example_reviews: Great Food and very big portions‚Ä¶ Amazing service and very good prices.üòãüòãüòã Very nice traditional location I‚Äòll vome back again

I had the pleasure of dining at Quan Que during my recent trip to Vietnam, and it was an experience I won't forget. Located in a charming part of town, this restaurant offers a perfect blend of traditional Vietnamese flavors and a cozy, inviting atmosphere. The staff were incredibly friendly and attentive, making sure our every need was met without being overbearing. The restaurant itself has a rustic, authentic feel, with wooden tables, lanterns, and beautiful decor that captures the essence of Vietnamese culture. As for the food, it was absolutely outstanding. We started with the Goi Cuon (fresh spring rolls) and Banh Xeo (Vietnamese pancakes), both of which were bursting with flavor and made with the freshest ingredients. The highlight of the meal was definitely the Pho ‚Äì a warm, aromatic bowl of noodles with a rich broth that had been simmering for hours. The balance of herbs, meat, and broth was perfect!

Came here tonight with some friends I‚Äôm travelling with and was served by Henry who was so sweet and had amazing service! Spent 210.000VND on a drink and main meal (just over $8), which is amazing value for the deliciously large portion of pineapple fried rice I enjoyed. Thank you Henry for giving us great recommendations- my friends really enjoyed the beef pancake dish which was showed to us how to properly eat it. I was so jealous, it looked so good! Overall great place for all demographics :)

name: Hanoi Coffee Culture
address: 45 Nguyen Huu Huan, Hanoi 100000 Vietnam
description: Hanoi Coffee Culture & Brunch serve variety of high quality coffee and brunch including Egg Coffee, Coconut Coffee and Big breakfast. It built in very beautiful old French colonial building background design.
example_reviews: This place has a really nice atmosphere and a light, accessible menu for when you feel like a break the deep-fried delights of Hanoi. We had two salted coffees, an americano, an avocado smoothie, peanut butter sourdough toast and a fruit salad breakfast bowl for 10 GBP. It√¢‚Ç¨‚Ñ¢s also right next to the home of the original Hanoi egg coffee.

A cute little spot with an upstairs air conditioned room if you need to escape the Hanoi heat, or a perfect people watching covered alley if you need to shelter from the rain. I visited twice during my visit to Hanoi, warmly welcomed and served by Chi on my second visit. The biggest draw for me was the Italian style coffee offerings (excellent latte) as a break from Vietnamese filter coffee. For those alternative milk hunters, oat milk is on offer. I also enjoyed the oat bowl (which again I think was made with a non-dairy milk). Whilst pricier than local-style coffee/breakfast offerings it was worth it.

Egg coffee is not what you may imagine. It was invented at the 5-star iconic Metropole Hotel in Hanoi when the French wanted a cappuccino and there was no milk. So, frothed egg whites, then frothed eggs, and finally frothed egg yolks were added to make a drink tasting like the best-ever tiramisu. This caf√É¬© has been confirmed to be the #1 choice for the best egg coffee ever. I agree!

name: Ozone Sky Lounge & Restaurant
description: Ozone Sky Lounge & Restaurant ‚Äì Hanoi‚Äôs Most Stunning Rooftop Escape! ‚ú® Perched on the 10th floor in the heart of the Old Quarter, Ozone is the only rooftop bar boasting an unbeatable view of the iconic St. Joseph Cathedral‚Äîa breathtaking backdrop for unforgettable moments. Savor delicious cuisine, from gourmet bites to authentic Vietnamese flavors, paired with creative cocktails, fine wines, or artisanal coffee. Dive into relaxation in our outdoor jacuzzi pool while soaking up Hanoi‚Äôs vibrant skyline. With live music weekly, the atmosphere is always electric‚Äîperfect for sunset cocktails, romantic dates, or lively gatherings. Whether you're here for afternoon tea, sunset drinks, or a night under the stars, Ozone offers a luxurious escape in the soul of Hanoi. Come for the view, stay for the vibe! #HanoiRooftop #SkyLounge #OzoneHanoi
example_reviews: We were looking for a place to chill out for about six hours until we caught a sleeper bus out of the city and we came across what turned out to be a little gem of a roof top pool bar which Included lockers and shower facilities . The bar is very smartly laid out with a cool design throughout and the seating is very comfortable. The food was absolutely gorgeous and the presentation was fit for the king of England himself ! Specifically, we had the duck, spring rolls, vegetable salad, pumpkin soup and crab fish cakes. The bar itself is great with a wide variety of drinks ! And finally, but certainly not least the bar staff themselves are very warm, welcoming and accommodating which made the whole experience what it was. which when I reflect on my experience at the bar it was simply outstanding and I hope to return or the very least I will recommend my friends and family that come to Hanoi to go and see how great it is for themselves. Big shout out to the bar staff particularly Sang, Vu, Dylan that made it so welcoming.

Staying in the hotel we had an afternoon at the Sky Lounge we enjoyed relaxing by the pool then day into evening had a few drinks and asked the lovely Chien could we eat from the dinner menu? Chien was so attentive and gave us a 5 star service with drinks and dinner. Nothing was too much trouble. A nice casual afternoon evening with amazing Mussels and wine, the largest I‚Äôve ever had! Chien made our experience the best, such a friendly great English speaking member of staff!

Excellent night! We had an incredible time! We will listen to the DJ again and have shots with Fiu, our waiter who treated us very well. If you come to Vietnam, spend a few hours at night having a few drinks and listening to music, highly recommended!!!

name: Hong Hoai's Restaurant
address: 20 Bat Dan, Hoan Kiem, Hanoi 100000 Vietnam
description: Welcome to Hong Hoai's Restaurant, a premier Vietnamese restaurant in the heart of Hanoi Old quarter . Celebrated for our authentic Vietnamese cuisine, we offer a diverse menu that highlights the rich flavors off Vietnam. At Hong Hoai's, we cater to all tastes with our extensive restaurant food selection, featuring hearty breakfast options, delicious lunch and dinner plates, and a variety of selectable vegetarian dishes. As a top choice among vegetarian restaurants, we delight both vegetarians and non-vegetarians alike. Experience the aromatic and intricate tastes of Vietnamese food at Hong Hoai's, where every dish is crafted to perfection. Join us for a memorable culinary journey that brings the essence of Vietnamese cuisine to your table.

example_reviews: Excellent restaurant in Hanoi!! We took nems to share as well as bun cha that we had to assemble ourselves in rice leaves (the waiter very kindly showed us how to do it), they were delicious!! Note that this restaurant is a bit more expensive than most restaurants in Hanoi, we got 6‚Ç¨ per person but it was really worth the cost. I recommend!!

Friendly and fast service. Fantastic Vietnamese food- rice paper spring rolls two different kinds of vegetarian with respective tofu and fried fish in with vegetables and delicious fresh herbs, soy dressing etc- the waiter showed us how, we had to fold them and they tasted heavenly. Clean and neat inside and outside a small terrace with rice paper lamps with light in one could also enjoy the view to the inside- on 1. Sal. Can highly recommend and almost a must

This place has lots of delicious gluten-free options, I was a pleasure to eat their Rice fried and their mango salad. name: La Capo Cafe
address: 48 P. L∆∞∆°ng Ng·ªçc Quy·∫øn, Hanoi Vietnam
description: A traditional vietnamese coffee shop with high service standard offering amazing drinks and experience in the Old Quarter, covering a huge range of drinks and brunch like egg coffee, coconut coffee, healthy smoothie bowl, sandwiches, fresh juice and so much more to discover. But which made us stood out from others is that we are happy to share with you informations and recipes in multiple languages. Please come and enjoy!
example_reviews: This cafe serves some delicious and affordable options for breakfast and brunch. This morning I tried their dragon fruit smoothie bowl, which was priced just at $3.50. The bowl was full of vibrant colors and flavors - the smooth dragonfruit puree was topped with crunchy granola, fresh fruit like mango and banana. It made for a healthy start to the day. This also has a relaxing, cozy ambiance and the service was friendly. Besides the smoothie bowl, they offer a range of coffee drinks, pastries, and other breakfast about $3 to $6. Overall, it's a nice spot to grab a quick but quality meal without breaking the bank. I'd recommend giving the smoothie bowl a try if you're in the area.

Cafe La Capo in Hanoi's charming Old Quarter is a little slice of heaven. The staff is incredibly friendly and welcoming, always going the extra mile to ensure customers feel right at home. The cozy, intimate atmosphere and beautifully presented Vietnamese specialties make this cafe a must-visit destination for anyone exploring the city.

This cafe exudes a welcoming atmosphere, adorned with rustic decor and soothing music. The baristas showcase expertise, delivering aromatic coffee creations and delectable pastries. Despite its popularity, seating can be limited, prompting potential wait times. The efficient and friendly staff, coupled with a diverse menu, make it a charming destination for coffee enthusiasts seeking a cozy experience.

name: The Moose & Roo Smokehouse
address: 21 19, Hai Ba Trung Street Inside the American Club, Hanoi 10000 Vietnam
description:
Moose & Roo Smokehouse is a regular go to for our elementary school birthday parties & play dates. They have a hard surface basketball court; sand pit for volleyball; a nice playground with swings & soft floor; a football/soccer pitch/field that used to be dirt but is now turfed for all-weather play.

We are very excited!

We went the other day to watch the World Cup & they put two different games on for us (US v. Portugal; Vietnam v. Netherlands). We had a blast.

They have a kids menu & will also make kids portions from the options on main menu. Enough vegetarian options for us.

Staff is always helpful & obliging.

The turfing of the field is a real positive game changer as our son loves to chase a ball around rain or shine.

Everyone enjoyed their meal. We had a chicken burger (3 layers of chicken), a chicken avocado wrap (lots of avocado and chicken) and a club sandwich. Fries and smoothie great too. And huge TV screens to watch the Aus Open tennis!

Our friends took us here while we visited town and said that their chicken wings were really good. They definitely were right. We had their sausages as well and it was also very good, a little bit peppery for my taste but that‚Äôs just personal taste! Will 100% recommend to my friends back home!

example_reviews: Incredible experience. Staff is knowledgeable about food, wine and general hospitality and provides personalised service. 10/10 would recommend the indulgence menu, great quality for a reasonable price, and premium, tasty dishes.

We attended this outstanding establishment in September 2024. My partner and I had planned to elope in Sapa with our parents, however Typhoon Yagi had other plans for us and we instead got married in a forest outside of Hanoi. Scrambling for a place to celebrate our nuptials we emailed several restaurants including the French Grill. From our initial correspondence with the helpful Assistant Manager Ms Nga Nguyen onwards, our experience was nothing less than magical. Ms Nga Nguyen was completely sympathetic of our change in wedding plans and the entire team at the French Grill went out of their way to make our evening as seamless and special possible, including arranging a beautiful flower arrangement for our table even though the restaurant does not typically use flowers as part of their d√©cor. We secured the Burgundy Room, a semi-private dining area that suited our needs perfectly. One of our party is vegetarian and had a delectable six course dining experience which was delivered and explained with as much care and thoughtfulness as the Indulgence Menu, chosen by the rest of us. We were served by the knowledgeable and charming Kian who was respectful of our need for privacy but equally seemed to be able to anticipate our every need and answer our every query with professionalism, grace and consideration, and even managed to delight and surprise us multiple times during the evening with his thoughtfulness. Kian, we wish you all the best with your career as a sommelier and have no doubt that you will be successful in all that you aspire to do. On to the food. Frankly, I was concerned that our parents would feel out of place and ill at ease with "fancy French food" that was completely unfamiliar to them. I need not have worried. My 79 year father has told us (and everyone he knows) repeatedly that the meal he had at the French Grill was the best he has had in his life and easily the highlight of his 2024 (even more so than presiding over our marriage ceremony in a the forest which was pretty spectacular). The Snow Crab was a real favourite on the table and each plate appeared more stunning and show-stopping than the dish before. There is a chocolatier on site and although we were all stuffed to the gills by the end of the night, the team brought us a selection of goodies as a parting gift and we all seemed to be able to make room for the deliciousness that followed - we cannot recommend trying the chocolate strongly enough. A huge thanks to the entire kitchen staff at the French Grill for a meal of a lifetime, unfortunately we did not have the foresight to ask for any names for our review (which we did not really intend to write as we never do, but thought the French Grill deserves all the public gratitude it can get). Overall, our night at the French Grill was so incredibly memorable and perfect. Budding photographer Nga Nguyen took some lovely photographs of our group and called us a taxi as we sadly said goodbye; she made us feel truly cared from from start to finish. We must thank mother nature for changing our destiny as we would not have had the pleasure at dining at this truly special establishment if our wedding had gone ahead as we had planned.

We enjoyed a family celebration at the French grill and absolutely loved it. The hostess, manager, waitresses and bartender were all amazing, bringing a small cake while singing happy birthday and making fun special mocktails for the table. The filets were ridiculous and the kids loved the lobster bisque and fresh bread with various butters! Thanks for a memorable night during our stay at the JW Marriott!

name: Cha Ca Thang Long
address: 21 Duong Thanh Street Old Quarter, Hoan Kiem, Hanoi Vietnam
description: Be careful as google maps points you a different restaurant. The proper one is at 6B Duong Thanh Street. I have to give a mixed review because the food was good despite being ripped off. We ordered as a couple 2 off the cha ca dishes at 140,000 VND dong each plus 2 Hanoi beers at 30,000 VND but we were charged the set menu which includes spring rolls at 176,000 VND each. This was also the only restaurant in our entire Vietnam trip to charge an additional 8% VAT so we ended up paying 455,000 VND in total. Note also this restaurant only takes cash. I also felt that we were short served as we ordered two serves of cha ca which came out in a single pan but we would be lucky to have 5 small pieces of fish each (can barely see the fish under the veges). However, the meal itself was very tasty. So overall I feel that this place takes advantage of tourists especially if you can't speak Vietnamese.

If you're in Hanoi and looking to indulge in one of the city's most iconic dishes, Ch·∫£ C√° ThƒÉng Long is a must-visit! This cozy, family-owned restaurant specializes in Ch·∫£ C√°, a traditional Vietnamese dish featuring grilled fish served with fresh herbs, peanuts, and rice noodles. From the moment you walk in, you‚Äôre greeted by the sizzling aroma of fish being grilled right in front of you. The fish is tender, slightly crispy on the outside, and beautifully flavored with turmeric and dill, creating the perfect balance of taste. It‚Äôs served with a variety of fresh herbs, bean sprouts, and peanuts to add crunch and freshness to each bite. The portion size is generous, making it a great value for the price. The staff is friendly and quick, adding to the warm and welcoming atmosphere of the restaurant. If you‚Äôre in the mood for an authentic taste of Hanoi, Ch·∫£ C√° ThƒÉng Long won‚Äôt disappoint. It‚Äôs a quintessential Vietnamese experience that lives up to its reputation and then some!

Nice restaurant in the historic center of Hanoi, with tables outside and inside. As soon as we arrived it was very crowded but (even though we had a reservation) we were able to sit immediately on the first floor. The staff did not speak English very well, they presented us with the (basic) menu, asking us if we agreed to order 2 sets of menus. Without really understanding what they included, we took the plunge and asked for spring rolls too. The setting was immediately prepared for us, with different sauces, herbs and noodles to accompany the main course, which was served in a convivial pan placed in the center of the table, on a small stove used to complete the dish at the table. We were also shown how to compose the dish (lightly breaded fish fillets, with dill and other vegetables) using the ingredients previously brought to the table. All very pleasant and light, the spring rolls served separately were simply fabulous!! Extremely appropriate and low bill compared to European standards (‚Ç¨18 for two with drinks, water and Pepsi). Ideal for a taste of Vietnamese cuisine in an authentic, no-frills venue. For a quick meal! Advised!

name: Don Duck Old Quarter Restaurant
address: 29 B√°t ƒê√†n Hang Bo, Hanoi 100000 Vietnam
description: The Don Duck old quarter restaurant providing Different Ducks& Duck dishes. We also serving special Vietnamese traditional meal and hot-pot and western food. With more than 20 years of experience in customer service we guarantee we bring Fresh, healthy product to served our customers. Visit us for an experience of duck dishes
cuisines: German Restaurants for Lunch in Hanoi
example_reviews: We heard that Don Duck 2 in the old quarter was highly recommended and had their version of a Michelin star so we went there with high expectations, and we were not disappointed. Whilst the restaurant is small and on multiple levels it is best to book your table before arriving as even in the early evening the restaurant was packed. As the name suggests it specialises in duck based dishes but does still cater for those who wish to dine on something else. As a lover of duck dishes I tried their Duck spring rolls and was blown away at how good they were followed by Grilled duck on the table whilst N chose a chicken dish with rice which she thoroughly enjoyed. Finally whilst the food and service was exceptional the cost was significantly lower than one would expect from a Michelin star restaurant with main, (duck), courses starting from as little as 155,000dong.

Going off google reviews we found Don Duck‚Ä¶ wasn‚Äôt disappointed.. good to see a restaurant specialising in one product and doing it 100%. Small aircon eating area downstairs, more seating upstairs. Staff were exceptional. Drinks cold and well priced - due to being busy they have us complimentary spring rolls while we waited. It was only a 10 min wait.

Our family had the pleasure of dining at Don Duck Old Quarter Restaurant in Vietnam, and it was an experience to remember! We ordered a variety of dishes including the Crispy Duck Spring, 1 1/4 Roasted Duck, Stir Fried Chicken, Vietnamese Beef Steak, and Seafood Fried Rice. Each dish was fantastic, bursting with authentic flavors and cooked to perfection.The Roasted Duck, in particular, was a standout‚Äîtender, juicy, and wonderfully seasoned. The Crispy Duck Spring was a delightful start to our meal, and the Vietnamese Beef Steak was a delicious twist on a classic. The Stir Fried Chicken and Seafood Fried Rice were also excellent, perfectly complementing the rich flavors of the duck dishes.Our meal was accompanied by refreshing drinks: Watermelon Juice, Lemon Juice, Coke, Orange Juice, and Lavie Water, which paired well with the food and added to the overall enjoyment of our lunch.The ambiance of the restaurant is warm and welcoming, making it a great spot for a family meal. The staff were attentive and provided excellent service throughout our visit.We highly recommend Don Duck Old Quarter Restaurant for anyone looking to enjoy authentic and delicious Vietnamese cuisine. It‚Äôs a must-visit if you‚Äôre in the area!

name: Ding Doong Restaurant
address: 18-20 P. Nh√† Chung Grand Hotel du LAC, Hoan Kiem, Hanoi 100000 Vietnam
description: Beautiful view of the St. Joseph Church. Great live Violin & Guitar perfomance. Looking for a private and intimate dining experience for your special occasions or business meetings? Ding Doong Restaurant has got you covered with our private dining room that can accommodate up to 20 guests. With a comfortable and stylish setting, it is ideal for small gatherings, parties and events. From birthday celebrations to corporate dinners, our private dining room is equipped with everything you need to make your occasion special. Book now for an unforgettable dining experience.
cuisines: Street Food Restaurants in Hoan Kiem
Fast Food Restaurants in Hoan Kiem
review_summary:
Ding Doong Restaurant has earned rave reviews for its exceptional service, with many diners noting the staff's attentiveness and professionalism. The vibrant atmosphere, enriched by live music and cozy decor, complements the beautiful city vistas, particularly the view of St. Joseph's Cathedral.

Patrons love the fresh, perfectly prepared dishes, lauding the authentic Vietnamese flavors with a modern twist. Furthermore, the value for money at Ding Doong is often highlighted, with guests appreciating the combination of superb service, high-quality cuisine, and the inviting ambiance.
example_reviews: Beautiful atmosphere with a rooftop view of Hanoi. We arrived early, before 6:30 and witnessed a magnificent sunset. The service was very pampering and attentive. Every dish was well done and very appealing. We had the chef salad and for dishes- the grilled chicken and the salmon. The prices are much higher than typical Vietnamese restaurants, but for the food, service and location, it is worth it. Would recommend!

The staffs were very accommodating especially Eric and Emma. And I would like to thank all the other staffs who made the special notes for my mom ‚ô•Ô∏è The food was delicious. The serving was big and the ambiance of the restaurant was very amusing as you can see the cathedral.

What an incredible dining experience! The restaurant has a lovely atmosphere that‚Äôs perfect for any occasion, whether it‚Äôs a casual dinner or a celebration. The staff were incredibly polite and went above and beyond to make sure we had everything we needed. The food was absolutely delicious‚Äîevery dish was prepared to perfection, with the flavors perfectly balanced and ingredients that tasted incredibly fresh. I was especially impressed with the attention to detail in presentation. The portion sizes were just right, leaving us satisfied but not overstuffed. It‚Äôs clear that a lot of care and passion go into every aspect of this restaurant.

name: L√° L·ªët Vietnamese Cuisine & Wine
address: 61 L∆∞∆°ng Ng·ªçc Quy·∫øn, Ho√†n Ki·∫øm T·∫ßng 3, Hanoi 11000 Vietnam
description:
The first time I came here, I had a good impression from the name to the food. The restaurant space has a creative bar design with lighting through cups, the color space is soft, but the lighting is not right at each table position, the dishes are decorated. Beautiful decoration, beautiful ceramics, but the spotlight is evenly lit so it can't be turned on. Because the light is even, not focusing on the table, taking photos of people or dishes often ends up in shadows.
Regarding the service, you guys are gentle, enthusiastic, very nice, but the dishes don't seem to be in the right order, the main dish comes before the soup, so you should add them gradually in order so that the dishes don't get cold and the eating experience will be better. will be better.
Regarding drinks, the fizz leaf juice is delicious, and the apricot tea, I think, should be less of the tea flavor so the apricot flavor will be clearer.
Regarding the food, most of the dishes are very delicious, I really like them (mushroom soup, beef rolled in lolot leaves, lentil fish). The remaining rambutan salad with onions made it a bit too pungent for me, the beef taste of the bland dish made the pungent taste even more obvious. The pork banh mi dish has a strong bread taste, so the color of the lolot leaf flavor is not strong, and the flavor of the dish is not clear.
Today is my birthday so I should write a bit long. I am satisfied with my experience at the shop. I wish the shop to develop better!

The restaurant serves mainly Vietnamese dishes at affordable prices. Enthusiastic and attentive service staff, worthy of 10 points for service quality. cuisines: Fast Food Restaurants in Hoan Kiem
Street Food Restaurants in Hoan Kiem
example_reviews: L‚Äôessence de cuisine is a good spot to go for dinner, but I‚Äôm not sure it deserves to be ranked as one of the best in Hanoi. I don't specifically have anything bad to say - the food just didn‚Äôt blow me away. The service was very good, the ambience was nice and the presentation of each dish was carefully thought out. However, I don‚Äôt believe it should be ranked in the top 5 of the city. I did not feel that the food on the couples tasting menu was that memorable or flavourful enough to justify the price. It was definitely tasty, but not super unique. They are always looking to improve so I‚Äôm sure that this restaurant can work it‚Äôs way up to be a top location in Hanoi.

Had a wonderful dinner at L‚Äôessence de la Via Cuisine. The food was absolutely delicious ‚Äî every dish full of flavour and beautifully presented. The cocktails were expertly made and really added to the experience. What stood out most was the exceptional service ‚Äî the waiting staff were warm, attentive, and made us feel so welcome throughout the evening. Highly recommend this place for a special night out. Top marks all around!

On our last evening in Vietnam we went to eat at this place, hoping to end on a high note. Instead, despite the pleasant environment, we ate poorly, in fact we almost didn't eat, because after the first tastes we didn't like the food. Unfortunately, our evening was ruined, because we had no alternatives for that evening, we didn't trust ourselves to go, at a late hour, to another random restaurant in the center of Hanoi, and so we were left disappointed and fasting. My husband gave it a negative review. This fact and this unpleasant situation cannot be erased. However, after a few days, when we had already returned home to Italy, the owner, not present on the evening of dinner, refunded us the bill paid, after having been asked, through the email with which we had booked, for the data banking. Making mistakes in the kitchen, or in the dining room, can sometimes happen, and it has already happened even in the best restaurants. Fully refund the amount paid, days later and 13,000 km later. It had never happened to me before. Compliments. It seems right to me to also review this correct behavior.

name: The Rhythms Restaurant
address: 33 - 35 Hang Dau 7th Floor, Hoan Kiem, Hanoi 100000 Vietnam
description: Our restaurant concept is formed in harmony with the rhythms of the King‚Äôs Symphony, showcasing an orchestra of Vietnamese authentic cuisine embellished with the grandeur of royal ambience. The blending of sophisticated Western architecture with local heritage has created a beautiful melody, expected to touch the emotion of guests and take them on a unique sensory journey.
cuisines: Street Food Restaurants in Hoan Kiem
Fast Food Restaurants in Hoan Kiem
Italian Restaurants for Lunch in Hoan Kiem
Pizza for Lunch in Hoan Kiem
example_reviews: The Rhythms did not disappoint with its warm and classy atmosphere, and the excellent dishes in the Vietnamese set and Signature set will surely satisfy the discerning diners‚Äô taste buds. To top that off, our server Katie was most friendly, knowledgeable and very attentive, making our dining experience a most enjoyable event. Highly recommended.

We had a wonderful experience at The Rhythms (33‚Äì34 H√†ng D·∫ßu, Hanoi) celebrating our 1st wedding anniversary. The restaurant thoughtfully decorated our table and provided very attentive service, making our special day even more memorable. Prices were reasonable, and the atmosphere was cozy with a perfect amount of space between tables, ensuring privacy and comfort. Special thanks to H·∫±ng (Katie), who was extremely dedicated and caring throughout the evening. She made sure everything was perfect for us. The food was delicious, beautifully presented, and full of flavor. We highly recommend The Rhythms to couples and families looking for a lovely place to dine and celebrate special moments!

It's like going for dinner on the last day of our trip to Hanoi. I ordered a Vietnamese course and steak here. The course meal was more delicious than expected and the portion was sufficient. The steak I ordered was served after the course meal and before dessert. Perhaps because I was full after the course meal, the steak was not as tasty as I expected. There was little Maillard on the surface of the meat. I especially ordered T-bone, but the tenderloin was so small that I thought it was l-bone. The steak was cooked the way I wanted it to be, but it was a little disappointing, but I enjoyed it. Dessert wasn't that great. I think it would be better not to eat it. The server in charge of us treated us kindly, which left us with a good memory. I would like to visit again next time if I have the chance.

name: The Hudson Rooms - Capella Hanoi
address: 11 Le Phung Hieu Rooftop Capella Hanoi, Hoan Kiem, Hanoi 100000 Vietnam
description: Imbibe a taste of exploration and optimism at the top of Hanoi Savour the boldest period-inspired flavours on our rooftop, tinged with the golden-pink hues of sunlight. Inspired by a renaissance of travel in the 1920‚Äôs, we transpose a golden era into the contemporary for your indulgence. Each encounter is infused with a sense of provenance and charm, from the finest selection of oysters and caviar that transport you to the sea, to hand-wrapped cigars and the finely crafted glasses our whiskey and artisanal cocktails are presented in.
cuisines: Fast Food Restaurants in Hoan Kiem
Street Food Restaurants in Hoan Kiem

example_reviews: We came to dine with friends in Saigon, I always appreciate Hudson's service. Today, serving the private room is Mai An, enthusiastic and always taking care of guests. The space is comfortable and spacious. Food is not controversial, always diverse and very beautiful. The price is suitable for the restaurant's location, food quality and decoration space. There is nothing to criticize. Highly recommend.

A very sophisticated and stylish set up from the furnishings, menu, staff uniforms and facilities. As soon as you walk in you know you‚Äôre in for a treat. During happy hour between 5.30pm and 7.30pm buy 1 for 1 free drink and oysters on flow. A feel great bar and many drinks to choose from

We stopped into The Hudson Rooms at the top of the Capella Hotel for drinks and a snack before dinner at Backstage. The top floor space is gorgeous as is the rest of the hotel. It is reminiscent of top floor lounges in Hong Kong. Service is sophisticated and high end. Our shrimp cocktail was five tiny shrimp for a healthy amount of money, but I expect to pay for such a swanky bar. Drinks were fine and equally as expensive. The Hudson Rooms is a special place in Hanoi. It is worth the cost for that extraordinary setting.

name: Au Lac Family Restaurant
address: 23 Ngo Huyen Hoan Kiem, Hanoi 100000 Vietnam
description: Well-located in the very heart of the Hanoi Old Quarter center, also near by Hoan Kiem lake, Hanoi Cathedral, Au Lac Family Restaurant is one of the best choices for Traditional Vietnamese Food

example_reviews: Great food. Staff was very friendly and hospotable service. Superb experience overall.Affordable cost and the chicken curry with cocounut milk was very filling and tasty and the spice level was optimal making me eat stomachful.

Fantastic restaurant where the food tastes heavenly. We ate two people each 1 starter and 1 main course and were full. A starter costs about 70,000 vnd and 110,000 vnd. Drank a cold beer for 30,000. The staff is super friendly and will be happy to change the menu if you have an allergy to something or you just don't want it. For example Cilantro. The restaurant is larger than it can be seen from the road, there are several tables in the room at the back. Definitely worth a visit.

Delicious and fun dinner with my friends. We arrived when the restaurant was very crowded, the atmosphere was bustling with many people coming from everywhere. He welcomed us very warmly even though he was very busy, the food was really fresh and delicious and quite filling ( banana salad, fish tomato, chicken cashew ‚Ä¶) we promised him to recommend this place

description: ‚Ä¢ MICHELIN Bib Gourmand 2024 ‚Ä¢ A premium Vietnamese restaurant with modern "Indochine" architecture located in the heart of Hanoi, just 3 minutes walking from The Hanoi Opera House - With the well-known Chef Madame B√¨nh from the best 5 stars hotel in Hanoi.

example_reviews: We visited Luk Lak Restaurant in Hanoi after seeing it recommended in the Michelin Guide with a Bib Gourmand distinction. The location is convenient, right near the Opera House, and the restaurant itself is spread across three nicely decorated floors, creating a pleasant and welcoming ambiance. The menu offered an impressive range of dishes, with photos and detailed English descriptions to make ordering easy. The staff were lovely‚Äîvery friendly and attentive, adding to the positive atmosphere. For our meal, we chose the following: ‚Ä¢ Cua L·ªôt S·ªët Me Cu·ªën B√°nh Tr√°ng: Deep-fried soft-shell crab wrapped in rice paper with fresh herbs and seasonal vegetables, served with tamarind sauce. ‚Ä¢ G√† N∆∞·ªõng T√∫ L·ªá: Grilled chicken with lime leaves, accompanied by sticky rice from Tu Le and special house-made sauces. ‚Ä¢ V·ªãt Ch√°y T·ªèi: Pan-seared boneless duck with garlic from Ly Son, Thai basil, and pickled bamboo shoots. The portions were generous, and the presentation was good. However, the flavours didn‚Äôt quite meet our expectations. The lime leaves in the grilled chicken were almost imperceptible, and while the duck dish was better, it wasn‚Äôt particularly memorable. Overall, we were a bit underwhelmed given the restaurant‚Äôs reputation. It‚Äôs worth a visit for the ambiance and service, but the food might not leave a lasting impression. (Also posted to my food blog on Instagram @AbbeyKing16)

Luk Lak is a clear step above the average local restaurant without being significantly more expense. We enjoyed it so much the first time we dined there that we came back a couple of nights later. The room is well presented with a reasonable amount of space between the tables and we found the food delicious.

The restaurant spans three colonial-style floors, each exuding a nostalgic Indochine charm. The first floor houses a cozy caf√©, while the upper levels provide spacious dining areas adorned with custom paintings celebrating Vietnamese heritage. Guided by Chef Madame Binh, who brings over 25 years of experience from Sofitel Legend Metropole Hanoi, the menu is a testament to Vietnam's rich culinary diversity. Dishes are crafted using regionally sourced ingredients, ensuring both authenticity and freshness. As Asians we enjoyed the restaurant so much that we returned the next day. Highly recommend the Stuffed Pigeon with Sticky Rice, where tender pigeon meat is combined with sticky rice, wrapped in lotus leaves, and grilled with five-spice seasoning, resulting in a flavorful and aromatic dish. The Nem L·ª•i Hu·∫ø was also good. The Nem ·ªêc H√† N·ªôi must have been unqiue but we took the soft-shelled crab spring rolls instead. I believe they have the d·ªìi huy·∫ø, blood sausage but we were already too stuffed. The Restaurant offers an impressive wine list that rivals those of many top-tier establishments, yet at more accessible prices. Their selection encompasses a variety of sparkling, white, ros√©, and red wines. I found some not so big names ones like Damilano Barbera d'Asti DOCG which i definitely recommend with the meats.

name: Top of Hanoi
address: 67 floor, 54 Lieu Giai Street, Ba Dinh District Lotte Hotel Hanoi, Hanoi 10000 Vietnam
description: Through many reviews from friends, we decided to come and experience at Top of Hanoi. With outdoor and overhead space, the shimmering city appeared, making us extremely excited. The band performed wonderfully with songs of many different styles. Notably, the drink menu is quite rich and diverse, suitable for young people. In addition, Mr. Bao (Top of Hanoi Manager) is very attentive, from menu advice to seating suggestions to help us have a better experience. Next time, we will come back for more delicious food and drinks.

A must visit place for the view after sunset. The place is on the 67th floor with an open roof. You can go to the 67th floor after touring the sky observatory deck. However once you‚Äôve gone to the top of Hanoi you aren‚Äôt allowed to come back down to the sky observatory. Really loved the Vietnamese techno being played there. The live music band is also good and playing a lot of jazz versions.

Very special place with a beautiful view of the city of Hanoi. You can have dinner at the Poano restaurant downstairs and then you can go to the terrace to have a drink and see Hanoi from above. name: Hanoi Fusion Pub & Restaurant
address: 54 Nguyen Truong To, Hanoi 10000 Vietnam
description: Welcome to Hanoi Fusion Pub & Restaurant, a charming and cozy restaurant nestled in a narrow tube house at the edge of the old quarter of Hanoi. This unique eatery aims to cater primarily to tourists, providing you with an unforgettable culinary experience that combines the best of local traditional flavors and well-selected Western delights. At Hanoi Fusion Pub & Restaurant, we take pride in showcasing the rich tapestry of Vietnamese cuisine, offering tourists the chance to savor authentic local & fusion dishes that embody the essence of Hanoi's culinary heritage. From steaming bowls of pho, vibrant fresh spring rolls, and flavorful banh mi sandwiches to delectable Vietnamese desserts, our menu takes guests on a culinary journey through the heart of Vietnam's food culture. While we celebrate traditional Vietnamese food, we also understand the cravings of travelers who miss the taste of home after spending a long time away. To cater to their nostalgia, we have thoughtfully curated a selection of Western favorites like wood-fired pizzas, mouthwatering spaghetti, and a delightful assortment of Western wines and craft beers. Our fusion dishes, such as expertly grilled fish and tender beef creations, are the perfect harmony of local and international flavors, crafted by our skillful chefs. Hanoi Fusion Pub & Restaurant is more than just a restaurant; it's a celebration of cultural exchange through food. The narrow tube house setting adds to the restaurant's charm, immersing guests in a cozy and intimate atmosphere where they can relax, share stories, and make memories. Whether you're a tourist eager to explore Vietnamese cuisine or a traveler longing for a taste of home, our restaurant promises to be a gastronomic haven that delights the senses and nourishes the soul. Our passionate team is dedicated to providing warm hospitality, making each visitor feel welcome and cherished. Come and indulge in the flavors of Vietnam and beyond, as we invite you to slurp on comforting broths and savor every delectable bite, creating an unforgettable dining experiences.
cuisines: Late Night Asian Restaurants in Hanoi
example_reviews: What a fantastic experience at Hanoi Fusion. The food was absolutely beautiful and the service from Zo was exceptional. The restaurant itself is so inviting and perfectly laid out even with dining on a mezzanine floor. The prices were very good with a family of 4 having a huge feast and two rounds of drinks at a very low price. I cannot forget to mention the Hanoi special smoothie oh so good! We will definitely come back when we return to Hanoi in a few days. We are so pleased our Tour Guide Quan mentioned this restaurant to us.

We had a lovely meal at Hanoi Fusion! We tried the seafood pasta and the tenderloin steak‚Äîboth were absolutely delicious and beautifully presented. The seafood was fresh and the steak was cooked to perfection. While the space itself is a bit small, the restaurant is spread across three floors. If you're willing to climb a few stairs, the top floor is definitely worth it. It offers a charming open-air dining experience with a great view of the street below, adding to the overall vibe. Highly recommend for a cozy yet flavorful dining experience in Hanoi! Would you like it written in a more casual or humorous tone?

We came here through a friend's recommendation, the food and drinks here are very delicious and the prices are reasonable. The cozy space is very suitable for those who like quiet, the staff is friendly, enthusiastic and cheerful. We will definitely come back.

name: Ti·ªám M·ª≥ Ti√™n S∆°n - Noodles And Dimsum
address: 2 Ngo Huyen , Hang Trong, Hanoi Vietnam
description: The noodles here are hand-pulled flat noodles, beef and duck stewed with herbs for 6 hours. You can feel the toughness of the non-fried fresh noodles, the frugal taste of herbal medicines, beef, and duck that are soft but not broken, marinated with the fruity spices after 4 hour stewing. Beside of that, we also have several choices of Dimsum and buns to pair with for your full dinner. Dimsum is fresh made everyday not like the ones in supermarket. The restaurant is located in a hustle and bustle area called Ngo Huyen, which intersects with Ly Quoc Su Street. Coming to Ngo Huyen, you will easily find the restaurant with our eye-catching red lanterns and red LED signage.
cuisines: German Restaurants for Lunch in Hanoi
example_reviews: My husband and I passed by this unassuming restaurant in a small back street and decided to stop in for dinner. I can not emphasize enough how incredible our meal was. We ordered duck leg noodle soup and fried rice with duck leg and an egg. The noodles were firm and chewy as home made noodles should be. The broth was complex with a depth of flavour that can only be achieved from hours of simmering. And the duck was tender and delicious. The sauce on the duck leg combined with the fried rice and the jammy egg made each bite perfection. We will definitely be back again. This is one restaurant not to be missed.

Best food I‚Äôve had in H√† N·ªôi! Tucked down a cosy alley near the cathedral, this place is a real find. The food looked gorgeous and was delicious, with all the condiments you‚Äôd expect on the table if, like me, you want to ramp up the chilli as you eat‚Ä¶ Friendly staff, easy ordering, great prices, and the music was brilliant, too. Perfect lunch!

Great food with affordable price. We tried the noodles and dimsum as well, both are fresh, rightly flavored. The service was 10/10 i believe, the servers were gentle, responsive. The location is easy to reach, right in the heart of the Old Quaters, definitely recommend this place for both local people and tourists

name: Xofa Caf√© & Bistro
address: 14 T·ªëng Duy T√¢n H√†ng B√¥ng, Hanoi 100000 Vietnam
description: Xofa Cafe was hatched from such simple wishes and is connecting souls with a desire to deliver it‚Äôs customers' heartwarming experiences. Like a soft and gentle sofa, we want to bring friends together and closer . Your smiles and joys are our rewards. If there is anything that makes you feel uncomfortable, please leave us a message and we'll try to make your next visit even more comfortable. Love,
cuisines: German Restaurants for Lunch in Hanoi
example_reviews: What a charming spot in hustling Hanoi!! The place is inviting and the food is simply outstanding! Everything we tried was of superior quality, fresh and flavorful. We had pasta and some cakes for dinner. Lovely coconut coffee and great service!!

The cafe appears to be very popular and was almost full when I was there. It serves regular cafe food and the decor, reminiscent of a cabin in the woods, provides a relaxing atmosphere. I ordered an almond milk, which came unsweetened and grainy. I guess the latter indicates it's made fresh? Staff were very polite and helpful. Not a bad place to rest your feet.

An oasis of calm in the otherwise frenetic Hanoi old quarter, we loved the spinach pancakes and fries. We sat on the balcony overlooking a shaded courtyard and took advantage of the excellent WiFi. Service was swift and friendly.

name: Mizumi Westlake - Sushi, Teppanyaki & Sky Lounge
address: 51 Xuan Dieu street Floors 13 - 15. Tower B - Fraser Suites Hanoi, Hanoi 10000 Vietnam
description: Mizumi is the only modern Japanese restaurant in Hanoi that offers all 3 dining styles: Omakase, Teppanyaki and A la carte, each style offering completely different experiences. In addition, diners coming to Mizumi can enjoy the "view" embracing West Lake on Sky Lounge, located on the rooftop of the restaurant, adorning the journey of enjoying modern Japanese cuisine, which would definitely elevate the culinary scenes in Hanoi. Mizumi pioneered modern Japanese cuisine, different from traditional cuisine. Modern Japanese cuisine at Mizumi is expressed through the skillful combination of traditional & premium ingredients of the country of rising sun, with ingredients and rich culinary flavors of the Western cultures. Mizumi hope that we could deliver both diversity and uniqueness in terms of cuisine, experience space and quality of service to Hanoian customers.
cuisines: South American Restaurants for Lunch in Hanoi
example_reviews: For me, the best Japanese restaurant in Hanoi. The view over Westlake is breathtaking. The restaurant is really high end and luxury but the price is very good value for money. They have Omakase, Teppanyaki, A la carte as well. Our bill was $100 for 2 people (we order a la carte) including drink and we were super happy with such a beautiful experience. Service here they follow Forbes Standards and this is the only standalone restaurant in Vietnam is doing so (What the manager shared with us). I have a look at Lunch menu and prices are even more attractive, $11 for a lunch set as I remember, definitely need to come and try next time.

I get to know this place from a sharing from you tube . Since I plan to visit Hanoi I decison to visit this place. Is Amusing I was luck to serve by waiter Mark .He's very observant always attend to my need and chef Tuan is amusing he not only cook well for me he also provide some Entertainment Show out the Serve process .He also make my lunch experience with Good Memories. This meal is not cheap for the local but for Foreigner is Worth whlie to try . High recommend any one should come over Hanoi visit Mizumi to Experience the Fine dinner. I recommend come Lunch time is better U can enjoy the Full experience Chef Tuan can give u. See u soon .....

Amazing, authentic Japanese experience. The reception from the staff was incredibly friendly and every dish came with a description of what it consisted of and how it was made. The food was absolutely delicious, and there was plenty of it. We assumed that we would choose one selection from each category, as is normally the case, but the meal is actually everything on the chosen menu. A highly recommended experience.

name: The Hung Snake Restaurant
address: 161/64 Hoa Lam, Hanoi 10000 Vietnam
description:
Please come to our restaurant, you will see, play with snakes, you can eat snake dishes.
Our slogan is: Happiness first, money second so we promise and commit with you that if you are not happy and satisfied , you don‚Äôt have to pay.
P/S: If you come to the restaurant, please make a reservation in advance to make sure we have space as well as the right snake for you. Call me directly: +84 989331012 (Imessage and Whatapp)

Mr Dragon, the owner
cuisines: French Restaurants for Lunch in Hanoi
German Restaurants for Lunch in Hanoi
example_reviews: It was a great experience! The price was 50 USD for two people, including one bamboo snake and drinks (including alcohol). The owner, Dragon, was friendly and very charming. We were able to talk a lot about the restaurant and the food. Because it was a weekday, we were able to talk a lot with Dragon, so I recommend visiting on a weekday when it is not crowded with other customers!! First, you are asked to choose between a bamboo snake or a cobra (which is a little more expensive). Next, if you want, you can see the moment the snake is killed. You can also choose whether to drink the heart and blood. After that, you order a drink, and the dishes made with the snake you just killed are brought out one after another. ‚Ä¶ The taste is excellent. Depending on the cooking method, it tasted like chicken, fish, or eel white meat, so it was fun. By the way, Dragon likes dirty jokes. The serve is humorous and the atmosphere is somewhat mysterious. There is no other restaurant as wonderful as this! Eccentric!

An incredible experience. It is a little far from the center but it is worth experiencing. Mr. Dragon's treatment is unbeatable. He is always joking so that you have a good time but at the same time you can talk seriously with him. They have a Bamboo Snake or a King Cobra (the first one is cheaper than the second one). We opted for the first option and for the price we agreed upon, they served us the snake in 7 different ways (all of them delicious) and all the drinks we wanted. 100% recommended if you are in Hanoi, we loved it.

family reastaurant. kind workers. the owner (dragon) was very kind to show me the snakes served in the restaurant. if you come alone give a call to the owner to check if there is a dead snake already, otherwise, you need to pay for a whole one. great place to come with friends and great snake dishes!

example_reviews: Reccommended this stand by a local. Every time we went for lunch the que was at least 45 mins long. Finally we decided to go early for breakfast. Even then thr que was 20 mins but well worth the wait.

This Banh Mi is so good. Long line to order as the food is so yummy. Worth the wait! Been here numerous times. The bread roll is so fresh and crispy and the fillings are delicious. Our two favourites are Chicken and Pork. Mama is so sweet too, service with a smile. Must try!

example_reviews: Very nice ambience, cozy lighting. Charcoal barbecue at the table is awesome. We had the Wagyu set (USA) for two people (3*130 gr) and additionally ordered an Angus Ribeye (130 gr). Meat quality excellent, we found the best Wagyu pieces with higher fat content. Due to the ripening, the meat has a special taste - extremely delicious. Just add some salt and pepper and you're done. As a side dish we had a green salad, grilled vegetables and potato wedges and as starter fried dumplings. The quality of the side dishes was also top. We paid 90 ‚Ç¨ (including beer, water, cocktail), which is of course expensive for Vietnam but quite inexpensive for this enjoyment. Also the service was top. Our waiter Trinh has a very pleasant attentive nature and helped us with the barbecue (the meat is pre-grilled medium-rare and then finished grilling at the table grill according to taste). Conclusion: If you like to eat meat and want to treat yourself, this is the place for you.

Excellent place to eat grilled beef and pork. A great combination of cuts that serve with very delicious Korean tapas. The salads are very delicious too. The price is a little higher than the average of other restaurants; but it is well worth it for the quality of the meat, the combinations of sauces and different types of salts.

Dining at this Hanoi steakhouse is a world-class experience, unique in its charm. The quality of meat is exceptional, rivaling the best steakhouses globally. Their cocktails are a delightful journey in flavors, adding to the exquisite dining atmosphere. The staff strikes a perfect balance between attentiveness and discretion; they're not only highly professional and fluent in English but also intuitively responsive, ensuring comfort without intruding on your privacy. It's a place where culinary excellence meets impeccable service.

example_reviews: I had the pleasure of dining at RK Spice Indian Restaurant during my visit to Hanoi, and it was an experience worth every bite! Nestled in the vibrant Old Quarter, this restaurant serves some of the most authentic Indian food I‚Äôve had outside of India. The menu is extensive, offering a range of North Indian, South Indian, and Mughlai dishes. The flavors are rich and bold, with each dish prepared to perfection. I particularly enjoyed the golab jamun‚Äîan absolute treat! The butter chicken was creamy and delicious, and the naan was freshly baked, soft, and warm. One of the things that stood out to me was the simplicity of the restaurant. RK Spice isn‚Äôt about fancy interiors; it‚Äôs about delivering incredible food at reasonable prices. This approach has clearly resonated with diners, as the place was buzzing with both locals and tourists alike. The service was top-notch. The staff were friendly and knowledgeable, making sure our dining experience was enjoyable from start to finish. Whether you‚Äôre a fan of Indian food or someone looking to try something new, RK Spice should be at the top of your list when in Hanoi. If you‚Äôre in the Old Quarter and craving a taste of India, don‚Äôt miss out on this gem! This should provide a different perspective while highlighting the key features of your restaurant.

We came across this place when looking for an alternative to all the Vietnamese restaurants. The food was excellent, especially the many mutton dishes and the service was prompt and friendly. The owner, a cricket aficionado, was very attentive and keen to know what we thought of the food. We would certainly recommend this as a spicy and tasty alternative while in Hanoi.

I visited this restaurant last week and had an excellent experience. The food was delicious, full of authentic flavors, and made with fresh ingredients. The staff was friendly and welcoming, providing great service. Prices were very reasonable, making it a great value for money. If you're looking for tasty halal food in Hanoi, this place is a must-visit!

example_reviews: I was walking to eat at around 9pm on a weeknight, and I passed once, but went back and entered. The reason I decided to enter the restaurant was that it was clean from the outside. I travel alone a lot, so I have a lot to worry about when I eat, but the friendly staff here said, "There's a table in the back of the shop, which one would you rather have?" It was very impressive that he confirmed his intention. Even though I was a single guest, I was very grateful to be shown to a quiet back seat. He understands that I'm hot and adjusts the fan, and is very considerate. Order X√¥i H√†ng Qu√† for dinner. I ordered it without any prior knowledge, so I was curious about what kind of meal would be served, but it was a bowl of so-called sticky rice topped with meat, sausages and vegetables. Many restaurants around town have stiffer meats, but that hasn't changed here. The flavor is just right. The amount is also satisfactory to most people if it is an adult male. It may be a bit more for women. After the meal, order an additional Vietnamese coffee with salted cream. It tastes good in other cafes, but I was able to enjoy it well here. There's plenty of ice in there and there's no sense of cutting corners at all, which you see sometimes in Vietnam.

Hi, I'm Teresa from Singapore. Their salted coffee and sticky rice were delicious! The staff was approachable & friendly and I had a very nice chat with him (I forgot to ask for his name). They have a very adorable Corgi mixed Siberian Husky dog (Dom). Thank you for the very pleasant dining experience for my last night in Hanoi. Highly recommend this place! :)

Food and coffee was just amazing. The cafe is really cozy and friendly staff ;). The Bahn mi sandwich was simple but memorable. The rice combo dishes and chicken noodle soup are perfect light lunches.

description: Drop into Big Pig for delicious American style BBQ Ribs, Awesome Burgers, Steak & Pizza, along with yummy Vietnamese favorites like grilled seafood, rice & noodles, Big Pig also has a big selection of ice cold beers, cool cocktails, wine list and excellent western and Vietnamese coffee. Open for breakfast, fantastic lunch specials (from 99k+), hearty meals and late night drinks & snacks, the team at BIG PIG District 1 is ready to welcome you. Daily Happy Hour from 3-7pm! Our team speaks English well, and look forward to seeing you soon!
example_reviews: We had an amazing meal with entrees and main, the meals were very large serving and so tasty, the staff were amazing the drinks were cold the aircon was on and it was just a great experience. Highly recomend the pork belly bites, the ribs the steak and the garlic bread all the foods we had. Yum

We‚Äôre in Saigon on a school trip from the UK, two teachers with ten teenagers. The students asked for a mix of western and Vietnamese foods for dinner and we stumbled across The Big Pig which beat our expectations. Being such a big group we managed to reserve a table a couple of hours earlier. We had a warm welcome on arrival and we‚Äôre quickly offered food and drink menus. There was a great choice of food to keep everyone happy. The students told us the Smoothies were the best yet (and they‚Äôve had several from across the city!). The food was tasty with generous portions all came out fresh and hot from the kitchen. We had burgers, pizzas with a lot of side dishes and left with many clean plates - a huge sign of happy teenagers! Fab place for tasty food to please all tastes, and really well located right by the Siagon Skydeck, making our evening even easier. The staff were excellent always on hand to help and serve us quickly. Brilliant work.

Really professional friendly service, welcoming and polite showing my wife and I the full food menu and drinks menu before we were seated by Lewis who was brilliant ü§© Our waiter this evening was Le Nhu Y who was exceptional in his service. A friendly smile and a very warming personality who makes guests feel so welcoming. The restaurant is very spacious with a few levels. The beer was ice cold and the cheeseburger & fries was really nice reminding me of a good burger from back home,many thanks for your service üåüüåüüåüüåüüåü

The service was super friendly and efficient! When all the food came out it was all hot which is amazing for 6 burgers. Quan was super funny and friendly. Speaks English quite well so it made for good conversations and great service. Even gave us some recommendations to see in H√† N·ªôi. Even though we came quite late and close to closing time they didn‚Äôt rush us or degraded the food quality or service so we all really enjoyed it. The burgers were juicy and delicious and the the truffle chips are a MUST. Would recommend if you wanna change up from Vietnamese cuisine to some American styled burgers.

If you are traveling in the city and feel like burgers, you can eat here with pleasant and not too loud music. Personnel: I was served mainly by the very nice Mike, but can also say that the others were also very friendly and always had a smile on their lips. To the kitchen: I had a burger (fresh ingredients that you can also taste) with fries and dessert. In terms of taste and appearance, a recommendation from me. For the price: Although a bit more expensive (about 13‚Ç¨ incl. dessert and drink).

description: With 3 convenient, tasty & fun locations in D1, D2 & D7 Eddie‚Äôs Deli & Diner is Saigon's Favorite Authentically American Dining Experience since 2018. We pride ourselves on our Good Food, Warm & Friendly Service, Awesome Shakes, 1950‚Äôs Diner Vibe & Huge American Menu with something for everyone! All of our cuisine is made in house using the finest ingredients for that Real- American taste. So what‚Äôs on the Menu? All-day breakfast, mouthwatering burgers, hotdogs, and deli sandwiches including our famous Reuben, juicy steaks & chicken, salads, soup, apps, full vegetarian menu & even an American Chinese Menu. We bake our own cinnamon buns and pies too. Kid‚Äôs love Eddie‚Äôs and we have a full menu for the little ones. Our Satisfaction Guarantee makes Eddie's the perfect place to enjoy a little taste of home. Please Visit us at 73 Pasteur in D1 71 Thao Dien in D2 408 Pham Thai Buong in D7. example_reviews: I stayed at this restaurant with friends because we felt like a nice hamburger after days of local cuisine. The place is faithfully reminiscent of the American ones, the staff is welcoming and friendly. We tasted the classic burgers (very good) with chips and coke (you can refill the drink for free once you finish). We spent about 10/15 ‚Ç¨ each, including two desserts that surprised us particularly, given the loyalty with those eaten in America.

We looked up restaurants close by and Eddie's came on the scope. So we popped in for dinner and tried some burgers, what sensational burgers absolutely top class and the staff were attentive to our needs and happy to engage in friendly chat. We will definitely be back for more. Also the apple pie was the best. Our main man Tai who served us was the best.

Eddie‚Äôs is the real deal! Started by an American ex-patriot from Minnesota, it serves up fresh, authentic diner food in a casual atmosphere. Where else can you get a tuna melt in Saigon? Eddie‚Äôs serves breakfast all day, along with burgers, cheese steaks, fries, onion rings and even chicken parm! Yes, they make their own ice cream, too. Servers are fluent in English, so there‚Äôs no menu-pointing required to order your favorites. When you‚Äôre half a world away from Katz‚Äôs and craving a corned beef Reuben, Eddie‚Äôs is the place.

example_reviews: Fantastic experience! Phong was such an attentive host, we had 12 people in a group and he helped us choose what to have on the menu, and how to add the condiments! We had teens that are fussy eaters and he was patient and they ate majority of their food which was a win for us. Thanks Phong you are a legend!

Super Ph·ªü, delicious beef noodles soup with authentic favors. Great and inviting design, English speaking staff and helpful. We think this restaurant is new but best soup in town. A must-try soup shop.

The Ph·ªü T√°i LƒÉn was simply exquisite, with fragrant herbs and perfectly cooked noodles. The atmosphere felt nostalgic, reminiscent of traditional Vietnamese eateries. The staff made us feel at home, offering recommendations and sharing stories about the dishes. Plus, the complimentary parking was a nice bonus. We left with full stomachs and happy hearts, eager to come back for more!

description: Established in 2014, Nossa located in the heart of Saigon (opposite to five star New World Saigon hotel), NOSSA is a cozy & romantic restaurant featuring Western steak house and Italian cuisine. We offer a wide selection of chilled premium Australian Black Angus & Wagyu beef like striploin, tenderloin, ribeye, TBone and many choice of pasta, ri√≠otto & pizzas. To complement with the aforesaid statements, the restaurant comes with an bar counter at first floor, indoor and outdoor terrace at second floor with flower and candle. The restaurant is good for couple with romance ambience and businesses or family dinner with a private room.
example_reviews: After almost a fortnight in the Far East we were keen to eat something without rice! Found this atmospheric Italian restaurant about 100yards from the New World Hotel and were seated on the first floor balcony. Food was delicious with a couple of us having Lasagna and others fish served by delightful staff.

After two weeks on the road in Vietnam, we wanted something a bit different for dinner. We found this place online and decided to try it out. It was a great decision ! . Walking distance from our hotel, we went upstairs and sat outside to watch the happenings on the street. It's not too noisy and the weather was warm. The very nice waitress was with us in minutes and we ordered a glass of red and white house wine, a salad, and some pasta with prawns and a pizza. The salad was fantastic, the wine very good and the pasta and pizza as good as you'd get in Italy !! . The dinner was that good that we actually went BACK the following night for dinner and it was brilliant yet again ! Same waitress, very nice - and friendly service. . Around $80 Australian dollars for 2 and that included bottle of wine. . Highly recommend.

The restaurant was close to our hotel and after a long trip walking around the area looking for dinner. We both ordered pasta dishes finished off with the passion fruit panna cotta. The pasta was ok, the dessert very good. What warranted the rating was the attentiveness of the staff which makes all the difference.

example_reviews: I found the combination of dishes to be quite exquisite. I ordered the Filet Mignon aux Cepes here, and the tender beef fillet paired with fragrant mushroom sauce and creamy potatoes was a delightful experience. I would definitely come back.

This restaurant is within walking distance of the Pan Pacific across the bridge that has the John McCann Memorial. A little challenging to cross the streets closest to the Pan Pacific. It is on Tran Vu, the first street after the bridge to the left. Not a big place, probably very busy at night with the bar. We ate upstairs, very quaint. Food is excellent. The French onion soup & creme br√ªl√©e were outstanding. I had a special which was similar to a shepherd's pie but made with duck & it was delicious. My husband tried the lasagna - it was good but not what he would consider lasagna. We ate here a second time and had the hamburgers, really done well. It's not easy to find Western food in Hanoi.

The French Onion Soup and Duck Confit were very nice! The brownie was special. And, the olives were devine. My friends‚Äô Seafood Bisque was the best he has ever had and he is from New York City and Boston where the chefs take pride in their Seafood Bisque.

name: Carpaccio - Italian Restaurant
address: 79 Hai Ba Trung Street, District 1 Dong Khoi Area, Ho Chi Minh City 700000 Vietnam
description: Carpaccio - Authentic Italian Restaurant Since 2000s with 25 years brand history in Vietnam We are proud being the ambassador of Italian culinary culture, where you can immerse yourself in a refined experience from the charming yet romantic Venice. From the traditional pizza, the handmade pasta, to the classic Italian cocktails are greatly combined to create a cozy and intimate dining experience. Buon Appetito!
example_reviews: A very good indication is always if an Italian restaurant outside of Italy, has many Italian or native speaking Italian guests. Long story short: service, food, drinks ‚Äì summarized ‚Äì very good. You can spend a nice evening there in a relaxing atmosphere with good music in the background. Price - value is in a very good ratio

A trip to Italy even in these times is possible, no visa nor CoVid test required. This restaurant serves the very best of Italy: atmosphere, great flavours and dolce vita. The refreshing Aperol Spritz creates the first WoW, awesome al dente pasta, homemade minestrone, antipasti della casa follow before the main course. We love the pizze e calzone, also the grilled fresh tuna steak with olives, capers, oregano and tomato sauce. Prosecco sweetens our lunch before delicious Tiramisu and Panna Cotta with berries. Not to forget the sound of the typical Italian coffee machine producing worldclass espresso. Adriano Celentano & Monica Bellucci join us for the grappa and Amalfi coast limoncello... Viva l‚Äô Italia

Maybe the best Italian in town with homemade fresh pasta like linguine alla Sarda with fresh prawns, mussels in a slightly spicy tomato or white wine sauce. We love the original Napoli style pizze and the house special ravioli and truffle risotto. Feels like a trip to Italy üáÆüáπ despite travel restrictions! Cheers, btw their Aperol Spritz is fabulous, followed by delicious Panna Cotta or Tiramisu and iced Amalfi style Limoncello... buon appetito

name: Au Lac Do Brazil Nguyen Hue
address: 131 Nguyen Hue St, Ho Chi Minh City 700000 Vietnam
description:
Best place for meat lover and gymer üî•
Many types of Churrasco hot grilled meat flavored Brazil ingredients, free flow soft drinks
I had premium buffet with 1,250,000++ per person. More than 10 types of Churrasco, baked lobster with cheese, picanha, cupim, etc.
They also have samba performance at weekend, so perfect for group of friends and family. ALDB feasted so much fun ü•≥
example_reviews: Best place for meat lover and gymer üî• Many types of Churrasco hot grilled meat flavored Brazil ingredients, free flow soft drinks I had premium buffet with 1,250,000++ per person. More than 10 types of Churrasco, baked lobster with cheese, picanha, cupim, etc. They also have samba performance at weekend, so perfect for group of friends and family. ALDB feasted so much fun ü•≥

Good food but confused and maybe new (?) tableware. All tables had to ask for napkins and we did not get all the food we ordered, for example. If you want to eat a lot of good meat, you can go here, but no place that is memorable.
Go with my colleague on Friday, Set lunch is really tasty, decoration suitable for Brazilian style and nice music vibe.

name: Ph·ªü Vi·ªát Nam
address: 66 Tr·∫ßn Qu·ªëc To·∫£n, Ph∆∞·ªùng 8, Qu·∫≠n 3 163 Tran Nao Ward Binh An, Dist. 2, Ho Chi Minh City 700000 Vietnam
description:
Affordable price, i came and ask the staff if they accept card for payment but the staff cant speak english, so i need to wait until 1 staff come and talk to me, i think only one staff who can speak english. Order the one with hot stone, so we need to put by ourselves the noodles, meat and other vegetable into the hot stone fill with the soup. Because i not put all of them in one time, the soup not boil enough and my meat not cooked well, lol, so i ask the staff who can speak english to boil again my soup, and voila..they also adding my soup.

The taste really yummy, the meat so tender, the noodles also fresh and they give so many vegetables, the soup is super tasty, love it. The restaurant really crowd, but more guest come with family. The condiment available in the table and the drink (looks like tea) also avail in the table, free charge, free refill. I got trouble with my payment, but thanks for the cashier want to wait until the issued solved. The restroom also clean and provide westafel.
example_reviews: Affordable price, i came and ask the staff if they accept card for payment but the staff cant speak english, so i need to wait until 1 staff come and talk to me, i think only one staff who can speak english. Order the one with hot stone, so we need to put by ourselves the noodles, meat and other vegetable into the hot stone fill with the soup. Because i not put all of them in one time, the soup not boil enough and my meat not cooked well, lol, so i ask the staff who can speak english to boil again my soup, and voila..they also adding my soup. The taste really yummy, the meat so tender, the noodles also fresh and they give so many vegetables, the soup is super tasty, love it. The restaurant really crowd, but more guest come with family. The condiment available in the table and the drink (looks like tea) also avail in the table, free charge, free refill. I got trouble with my payment, but thanks for the cashier want to wait until the issued solved. The restroom also clean and provide westafel.

We found this place by accident, as it‚Äôs not centrally located and has such an unimaginative name. It was such a pleasant surprise, as this is undoubtedly among the best ph·ªü in Vietnam! Go for the house special; the delicious pho broth and cooked meat (which includes brisket and oxtail) is served in stone bowls, so remains piping hot for almost the whole meal. You can order extra sides, like tendon, blood, an egg, etc, but sadly no tripes. The raw meat and noodles come separately, and you throw them into the bowl. Unique among ph·ªü restaurants anywhere in the world, they make their noodles fresh from scratch here, and you can observe the whole process through the glass window. Boy, it makes a difference, freshly-made noodles are much, much better than the packaged dry ones served elsewhere. Crispy yu-tiao (extra price) is left on the table; I highly recommend you dip it in the broth for additional delish texture. Service is excellent, they‚Äôre super quick at bringing you requests for extra stuff, like fresh lime, etc. Our go-to

Crowded restaurant, mainly frequented by Vietnamese. Just pho with fresh pasta and beef (your choice of fillet meatballs, tail ribs, etc.). Served either in bowls (small, medium, large) or cast iron casseroles filled with boiling broth into which you throw the raw meat, your fresh pasta, your Thai basil and your bean sprouts. From 70,000 to 110,000 VND. It's exotic, it's noisy, it's fast. Everything we love about Vietnam.

name: Cocotte Sila
address: 21 Ng√¥ Th·ªùi Nhi·ªám, Ho Chi Minh City Vietnam
description: Located on the ground floor of SILA Urban Living, Cocotte SILA is a fantastic space between two terraces from pool side to the main street decorated with designer furnitures and a large wine cellar filled with amazing and rare bottles. Near War Remnants Museum, in the heart of Ho Chi Minh City, Discover Traditional Authentic French Cuisine for everyone, with great value, warm and friendly professional service. There are 3 inside area's including a mezzanine that can be privatized for events. Our Cocotte French Bistro menu is available, it is complemented by a SILA only menu offering items only available here (Foie gras, Scallops, Veal, Lamb, Tarte tatin , etc..). The wine and cocktail selection as well as our A La Carte & special SILA menu are available all day long from 10am to 10pm. You can enjoy our Stylish French Bistro at anytime of the day, and every day of the week. Come visit, it is truly a beautiful setting with an amazing food and beverage selection at great value for money.
example_reviews: Firstly I‚Äôd like to say thank you to Xavier and his staff for a lovely experience in Ho Chi Minh City for their friendly approach making you feel very welcome in Cocotte, a truly beautiful restaurant. We were both blown away with the quality of food and drinks at a very reasonable price. Signature dish is the French Onion soup covered in Emmental cheese which tasted like a traditional dish. We also had the Tuna with Wasabi beurreblanc and the beef ravioli, both were excellent and washed down with a very nice bottle of Cremant which was excellent. Many thanks for a great evening.

I discovered Cocotte through a friend's recommendation. Located in Sila Urban Hotel, I tried the food here last week and found myself smitten with the pan-fried duck breast served with a fragrant black pepper sauce. The dish stands out more when paired with a glass of red wine, stimulating the dish's richer taste. In addition, the space is also very chill, and the service is extremely friendly. I will definitely come back.

This is a French restaurant that really impressed us. The food was delicious and the price is really reasonable. Another nice surprise was that we found the exact taste we had in France (some of my us are french). A place you should try! And enjoy some of the best dishes that are also signature dishes of this restaurant: duck magret, duck confit, rosbif

name: De Tham Restaurant - Vietnamese Cuisine & Vegetarian Food
address: 258 De Tham Street Pham Ngu Lao Ward, Ho Chi Minh City 700000 Vietnam
description: Welcome to De Tham Restaurant - We are proud to be a famous Vietnamese restaurant located in District 1 - considered the center of Ho Chi Minh City. Famous for its authentic Vietnamese cuisine, the restaurant offers a diverse menu with classic dishes such as Traditional fried pork, Traditional fried fish and Vietnamese Pancake. Whether you are a meat eater or a vegetarian, De Tham has a dish to please every palate. With a commitment to using fresh, locally sourced ingredients and traditional cooking techniques, De Tham is considered one of the best Pho restaurants in District 1 and is a must-visit for anyone looking for a truly memorable dining experience.
example_reviews: Wonderful food! Would definitely recommend if you are vegetarian too - my friend is and she really enjoyed her meal. Our waiter Kien was very helpful and he showed my friend how to eat her ‚Äútraditional Hanoi pork‚Äù with rice paper. He also had a lot of patience with us when we were sorting the bill.

The food at this restaurant was some of the best my wife and I have eaten in Vietnam. Went back twice in 4 days and both times the food was excellent, portions generous and service quick and friendly all at a very reasonable price. The make your own Vietnamese pancake was especially delicious. The restaurant was clean and welcoming but not fancy decor wise but that doesn‚Äôt matter as the food is the main event. We booked a table through their Instagram. They do walk ins but each time we went there was a queue for that which seemed to have around a 15 minute wait time. Would highly recommend for great food and service

My husband was looking for somewhere for our last dinner in HCMC and found De Tham. We were warmly greeted and fortunately for us, a comfortable table had just opened up so we were quickly seated. The menu is good with plenty of regional options plus a fairly extensive vegetarian/vegan selection. Our waiter, Jack, was very attentive, knowledgeable and friendly so any questions we had were answered and we felt very well taken care of. My husband ordered us the fried eggplant as a starter and had the grilled beef served in bamboo as his entree while I enjoyed the caramelized pork and quail eggs. I had a glass of red wine from Dalat Vietnam and a lime soda (lime juice, a can of soda water and a small jug of simple syrup so you can mix it to your palate!) and my husband tried a couple of the Vietnamese beers they offered. The eggplant was crispy and tasty and we enjoyed the chili sauce for dipping so much that Jack brought us more. The beef was delicious, tasted chargrilled and looked appealing served up in bamboo. My bowl of pork and quail eggs was so comforting, the broth tasted like it had been simmered with love for hours at Grandmas house. We shouldn‚Äôt have ordered the banana split to share but we did and had no regrets, it too, was well executed. Prices are reasonable for District 1 and portions quite generous.
