Thank you Jack for taking such good care of us!

name: The Monkey Gallery Dining
address: 3F 91 M·∫°c Th·ªã B∆∞·ªüi, Ho Chi Minh City 70000 Vietnam
description: Host by Chef H·∫≠u and our Monkey. The Monkey Gallery DINING is one of the first fine dining restaurants in Ho Chi Minh City, opening in 2019 with a passion for bringing a new gastronomic destination with a Vietnamese soul to local and international diners. The dining room features an ultra-high ceiling with a central open kitchen that acts as the heart of the gallery, where our artists work on their imaginative creations. The 200m¬≤ area has 12 seats, 7 chef's table seats, and a Private Gallery, all designed for the best comfort to enjoy the chef‚Äôs creativity. The Monkey Gallery DINING has received Michelin-selected awards for 2023 and 2024, the Best 50 Discovery award, and Tripadvisor‚Äôs Traveller Choice 2023.
example_reviews: Culinary experience of the highest level, where flavors of Asian cuisine steeped in spices and aromas give life to an alchemy that demonstrates the personality of the chef, less experienced in molecular techniques, expressed in many courses between spherification and gelation not perfectly successful. The rest very well worked out. Michelin is rigid in its 360-degree evaluations... here it has blindfolded in the service, albeit sympathetic waiters. Minimal tone in the mise en place. Too bad they replaced the wine glass with a beautiful water glass in fine Hungarian crystal .. Modest location , jap style but advanced technologies that maybe make you feel in an interstellar space and that, fortunately, you forget as soon as you are out to find yourself in the magical Saigon.... long live Vietnamese Cuisine!!

We comeback to this wow place after a short period of time since our last visit to enjoy their new festive menu. Staffs are kind and well trained and food is super delicious. We love our experience here and definitely will comeback many more times!!

This was an excellent meal! If you're looking for a fine dining experience in Saigon that is beyond worth the price point, please do check it out! I tried the 'Stylish' menu, and although it was 4 courses, there were loads of complimentary nibbles in between. Rita was our server, and she was so helpful that it made the entire experience seamless. Highly recommended!

name: Ngon Restaurant
address: 160 Pasteur, Ho Chi Minh City 70000 Vietnam
description: Exquisite and heavenly dishes in an elegant, spacious and sophisticated interior. Tastefully decorated with elaborated wooden frames, slide doors and comfortable armchairs with cushions. Soft died cloth drapes its sealing and red lanterns illuminates its interior at night. Its beautiful outdoor seating has a traditional theatre where water puppet shows and Vietnamese cultural music are held weekly. The chef‚Äôs ability to marry ingredients & flavours results in multi-dimensional dishes that are a pleasure to eat. We also offer a fine wine section that caters for those wanting to indulge.
example_reviews: The setting is superb. Fast and efficient service despite the size of our group. The dishes are very generous (too much) but not as fragrant as in the other restaurants where we stopped during our tour. The spring rolls for example were huge but only tasted like meat. Spring rolls not as good as elsewhere. Completely incomprehensible: we asked for towels to replace the wet towel intended to cool our hands. There are no paper towels and wet ones are charged extra...

This restaurant downtown was suggested by our guide. The fa√ßade of the restaurant is very lit and richly decorated with plastic plants and flowers. The interior consists of various rooms and other tables are in a large courtyard in front, all lavishly decorated. The tables are pretty close. The menu was very varied and enriched with photos to illustrate the individual dishes. Food is normal and portions plentiful. The service was efficient considering the considerable number of tables but completely impersonal. There are no architectural barriers to get to the front tables.

In the central area of Ho Chi Minh City, this restaurant offers a well-kept environment both inside and outside. The service does not shine for friendliness but you eat well and with a wide choice. I definitely recommend it also in light of the now 2 weeks of local cuisine. I count around 30 euros for 4 dishes and 4 beers.

name: Xliii Coffee
address: 178A Pasteur Ben Nghe Ward, District 1, Ho Chi Minh City 700000 Vietnam
description:
Came here for specialty coffee (i.e. pour over) after touring at the independence palace. The entrance and ambiance of the shop is minimalist style, pretty special for a coffee shop. Apparently they have another store in Danang and the shop looks even more amazing (from pics shown to us).

The staff was very friendly and spent time to explain the steps for us to order coffee. He also explained how they sourced the beans and how the beans taste. He also recommended us the beans and types of coffee to try based on our preference.

The price is not cheap consider it is in HCM, some could be even pricier than in HK. So, not really for budget drinkers or if you just want to have a dose of caffeine, it is more for experience.
example_reviews: Came here for specialty coffee (i.e. pour over) after touring at the independence palace. The entrance and ambiance of the shop is minimalist style, pretty special for a coffee shop. Apparently they have another store in Danang and the shop looks even more amazing (from pics shown to us). The staff was very friendly and spent time to explain the steps for us to order coffee. He also explained how they sourced the beans and how the beans taste. He also recommended us the beans and types of coffee to try based on our preference. The price is not cheap consider it is in HCM, some could be even pricier than in HK. So, not really for budget drinkers or if you just want to have a dose of caffeine, it is more for experience.

Delicious the hand poured coffee tasted like tea. No bitterness and the quality of the beans were superb. The staff were extremely knowledgeable of the business ethos and how they value not just quality coffee but genuine relationships with their coffee suppliers and methods of growing coffee that are sustainable.

Staff is friendly and study coffee well. They can recommend suitable coffee based on your demand. They serve tasty cascara tea for free after you enjoy the coffee. Only a pity is that some pastry are already sold out even I came early in the morning. Not easy to find this kind of cafe for special coffee beans. Price is quite expensive compared to the typical Vietnamese coffee shops, however it worth trying !

name: The Lounge - Sheraton Saigon Grand Opera Hotel
address: 80 Dong Du Street, Ho Chi Minh City 700000 Vietnam
description: The place to meet, work and relax. The Lounge offers all-day dining menu themed with &More by Sheraton concept encompassing a gathering place at the hotel lobby, serving everything from coffee, tea, fresh juice to craft beer, wine, and afternoon tea.
example_reviews: The Lounge, located adjacent to the lobby, has first class food, drinks, and service. I happened to arrive during happy hour (daily from 5-8pm) and drinks were 50% off, which made my Mai Tai extra tasty. I also tried "Banh Xeo" for the first time, which is a traditional Vietnam dish made with Pork and Shrimp, and served with mint, basil, lettuce leaves, and a wonderful dipping sauce. Absolutely delicious and would highly recommend.
Coffee & Tea & cookies are perfect,,, Service team are good as well. Space is warm & quiet We feel relaxing and will be back üòçüòç

We stayed at this hotel recently for a couple of nights and had a bite to eat at The Lounge on the ground floor of the hotel at lunchtime on our first day. We were very happy indeed with the food and service so decided to do the same the next day, too. The bar/restaurant offers a good choice of plates, both local and international, plus drinks. It is a very spacious, modern area with tables, more relaxed seating and chairs at the bar as well. The mostly young staff are well trained and have great communication skills. Our waitress on both occasions, Huyen, was extremely attentive and eager to please. She recognised us the second day and greeted us warmly which was lovely. We were very impressed!

name: Lagom Caf√© - Belgian Beer & Coffee Lounge
address: 87 Vo Thi Sau Ward 6, District 3, Ho Chi Minh City 700000 Vietnam
description: Based on the idea of combining 3 interconnected F&B services: Cafe, beer lounge and mini retail shop specializing in selling Belgian beers directly to the end-users. Lagom Cafe has become known not only as one of most relaxing place for savouring Belgian craft beers but also as the only location in the country selling the most diversified collection of Belgian beers at the most reasonable prices
example_reviews: This is a super cute little Belgian beer bar, cafe and restaurant just a couple of minutes walk from The Pink Church and directly opposite Quan Pho Huong Binh for those of you on the Michelin credited pho restaurant trail, as we were. We noticed it across the street and stumbled in out of curiosity. Lovely, rustic wooden decor over several floors in a typically narrow HCMC-style dwelling squeezed, almost impossibly, into the shaft of space between buildings. A huge selection of bottled Belgian beer and several good quality staples on draft as well (I had a draft Vedette, she had a bottle of Grimbergen blonde). Really lovely staff - the young lady who served us was particularly helpful in recommending the best pho places to visit if you want to eat like a local. Hint: they are not on the Michelin credited list. But if you want to find out more about that, I suggest you pop in and ask yourself‚Ä¶

The first time I came here, I was impressed by the cozy feeling and the unique decoration style with beer bottles, creating a very suitable space to enjoy beer. The shop has many varieties from Belgium and has many choices from light to heavy, serving many customer groups. The service staff are very enthusiastic and attentive. I will definitely come back again!! ‚ú®‚ú®

I had the opportunity to visit Lagom and was really impressed with the way the shop represents the culture of Belgian beer. First, the restaurant's space is very comfortable and cozy. I feel like I'm in a little corner of Belgium. There are many unique decorative details, including paintings of famous Belgian beers. Soothing European-sounding background music creates a relaxing atmosphere ideal for enjoying beer. The shop's biggest strength is its diverse Belgian beer list. I tried many different beers and each one was interesting in story and rich in flavor. The bar's staff is very knowledgeable about Belgian beer and helped me choose the one that suits my taste. In addition, the shop also has a variety of snacks to pair with beer. I tried a few dishes such as a delicious cold charcuterie cup and a plate of beef with fragrant red pepper sauce. Although the prices are somewhat higher than some other shops, for all that the shop offers, it is a worthy experience investment. If you are a Belgian beer lover and want to experience the country's authentic beer culture, this is a great destination. I will definitely return to this restaurant in the future.

name: Latest Recipe
address: 3C Ton Duc Thang Street Le M√©ridien Saigon, Mezzanine Floor, Ho Chi Minh City 70000 Vietnam
description: Overlooking the vibrant Saigon River, Latest Recipe is one of Ho Chi Minh City's most sought-after dining destinations. Featuring a stunning open showcase kitchen, guests can enjoy live seafood, fresh noodle selections, wood-fired pizza, and made-to-order dishes crafted by our talented culinary team. Indulge in an extensive international buffet available for breakfast, lunch, dinner, and Sunday brunch, or explore our √† la carte menu for a personalized dining experience. Whether you're looking for a delicious meal, a lively gathering, or an intimate dining experience, our diverse menu caters to every palate.
example_reviews: Residing at Le Meridien Saigon where this restaurant is located, I tried it for both breakfast and dinner. The breakfast buffet is of a good standard, not a lot of choice and variety but what is there remains of quality. The fruit and/or vegetable juice freshly centrifuged to order is very appreciable. For dinner, however, I ordered a la carte, again not a lot of choice but well-prepared dishes in a mix of international and local cuisine. The price is very high for Vietnam but considering that this restaurant could be in any other metropolis in the world, you choose when you want to be safe

Tonight I dined at Le Meridien restaurant on Ton Duc Thang Street, District 1. Although the restaurant is buffet, I tried √† la carte to experience the food here. I must say that the dishes I ordered to try were Mekong salad, cod fish eaten with rice... especially the fries served with shaking beef were delicious, very delicious. And the attentive, cheerful, enthusiastic waiters made the atmosphere as well as the meal more delicious. Thank you Yen, Van, Ngoc, My Dung, and Thu, for your very dedicated service.

Came here for breakfast and was impressed by the service. The waitstaff are responsive and kind, and speak English well for those who do not speak Vietnamese. Maru Nguyen served us and was polite and friendly. She speaks English well and was able to answer our questions with ease. The food was good, with choices of American breakfast, Chinese food, pastries, and Vietnamese food. Nguyet or Luna, the head chef who makes Pho, is very personable and greets you when you come to her station. She is very helpful and makes great food recommendations. The pho that she and her staff makes is delicious! My family and I had a great experience.

name: L'entrecote - Social Meating
address: Level 2, 63 ƒê√¥ng Du, Ph∆∞·ªùng B·∫øn Ngh√©, Qu·∫≠n 1, Ho Chi Minh City Vietnam
description: L‚ÄôEntrec√¥te, the iconic Parisian eatery since 1959, now graces cities worldwide. Savor our famed single-course meal; fresh organic walnut salad, Prime Sirloin with its famous secret sauce, and unlimited daily prepared crispy french fries.Enjoy this Legendary Dining Experience in Vietnam!
review_summary:
L'entrecote - Social Meating wraps guests in an atmosphere that exudes both elegance and comfort, complete with a French charm that's perfect for both romantic dinners and business meetings. The service at this establishment has received high marks for its professionalism and warmth, enhancing the authentic French culinary experience.

Diners often feel they receive excellent value, with the quality of ingredients and exceptional cooking justifying the cost. The prime sirloin, praised for its perfect preparation and irresistible secret sauce, along with an array of delightful sides and desserts, consistently earns rave reviews.
example_reviews: Once again, L'Entrec√¥te Social Meating did not disappoint us! The formula is simple but effective, with excellent Value for Award. We took advantage of the "60,000 VND" offer to taste saut√©ed vegetables and pepper sauce, a delight! The service was impeccable and the atmosphere very pleasant.

The restaurant's understated and elegant d√©cor is a perfect interpretation of French sophistication. The specialty steak is served with a secret butter sauce, and the meat is tender and juicy. The wine list is impressive, with a selection of wines from Burgundy to Bordeaux. The service team is professional and welcoming, giving us a true sense of French hospitality. The most amazing thing is that they follow the traditional French recipe strictly and each dish is full of craftsmanship. It's expensive, but it's definitely worth a special occasion. This is a rare romantic dating spot in Saigon!

The signature entrec√¥te steak was cooked to perfection, swimming in their secret sauce. Generous portions had us swooning, while the authentic French atmosphere transported us straight to Montmartre. Absolutely smitten with their cr√®me br√ªl√©e!

name: Oriental Pearl Restaurant
address: 720A Dien Bien Phu 66th Floor, Vinpearl Landmark 81, Autograph Collection, Ho Chi Minh City 700000 Vietnam
description: The Oriental Pearl, the city‚Äôs finest and highest all-day restaurant, serves elevated local dishes such as pho prepared with Wagyu beef set against a stunning view of the city so diners can sip on the clouds. A focus on local fare that blends tradition and creative re-imagination embodies Vinpearl Landmark 81 - Autograph Collection‚Äôs emphasis on immersing guests in modern Vietnam.
example_reviews: Honestly, one of the best restaurants I‚Äôve been too. The location and the view is beautiful, and they have live music with a good variety on music type on saturdays that made the vibe even better. Now, the first impression, except from the view was the staff. All the staff were smiling and seemed happy which for me is very important that you can see and sense that they do wanna be there and work, and that you‚Äôre not bothering them or that they just wanted the evening to be over. Our waitress of the evening was Mocha and the service she gave was first class in my opinion as a former waitress. She went out of the way to explain the dishes to us, recommending dishes and ordered small portions for us to try. One thing I was impressed by was that she noticed that I ate the oysters raw, and therefore she recommended other dishes that contained raw fish like ceviche. She made sure that we had everything needed and didn‚Äôt mind to do everything so the evening would turn out the best for us as customers. The food was so fresh and seasoned so well. The range of seafood wasn‚Äôt very big but here it‚Äôs definitely quality over quantity and honestly, you don‚Äôt need much more than what they have. The only thing I can point out was the pasta dish that they prepare upon order. If you start with it, it might turn out great. But we had it for last and after all the fresh seafood it tasted a bit too salty for us. But definitely nothing wrong with the seasoning or so. In conclusion, I would not even hesitate to eat here again.

Great service and great quality of food! Our server Mocha was the best, she was very attentive and gave us great hospitality, truly a 5 star rating. The A4 Wagyu and fresh seafood was Devine and worth the price, definitely would recommend!

My wife and I went on her birthday and we thoroughly enjoyed the late lunch, we had the 990,000 dong Pho (which was a whole different experience - the meat quality of the Pho is better here but the flavor of the Reverie pho is better in my opinion. Com ga Hoi A was a pleasant partner to the Signature Pho. The service from Mocha was exceptional. We also appreciated the birthday cake (gratis) and Mocha taking endless pictures of us and the surrounding breathtaking views. Landmark is also known for its great seafood buffet.

name: Sol Kitchen & Bar
address: 110 - 112 Ly Tu Trong Ben Thanh Ward, Ho Chi Minh City 700000 Vietnam
description: Sol kitchen bar, a new dining destination right at the heart of District 1, Ho Chi Minh City. Our cuisine is inspired by the flavours of latin America. We draw most of our influence from Mexico & Argentina. We look forward to welcoming you to Sol kitchen & bar.
example_reviews: This place has a nice vibe, staff are attentive and efficient and the food and cocktails were excellent - the pork and lamb option are melt in the mouth delicious! Couple of dissatisfaction points: mains a little lacking for vegetarians - we asked for vegetarian fajitas instead of chicken but restaurant was not willing to improvise to accommodate; If you are wine drinkers make sure you check they have enough bottles in stock for your group (12 people), ours ran out after 2 bottles - restaurant had no equivalent price alternative, the next option was almost twice the price. Could improve with accommodating customers better.

We had anniversary dinner here and were absolutely blown away with the food we received. It was beautiful and some of the best food we have ever eaten. Wasn't cheap by Vietnamese standards but to have the same quality meal at home we would've paid double the price we paid here. Would recommend this restaurant for any couple that want to treat themselves whilst on holiday 10/10

This is a great, vibrant restaurant with excellent food, cocktails/drinks and service! The atmosphere was lively as it was busy with lots of young people enjoying HCMC at night. There was a couple of birthday celebrations that staff supported with a cake and singing. My partner chose the chilli con carne and duck and I chose the warm cheese & chorizo and seafood with orzo. All of the food was delicious, hot and plentiful. We were given a cheesecake dessert free as there was a very slight delay in the main courses not arriving together. Staff were helpful, efficient, smiley and created a lovely atmosphere for a great dining experience! I would highly recommend this restaurant üòä

name: A Taste Of Saigon - Kitchen
address: 272 ƒê·ªÅ Th√°m Qu·∫≠n 1 H·ªì Ch√≠ Minh, Ho Chi Minh City 700000 Vietnam
description: At ‚ÄúA Taste of Saigon,‚Äù we are committed to providing a memorable dining experience that celebrates the essence of Saigon‚Äôs culinary culture. Join us for a journey of flavors, where every dish tells a story and every moment is a celebration. Discover the heart and soul of Saigon through the exquisite offerings at ‚ÄúA Taste of Saigon.‚Äù
example_reviews: The staff were so friendly and helpful in this restaurant and their service seemed genuine. We were served by Blink, who had a lovely smile, and nothing was too much trouble for her. The food was really good and we didn't have to wait long for our meals. If you want to sample authentic Vietnamese food in a restaurant that provides good value for money, then this is a good choice for you

Amazing food and excellent service! The papaya salad, spring rolls, and tofu balls were all delicious‚Äîfresh, flavorful, and perfectly prepared. The servers were attentive and made our experience even better. Highly recommend this spot!

A fantastic meal. June our waitress was very attentive, taking time to explain the menu options to us. She was extremely friendly and her use of the English language was excellent. The food and drink were delicious and good value. We shall be recommending this establishment to our tour guide.

name: Hanoi Train Track Cafe
address: 47 Le Duan Street 224 Lane, Hanoi 100000 Vietnam
description: CAFE & DRINK Come in and get a taste of our great cafe & drink. Excellent place to visit, to chill and get amazing photos of the train.
cuisines: Late Night Mediterranean Restaurants in Hanoi
example_reviews: In the heart of Hanoi, tucked away along the train tracks, lies a quaint caf√© that exudes a unique charm. The ambiance is captivating, offering a serene escape from the bustling city. The coffee served here is delightful, complemented by a selection of tasty snacks that perfectly accompany your drink of choice. The staff are friendly and attentive, ensuring a pleasant visit every time. It's a place where you can unwind, soak in the local atmosphere, and enjoy a moment of tranquility. Highly recommended for anyone looking to experience a hidden gem in this vibrant city. üáµüáπüáªüá≥üáµüá∏üåçüôèüèºü§ç‚ú®üñ§üåô

We ordered the coconut coffee and egg coffee from Cafe Ga Dong Duang and we thoroughly enjoyed it. The cafes along the railway were beautiful and had a great atmosphere. Great place to relax and watch tourists come by. A guard is at the only entrance. A cafe owner will come and bring you in. It‚Äôs their way to manage the crowd given the authorities‚Äô concerns with safety issues given the trains. You can choose which cafe to go to.

Check train times before you go so you can see the train. The train goes past about 9 times a day, some are spaced a hour or so apart and some in the evening. There are about 10 spots to stop and have a drink on the small section of track. Of course you have to purchase a drink to sit down at a shop but it‚Äôs the standard price. 20k - 50k for a beer with lots of juices and snacks to be had. We stayed for 45min and had 2 beers a ice tea and a smoothie for 115k dong. If you don‚Äôt want to spend money you can walk up and down the track and just take pictures for no charge

name: Fu Rong Hua Cantonese Restaurant
address: 9 Dinh Tien Hoang Street, Hang Trong Ward, Hoan Kiem District 09 Dinh Tien Hoang, Hoan Kiem District, Hanoi 10000 Vietnam
description: Fu Rong Hua is a Cantonese-style restaurant. Located in the heart of Hanoi capital, overlooking the Hoan Kiem Lake, Fu Rong Hua is the ideal place for couples, families and diners to love Chinese food such as dim sum, roast duck
cuisines: Middle Eastern Restaurants with Buffet in Hanoi
example_reviews: Decent meal but not on par with the Cantonese food served in Europe. Eg pancakes for duck are incredibly thick and doughy, the dishes are highly salty (maybe don‚Äôt check your blood pressure reading on the same evening of dining). Pricey for Vi standards but a nice treat if you fancy something different. The dim sum (crab and prawn) cannot be faulted and the service is speedy. Solid 3.5/5.

We ate there early, so we had the benefit of a quiet restaurant. I can honestly say I don't remember the last time I ate dimsum so good! Fresh ingredients.... every prawn dimsum was meaty and you could see and taste the prawns... it was really outstanding. Also the Hong Kong style pork was great.... Our server V√°n Anh was extremely friendly and helpful! Huge compliments to her. Overall really no complaints, and I would definitely eat here again.

Very average food with a Pekin Duck ( the house specialty, it seems..), served with only one kind of sauce (no Chinese mustard, no pickled chilli) chewy and tasteless. The Dim Sum were standard, with little difference in taste from one to another. Dining rooms are pleasantly lit, the service efficient. Last visit.

name: Maison Marou
address: 91A Tho Nhuom Tran Hung Dao Ward Hoan Kiem, Hanoi 100000 Vietnam
description: Exellent chocolate cocktail! I ordered chocolate cookie cocktail. Although it was a bit expensive (120 000 VND) it was worth the price. I liked that with a dessert you get a free refill of drinking water, which helps on hot days. Great place for a date.
cuisines: Eastern European Restaurants for Lunch in Hanoi
example_reviews: Exellent chocolate cocktail! I ordered chocolate cookie cocktail. Although it was a bit expensive (120 000 VND) it was worth the price. I liked that with a dessert you get a free refill of drinking water, which helps on hot days. Great place for a date.

It looked like a classic Vietnamese souvenir shop, and I walked to the hotel in front of Hanoi station where I stayed. It took me about 10 minutes to get there, but I found myself facing a road just down the street, so I had to rely on navigation if I didn't know. There was a showcase of cakes as soon as I entered the store, and when I ordered recommended products and drinks, they served me to the eat-in space at the back. Further into the eat-in space was a handmade workshop where visitors could watch demonstrations. There was a dedicated corner by the entrance for tea and souvenirs, which could be purchased here, but because it was hot outside, you had to be careful about the take-home time.

I came to the cafe for the sweets. It's fun just looking at the sweets in the cafe's showcase. The beer mug-style chocolate sweets I was looking for were not sold out yet. There are so many types of chocolate in the shop corner that it can be confusing, but you can sample them. You can have fun selecting items. I chose a standard set as a souvenir for home. The price is high, but you can buy it cheaper than buying it in Tokyo.

name: Spices Villa - Vietnamese Cuisine
address: 73 Ly Nam De Cua Dong Ward, Hoan Kiem District, Hanoi 10000 Vietnam
description: Nestled in the vibrant heart of Hanoi's Old Quarter, yet serenely removed from the bustling streets, lies Spices Villa a Vietnamese Restaurant. More than just a place to eat, it's an experience, a journey into the soul of Vietnamese cuisine. Housed within a beautifully preserved French colonial villa, the restaurant exudes an air of timeless elegance and tranquil charm. Step through its doors and be transported to a bygone era, where the aromas of fragrant herbs and spices mingle with the hushed ambiance of a peaceful sanctuary, promising an authentic taste of Vietnam in an unforgettable setting.
cuisines: German Restaurants for Lunch in Hanoi
example_reviews: . Ate here on our first & last nights in Vietnam, initially recommended by our hotel reception . The ambience was tranquil, with an airy semi open area at front and plenty more space under cover Tables were spaced well apart and the food delicious, My duck breast was perfectly cooked & my husband‚Äôs stir fried beef fillet soft and succulent. Desserts were also fabulous. The staff were lovely, just the right level of attentiveness. A special mention for Chilie, our lovely waitress on both occasions- she recognised us straight away on our 2nd visit even gave us a sketch of our meal, drawn while we were eating, to give us as a memento. This is the perfect spot for a celebration or just a good slap up meal.

Gorgeous restaurant with event outdoor and indoor seating. Set menu was the perfect amount of traditional yet elevated Vietnamese food. The spices, flavourings, and textures were really a cut above other places we have eaten (and loved) in Vietnam. On top of this the young, vibrant staff (who all speak fluent English) were impeccable. Both polite and friendly it made us feel really at home. Special shout out to Ms Chi Le who also gave us a great bar recommendation for later!

We dined in this beautiful place. The restaurant , in a beautiful house elegantly restored , is quiet and offers a lovely room and two charming courtyards. We tasted refined dishes full of flavor and finesse. The kitchen is really upscale! The welcome of the whole team is exceptional , Miss Chile is adorable, professional and speaks very good English. Thank you , it was a last dinner that ended our trip to Vietnam and we will keep a wonderful memory. Do not hesitate to discover this place in Hanoi!

name: La Badiane Restaurant
address: 10 Nam Ngu, Hoan Kiem, Hanoi Vietnam
description: Founded in December 2008, La Badiane -French for Star Anise spice- is heralding its claim to be one of the best restaurants in Vietnam, dedicated to fusion of flavors and international gastronomy. As reference, La Badiane is rated top 500 Restaurants in Asia by The Miele Guide, has been recommended by The New York Times, and has received 5 consecutive Certificates of Excellence by Trip Advisor -since 2011. Indeed, with more than 300 upvotes as ‚ÄúEXCELLENT‚Äù, La Badiane knows a high rating deserved to top-end restaurants. Yet, if most is about tastes, fusion of flavors and international gastronomy, great attention is also constantly paid to the quality of the service provided as well as to the overall atmosphere, so guests have a unique culinary experience by enjoying every aspect of their meal. When coming in, one‚Äôs attention is instantly caught by the multitude of perfumes & aromas flowing out from the open front kitchen. The entrance corridor planted with harmonious luxuriant vegetation leads you towards the heart of the restaurant, and its glass covered patio. Surrounded by carefully chosen leaf plants, walls predominantly white, and large B&W photo portraits, the place provides for a true feeling of calm and elegance. The combination of tablecloths, two-color curtains, and the green vegetation gathers all conditions to let guests‚Äô visual and gustative senses fully express themselves. The attentive and discreet lightening in the evening makes it very romantic, and live classic music concerts every Wednesday evening levels-up La Badiane restaurant to turn it into a complete place. On the upper floor, two rooms available provide for perfect intimate spaces, appropriate for guests either looking for privacy, or mid-size groups wishing to enjoy a private lunch or dinner on a special occasion. As opposed to the ground floor and its B&W photos, the first floor presents large-size color portraits. A must-see.
cuisines: Fast Food Restaurants in Hoan Kiem
Street Food Restaurants in Hoan Kiem
Late Night Indian Restaurants in Hoan Kiem
example_reviews: Tonight, my wife and I ate at La Badiene, and the experience was simply wonderful. I booked the restaurant from Australia via email - the communication was very easy, clear, and timely. From the moment we arrived, the staff were fantastic - chilled, but super attentive. We had the degustation menu and at their suggestion we had the Signature menu and Fusion menu and shared each dish, this doubled the number of dishes we had, but also doubled the amount of work for the kitchen and staff. Throughout the meal, the waiters offered additional bread, making sure that we had enough for the pate, etc. The meals were beautifully crafted, full of flavour, and complemented the other courses. On completion of our meal, our waiter helped us book a Grab (Uber), and another of the staff waited with us until it arrived. We often eat at restaurants, but La Badiene is exceptional - Great food and wonderful staff. If you're in Hanoi and looking for a special night out, this is it. 11 out of 10

This is a beautiful place. We ordered a four-course lunch, and the quality started incredibly high and gradually declined over the courses. I think the starters were best because they were relatively simple, so the excellent preparation and great flavours really shone through. But the mains and desserts felt over-complicated, with too many ingredients, not all of which seemed to belong together. They'd look great on Instagram, but weren't so satisfying to eat. Overall, though, a very good meal. The staff tried hard to provide what they clearly think of as good service, but to me it was very annoying. They were constantly fussing over us and making a big production of doing simple and/or completely unnecessary things like unfolding napkins, clearing crumbs from the table and putting down empty plates between each course and then taking them away again. But when we actually wanted something, they were nowhere to be found, and the bill took so long to arrive that my wife had to get up and fetch it herself. To me, good service is unobtrusively efficient, but this was inefficiently obtrusive. Probably wouldn't come back.

As you walk through the entrance with the glass panelled kitchen, you immediately feel special in this place of warm welcome sophistication.. from the beautiful black and white portrait prints that adorn the walls, to the head chef Benjamin coming and introducing himself to customers. But wow.. it‚Äôs the the tastes & the fusion of flavours, combined with the quality of service that you must come and experience. There is so much creativity in the combination of flavours & spices that pair so well together. Do yourself a favour when looking for a special meal. Come to this place. They have well priced degustation lunches that change weekly or simply try their individual meals‚Ä¶ whichever you choose you won‚Äôt be disappointed.

name: TUNG Dining
address: 2C Quang Trung, Hanoi 100000 Vietnam
description: T.U.N.G Dining is Vietnam‚Äôs first pioneering tasting menu restaurant, where innovation knows no bounds. Our vision is to offer diners an extraordinary experience‚Äîone that transcends limits and redefines expectations. Chef TUNG‚Äôs approach to food is inspired by culinary influences from around the world, thoughtfully combined with the finest local ingredients and flavors. Join us on this journey of discovery!
cuisines: South American Restaurants for Lunch in Hanoi
example_reviews: One of the most expensive Western restaurants I've ever been to and enjoyed. The Nordic food menu is extremely diverse, including ordering by portion or individual dishes. We got to try a lot of strange dishes that we have never tried before. When the wait staff brought it out, they fully introduced the name of the dish and even the main ingredients of the dish. Each dish is served in a fairly small quantity, we came here to determine this in advance and the price is also very luxurious. Professional and polite service staff, luxurious space.

I have been to this restaurant since attracted by reviews. I must say that what I tasted was partly amazing, partly normal. There are some things that, perhaps out of Italian habit and not only, did not convince me so much, like the fact that wine and water are not left at the table, but the waiter, every time he sees the empty glass comes with the bottle and pours what you need. Too bad that the white wine we chose arrived at the right temperature only at the end from dinner! That said: - pros: environment and dishes, some dishes with exclusive taste, attentive service, but not too much; - cons: drinks not left available to diners, some dishes with a bit 'flat flavor, price in my opinion not justified compared to the offer and prices of the place (although I understand it is a high-end restaurant), the waiter who once outside the room (right on the street), asks which dishes were liked more and which ones you liked less ... even today I do not understand why these questions are asked outside the restaurant. Otherwise, would I come back? Safe not. Would I recommend it? Yes, if you have an additional budget to spend differently... as I said above, some dishes are really crazy!

Giving T.U.N.G. Dining anything less than five stars is a travesty and does a disservice to creative cooking. Listen, I‚Äôm 74, was part owner of three restaurants, and have dined at the culinary temples of the world including many three star Michelin restaurants. T.U.N.G Dining is on par with most of them. Our 17 dishes tickled our senses of smell, taste, and sight. The culinary journey was a trip to Wonderland and Oz. The photos tell part of the story, but everything also tasted delicious. Service was charming and helpful, and everyone displayed pride in what they were serving. Pricing is extremely high for Vietnam, coming to around $280 for two including tax and tip. T.U.N.G. Dining is worth every penny.

name: Maison Vie
address: 28 Tang Bat Ho Street, Pham Dinh Ho ward, Hai Ba Trung district Hai Ba Trung district, Hanoi 10000 Vietnam
description: Based on 28 Tang Bat Ho Street, Maison Vie Restaurant is an indispensable destination for French cuisine lovers in Hanoi. With 20 years of in-depth experience in French restaurant business, Maison Vie promises awesome dishes and services delivered by skilful chefs and dedicated staff. Inspired by "Brasserie" - imperial and crowded French restaurants with Neoclassical architecture, characterized by meticulous and subtle sculptures, Maison Vie Restaurant owns ancient but luxurious beauty, partly forming an elegant trait among a busy street. Mansion perspective with light white color and gently patterned arches not only forms graceful and moderate architectural portrait but also creates open space of fresh air and natural light. Enjoying characteristic and superior French dishes in a classical and opulent space will be splendid memories for any choosy clients. On the second floor, outdoor dining area under green liana truss will be ideal composure for nature lovers. Simultaneously, 4 VIP rooms with cosy brown interior will well fit intimate and private appointments. Maison Vie means "house of life", which derived from the desire to establish a familiar address for family get-together, friend reunions, colleague gatherings in a subtle, deluxe French-originated dining space. Nothing is more marvelous than the period of relishing meals together with our dear ones, temporarily forgetting daily anxieties and appreciating sweet relaxation. Maison Vie logo with the simulation of a Gaulois cock, French national historic emblem, features goodwill, closeness, generosity, hospitality. Slogan "Let's taste better now" not only signifies determination to set up a superior nutritious French food spot, but also accumulates dedication to innovate combination of fresh high-class ingredients with native spices, which brings clients ultimate appetite. Maison Vie is the perfect dining site of gourmets, the must-try paradise of French cuisines once in a lifetime, the "third place" cementing family sentiment and nourishing intimate camaraderie. Maison Vie Restaurant - "Taste better now"
cuisines: Middle Eastern Restaurants with Private Dining in Hanoi
Pizza with Private Dining in Hanoi
Seafood Restaurants for Large Groups in Hanoi
example_reviews: Wonderful classy French restaurant. My wife and I went on a recommendation from a tour guide and were not disappointed. Beautiful setting and excellent food and service. We had the four course option with wine and everything was great. I‚Äôm not a real big dessert person, but with the 4 courses I selected the strawberry/orange cheesecake and it was flavorful, smooth and light as air. Amazing. And for those who come from another big city (we come from NYC) the cost is very reasonable. Highly recommended.

We had a price fix dinner that include a voice of appetizers and a selection of entrees. Included were dessert and wine. Food was excellent. I had the Basa Fish Bouilabaisse style entree which was quite different that other Bouilabaisse dishes I have had in the past. This did not have a broth, yet it was terrific.

We were very impressed with the quality of the food, the ambience in the restaurant, and the attention the staff paid to us. We could not fault anything. A well-informed local recommended to us the restaurant for fine French dining. We ordered two sets comprising Starter, Soup, Maim and Dessert. The choices for the sets, which we consulted with the staff, as well as for wine, turned out to be perfect. The beef cheeks, particularly, were juicy and delicious. A meal like this for one person would easily set us back by more than A$100 in Australia, but we paid under US$60 for two. Thank you for giving my wife and I such a beautiful dining experience. You are an important addition to Hanoi's fine culinary scene.

name: Bun Cha Huong Lien
address: 24 Le Van Huu, Hanoi Vietnam
description: This spot well-known on webs and we found it packed with visitors. Bun Cha and grilled pork skewers were excellent, we all too loved the broth soup that we asked for a second. And it was served quite fast. This dining spot seemed private, however, it' quite cramped so it' unconvenient anyway.
example_reviews: This spot well-known on webs and we found it packed with visitors. Bun Cha and grilled pork skewers were excellent, we all too loved the broth soup that we asked for a second. And it was served quite fast. This dining spot seemed private, however, it' quite cramped so it' unconvenient anyway.

We just enjoyed a tasteful lunch at this small but famous restaurant. Food was very fresh and service was good although the restaurant was crowded and it all went very quick. Would certainly recommend to visit this restaurant if you stay in Hanoi. It definitely is worth visiting

I was told to by the glove driver, but I had made a mistake. But I had never eaten Buncha before, so I tried it. I eat a sweet dipping sauce with vegetables and noodles. By the time I finished eating, I was bored with the sweetness and greasyness. Fried spring rolls are delicious.

name: Hill Top Curry Indian Restaurant
address: 6 P. H√†ng L∆∞·ª£c, Hanoi 100000 Vietnam
description: At Hill Top Curry Restaurant, we serve you fresh, and healthy food. All dishes are cooked by Experienced Chefs as our desire is to create a place where you can enjoy the beauty of food. Enjoy your meal! With more than 100 dishes and drinks on the menu.
example_reviews: Very conveniently close to the Masjid an Noor. V good quality Indian/Pakistani cuisine , very reasonably priced. Friendly and efficient service. No long wait for good food. Be cautious when ordering especially on a hungry tummy...The portions are very generous and the meals on the menu are often substantial enough for 2 adults to share. If you've over ordered management will gladly oblige if you have leftover food to be packed for taking home.

One of the best Indian Restaurant in Hanoi city and is very close to maximum hotels. Food is so Delicious and Tasty in reasonable best price. The team is very polite and humble. I recommend people to prefer this Restaurant without any doubt.

Vietnamese people may not like Indian food, and the price is higher than the average of local restaurants, but I love it! Authentic spice cuisine, you can eat delicious vegetarian or meat, masala, thali, biryani... It is worth exploring here. In Hanoi, a city full of imagination, eating delicious South Asian food is totally worth the money!

name: 5ku Station
address: 29 Thai Van Lung Ben Nghe Ward, Dist. 1, Ho Chi Minh City 70000 Vietnam
description:
We had dinner at 5ku Station today. After reading the map, we decided on shrimp, octopus and fish stomachs. Since we didn't know exactly what to expect with the last dish, we were curious. Then came the charcoal table grill for the ordered food, the fish stomach looked quite nice on the plate and we thought this was his normal fish. Far from it, it was actually fish stomachs that resumed their original shape on the grill. We tried a piece and then it was clear that this is not for us.
The waitress noticed that we don't really like the ordered fish stomach and took it back with us and didn't calculate it, just great, because we had ordered this.
All in all a nice experience with the barbecue at the table, the ambience is Vietnamese, but the service just super nice, for this 5 points with star.
example_reviews: We had dinner at 5ku Station today. After reading the map, we decided on shrimp, octopus and fish stomachs. Since we didn't know exactly what to expect with the last dish, we were curious. Then came the charcoal table grill for the ordered food, the fish stomach looked quite nice on the plate and we thought this was his normal fish. Far from it, it was actually fish stomachs that resumed their original shape on the grill. We tried a piece and then it was clear that this is not for us. The waitress noticed that we don't really like the ordered fish stomach and took it back with us and didn't calculate it, just great, because we had ordered this. All in all a nice experience with the barbecue at the table, the ambience is Vietnamese, but the service just super nice, for this 5 points with star.

First of all, the restaurant is more than rustic, the chairs and tables are hand-made, the floor is bare concrete; the air is quite smoky due to the various table grills. The restaurant is always busy, however, as it is comparatively cheap. The barbecue itself is an experience, you grill yourself at your table on small charcoal grills, we tried beef and pork, both very nicely marinated and nicely flavorful! In conclusion, it's not for a quiet dinner for two, but if you like grilled food and a good beer, you're in good hands here.

Great place for cook your own bbq - great atmosphere and service. Ordered the eggplant which was amazing along with the morning glory with garlic. For the bbq the pork and beef were both delicious but the octopus was very tough. The accompanying sauces were all delicious too. Beers were ice cold.

name: ST25 by KOTO
address: L√™ Du·∫©n/17 Ward B·∫øn Ngh√©, Qu·∫≠n 1, Ho Chi Minh City 700000 Vietnam
description: ST25 by KOTO pays tribute to the renowned Vietnamese rice variety, ST25, which earned the prestigious title of "World's Best Rice" in 2019, representing the essence of Vietnamese culture. It's a place where every meal can be a force for good, where the quintessence of Vietnamese cuisine and the mission of contributing to community development go hand in hand.
review_summary:
ST25 by KOTO garners high praise from patrons for providing exceptional value, with its high-quality, flavor-rich dishes and commendable social mission. Guests have called out the staff's attentiveness and warmth, enhancing the dining experience.

The restaurant's atmosphere is often described as stylish and luxurious, perfect for both intimate dinners and group gatherings. Moreover, the fusion of traditional Vietnamese flavors with contemporary twists in the food presentation consistently earns rave reviews from travelers.
example_reviews: We were looking for a romantic setting with Vietnamese cuisine, knowing how much my girlfriend loves Vietnamese dishes. As Vietnamese ourselves, we‚Äôve tasted countless dishes across the country, but KotoSt25 redefined our palate of how Vietnamese cuisine can be presented in such an elegant and exuberant setting. We opted for a set menu at Koto, which was authentically Vietnamese, rich in flavors that brought us back home, yet delivered with a Western twist that elevated our dining experience. Every bite was a rediscovery, from the spring rolls with well-braised Vietnamese-style Wagyu beef to the perfectly steamed ST25 rice. My girlfriend indulged in three cocktails, each beautifully mixed and served, with the standout being the ‚ÄúCanh Chua‚Äù‚Äî which amazes us enough as its taste uniquely captured quiet much resemblance to the Vietnamese tomato soup but still fit itself nicely to indulge as a cocktail. Staffs were incredibly attentive, friendly, and took lots of their effort to explain the ingredients and stories behind each dish (though we barely remembered all the details üòÇ). Their warmth made us feel truly appreciated and cherished. We were even greeted by the hotel‚Äôs GM and the restaurant manager, who made their rounds to ensure every guest was enjoying their meal‚Äîa truly memorable touch. It was a night that brought us even closer as a couple, and we would highly recommend KotoSt25 to anyone looking to share a lovely evening with their loved one.

Lovely dinner with braised Australian wagyu beef cheek spring rolls and the Halong Bay oysters for entrees. Springs rolls were hot, flavourful, and a nice start, as were the oysters, which were huge. Our mains were the slow roasted half bbq chicken and the crispy pork belly porchetta with seasonal asian greens and the fried rice with mushrooms and baby corn. The bbq chicken was well worth the wait and was tender, moist, and full of flavour while the porchetta was very tasty but huge and more than enough for two people. Finally, our desserts were rice pudding and the pandan waffle with strawberries, cream, and soursop ice cream. The coconut and mango rice pudding was the best we ever tasted with a beautiful texture and was simply genius. The waffle for me was the perfect finish to a lovely meal. Our server, Thuy / Mille was friendly, patient and very attentive with a very strong interpersonal skills. Very approachsble and professional at the same time. 10/10

Large open kitchen restaurant with lovely attentive staff, explained the dishes when presented etc etc topped up water when the glasses got low. Food was fantastic, we had the half chicken (knowing it would take 45min) and some Asian greens and of course a bowl of ST25 rice. Spring rolls for entree were great, full of beef and a great way to start. Was offered to have greens and rice whilst we wait for the main but chosen to have it together. Fantastic flavours and topped it off with dessert. We would def come back here again. Looking forward to it already. At the time of our visit they were open for lunch but only on weekends. Last dinner orders taken I think was 1030pm so a great option for late dinner. Accor Plus discount applied, I think the max discount was 30% food and the usual 20% for drinks)

name: Secret Garden - Vietnamese Restaurant
address: 158 Pasteur, Ho Chi Minh City 70000 Vietnam
description: Secret Garden 158 Pasteur is the original restaurant established since 2012 offering patrons signature home-cooked Vietnamese dishes and drinks, located on the rooftop of old building in town as a perfect view of the whole city life in day and night time.
example_reviews: We recently tried the Vietnamese rice pancake with mushroom, and it exceeded our expectations. The pancake was perfectly crispy on the outside, while the mushrooms added a burst of earthy flavors. It was a delightful combination that left us craving for more! What sets Secret Garden Restaurant apart is not only the delectable food, but also the affordable prices. You can enjoy a fulfilling meal without breaking the bank, which is a rare find in such a bustling city. The ambiance of the restaurant is charming, with a cozy garden setting that creates a tranquil atmosphere amidst the hustle and bustle of the city. The attentive staff were friendly and knowledgeable, eager to provide suggestions and ensure our dining experience was enjoyable.

It would be very easy to think the directions / location were wrong for this restaurant as you walk down a semi dark lane and then you find yourself climbing up a stairs past many busy apartments occupied by local Ho Chin Minn families. However, on arriving at the semi open roof top restaurant you are greeted by welcoming staff of this atmospheric culinary experience. Food was superb set out a very comprehensive menu. Can highly recommend but again, trust the directions üëç

Looking for a delectable dining experience that won't break the bank? Look no further than Secret Garden Restaurant. The affordable prices and generous portions ensure you get a satisfying meal for a reasonable price. The attentive and helpful staff are knowledgeable about the menu, making sure you get exactly what you desire. The authentic Vietnamese cuisine, made with fresh ingredients, will leave you craving for more.

name: Octo Tapas Restobar
address: 75 Ho Tung Mau 2nd Floor, Ho Chi Minh City 700000 Vietnam
description: Here to kick off a country with spanish food frenzy!! Highest quality ingredients married with modern techniques and exquisite style!! In the heart of Saigon, the first premier Spanish open kitchen experience! Most extensive Spanish winelist in Vietnam with over 65 vineyards to choose from!
example_reviews: Went here on the complete off chance. My wife found it looking on the internet as she fancied some tapas and it did not disappoint. Food and service was excellent. The waitress was very helpful and would not let us over order and the food arrived in the perfect amount of time. Not too quick but slow enough to know it was all being prepared freshly. Open kitchen so you can see the action. Very clean and a very nice ambiance. Would highly recommend the sucking pig.

Excellent food , tasty small plates to share. You won‚Äôt get tired of the same flavors ( like in a large portion) try lots of different and interesting dishes. The waiters are very friendly and attentive, and good suggestions if you‚Äôre not sure what to try. Open kitchen was fun to watch the dishes being prepared! We went there twice and was not disappointed!

Our group of 6 selected the We Pick, You Eat 6 course tapas menu for 900k/per person and it did not disappoint. Everything was delicious and the service excellent. Our only complaint and it's a small one, was that the wait time between dishes was quite long.

name: Dogalbi Saigon
address: 31e L√Ω T·ª± Tr·ªçng, Ph∆∞·ªùng B·∫øn Ngh√©, Qu·∫≠n 1, Tp. H·ªì Ch√≠ Minh, Ho Chi Minh City 700000 Vietnam
description:
Probably the best meal we have ate in our two weeks in Vietnam. We have been to Korean grills before in the uk but they do not compare to this.

The service was fantastic from start to finish. A waiter cooks the food on the grill for you are the table which ensures it is cooked to perfection.

The quality of the meat was fantastic and it all came in big steaks (rather than the little slivers we are used to in uk grills). There was so much food that we could not eat it all and we have big appetites!! They keep bringing the little plates and sauces out as soon as they see an empty pot

Would highly recommend this place. The prices are brilliant too and there was more food than we could eat.

10/10 from us!ü•∞ü•∞ü•∞
example_reviews: Probably the best meal we have ate in our two weeks in Vietnam. We have been to Korean grills before in the uk but they do not compare to this. The service was fantastic from start to finish. A waiter cooks the food on the grill for you are the table which ensures it is cooked to perfection. The quality of the meat was fantastic and it all came in big steaks (rather than the little slivers we are used to in uk grills). There was so much food that we could not eat it all and we have big appetites!! They keep bringing the little plates and sauces out as soon as they see an empty pot Would highly recommend this place. The prices are brilliant too and there was more food than we could eat. 10/10 from us!ü•∞ü•∞ü•∞

We were taken to this place by a local employee... the place looked nice but the food was way too expensive. She ordered japanes wagyu beef, black pork mini burgers... I was surprised because it was delicious, the meat was fresh, soft and sweet... We've been to other Korean places downtown and we found them to be even better here than the original. Wow Korean restaurants in Vietnam are better than Korea, very surprising!

Really good option if you're looking for something a little bit different to the local food but don't want to go for the stock options of Pizza, Burger, Pasta. We ordered a Combo meal - so a selection of different meats BBQ'd on the hot coals in front of us and it came with a wide selection of Korean style sides. Very filling and overall and excellent option. Unlike Korean BBQ I have been to in the UK/Ireland, the food is cooked for you and in front of you.üëçüèºüëçüèºüëçüèº

name: Viet Kitchen
address: 8-15 Ton Duc Thang Street Renaissance Riverside Hotel Saigon, District 1, Ho Chi Minh City 700000 Vietnam
description: Viet Kitchen is a trendy lifestyle-driven dining and networking spot in Ho Chi Minh City, where modern design and ambiance meet traditional and global flavors. International dishes combined with local Vietnamese flavors offer a unique, innovative take on classic cuisines near and far. Fresh produce, exotic herbs, and international favorites come together in our crowd favorites. Coupled with warm and friendly service, the venue‚Äôs funky design and communal tables make space a social hub for those wanting a high-paced, tasty lunch or an indulgent dinner with friends and loved ones.
example_reviews: The chef's food is very delicious and diverse, the service is very attentive, and the staff are very cute Thank you Manager for being very enthusiastic and applying the 2-for-1 program for our group Will definitely recommend friends and colleagues to experience it, the price is very reasonable for a lunch at a 5-star hotel.

We were warmly greeted by the host and watched the food being prepared and cooked in an open kitchen. Our host chose for us and the food was first class, ample in size and very well priced. Family atmosphere , not pretentious and well worth a visit

This restaurant has great food and if you are staying at the hotel you get 20% off. Specifically, we felt our server named Phat was outstanding. Truly above and beyond, one of the kindest most genuine people I‚Äôve experienced in the service industry. Thank you to him and to the amazing staff for making us feel so welcome.

name: The Olive Steakhouse
address: 151 Dong Khoi, Ben Nghe Ward, District 1 2nd Floor, Ho Chi Minh City 700000 Vietnam
description: The Olive is where everything is made from quality ingredients. Right in the heart of downtown Saigon and with only 7 tables in our restaurant, we are able to focus on providing excellent service in a cozy environment.
example_reviews: Looking at older reviews I had become a little worried, but after being served two beautiful medium rare pieces of meat by a lovely waitress, I'm happy to say this is a lovely little spot found in the art arcade in saigon. With wonderful service from the staff and pleasant Aussie cuts of beef which are about A3 rating. As someone who normally enjoys a good rib eye fillet or sirloin cut at home along with tomahawk, I know when I'm eating a well cut and cooked piece of meat. I highly reccomend the second serving platter consisting of a 350g rib eye and 350g sirloin which is cheaper than buying them separately. These also come with 2 complimentary side dishes, I don't reccomend the potato wedges and it would be a sin to eat such good quality meat with the mac and cheese, highly reccomend the sauted mushrooms. Don't be afraid to try a red with these lovely cuts as it develops overtime. To us, this was a wonderful experience with calming atmosphere.

Really great food. -I went back a second time. (And I heard the table near mine raving about how good their meals were as well) Excellent service. When you rock up with an allergy list nearly as long as your arm and they accommodate that. You know the waiting staff are attentive, when you order a drink and they bring it to you, without ice, because that is how you ordered it the other time. You know they paid attention when it comes to ordering the side and they say 'you didn't eat the mushrooms last time would you like to try the salad or something else this time?' Cute location too.

Absolutely delicious meal, my husband had the wagyu steak which was cooked to perfection and I had the beef steak with rose cream pasta which came with a whole steak! Absolutely delicious, wonderful ambience and lovely host. I would highly reccomend coming here over the commercial restaurants on the square. Thank you very much!

name: Anan Saigon
address: 89 Ton That Dam Street, Ho Chi Minh City 710000 Vietnam
description: About Anan Saigon: The name of the restaurant is ƒÉnƒÉn, which also means ‚Äòeat eat‚Äô. It is located in Ch·ª£ C≈© T√¥n Th·∫•t ƒê·∫°m, a wet market right in the center of bustling Saigon. We specialize in street food-inspired dishes created by the award-winning chef Peter Cuong Franklin. Chef Peter‚Äôs creative Vietnamese cuisine reflects his vision of a Vietnam that is deeply respectful of its history and traditions yet progressive and international in its outlook. He takes inspiration from the country‚Äôs vibrant food culture and uses fresh ingredients often sourced from local markets while incorporating French culinary techniques. The result is a focused menu of deeply flavorsome dishes that are all intended to pair perfectly with our bar‚Äôs diverse selection of local craft beers, carefully curated wines, and tropical inspired cocktails.
example_reviews: Genuinely excellent food, a class above most fine dining restaurants and it was absolutely delicious throughout. I‚Äôd strongly encourage a trip even at the high costs, but‚Ä¶ Two things stick out to me: 1. I‚Äôm still hungry. Every dish of the tasting menu was very small, and despite being very tasty I‚Äôd have gladly had a decent amount more food even if it meant sacrificing a dish or two to balance the costs. 2. A little bit of a bitter taste left in my mouth by the staff at the end. We‚Äôd made a point to ask for the bill early and to pay quickly because we had somewhere to be, yet they genuinely seemed to be making no effort to facilitate this (and indeed collecting payment from other tables ahead of us even though they were clearly not finished with their food/drinks and in one case had just had fresh drinks delivered). Overall though despite these (meaningfully frustrating) complaints I can‚Äôt bring myself to go less than five stars because the food really was exceptional.

This was an excellent Michelin star experience. Know that it‚Äôs not like say an Alinia in Chicago, it‚Äôs a casual but food centric pleasure in a Vietnamese food market sort of way. Think like say Direkte Boqueria in Barcelona,(but at a typically lower Viet price point). The premises are very tall and very narrow but they manage to space everyone out in an appropriate way. They even quickly upgraded us to the air conditioned first floor from the breezy rooftop We opted for an √† la cart experience although there were several rave reviews about the more expensive mixed fixed menus. The Foi Gras egg roll, while small, was loaded with taste. The duck mango salad was perfectly seasoned and very ample. My wife and I then shared the main course, choosing the pork chop specialty. Very tasty and tender. A nice surprise dessert cake for our anniversary, along with the fish sauce caramel vanilla ice cream topped off our meal and sent us off very happy and very satiated As I said, simply adjust your lense from an elegant high end Michelin to a casual but very flavourful Michelin experience. It‚Äôs all part of the fun. By the way, the staffing was very ample, all knowledgeable, warm and efficient.

Service and food are very good at this S√†i G√≤n Michelin star eatery. The layout is on five floors, all small spaces. We ate in the roof- dry pleasant. Creative cocktails, tho‚Äô my berry mocktail was too sweet for my taste. The fried rolls of shrimp & crab were terrific, and the deep fried fish was delicious, with the meat served in chunks on the crisp body of the whole fish. Plating of all the dishes was creative. We felt the vanilla ice cream dessert with fish sauce was a bit much-excessive showmanship that bordered on tacky. That sauce was served in a little cologne spray bottle. Fish sauce by DiorüòÇ? The food here is expensive, which it always has been. 6 of us ate for more than $200, and we did not order wine, just drinks. I‚Äôll still return here for a special occasion & memorable meal.

name: Hum Lounge
address: 34 V√µ VƒÉn T·∫ßn, Ho Chi Minh City 70000 Vietnam
description: Hum Lounge offers a cozy, tranquil atmosphere amidst the hustle of District 3. We are proud to pioneer a plant-based cuisine with fresh vegetables, flowers, beans, nuts, and fruits sourced from local regions and prepared new on-site daily. There is no artificial flavoring; we only add creativity and attentiveness to our dishes. Check out the drinks, too - they complement the food in intriguing ways that will please both your eyes and palette. Last but never least, our team maintains the highest hospitality standard every minute of the hour. Whether for a large gathering or a personal meeting, your time with Hum will delight the senses.
example_reviews: I went to this vegetarian restaurant with friends, relaxing and welcoming atmosphere, attentive to detail. We tasted dishes at the beginning of the dinner, which we shared (fried tuber, potato type ..) and each we chose a dish (fried rice with mushrooms, rice with pineapple and raisins ..). All very good, accompanied by fruit drinks (orange, lime and pineapple). Recommended dinner to enjoy a different evening, from the usual bars that are in the city. Cost for the city above average, we spent about 25 ‚Ç¨ each. Recommended!!

The photos people have shared are excellent, but there‚Äôs so much more to experiencing all that is this building and what goes on within. The food is on another level when it comes to creativity and deliciousness. The design of the interior design compliments the beauty of the plates being served. The staff are outstanding. The photos are outstanding, but the smells and flavors are something you must experience yourself.

After a stressful day, Hum truly felt like an oasis of peace. The atmosphere was calming, and the food was amongst the best we've ever tasted, with plenty of delicious vegan options to choose from. The staff were wonderful, going out of their way to help us select the perfect dishes. Special thanks to Phoung Vu for his exceptional hospitality‚Äîhe looked after us so well, making sure we were 100% happy and satisfied throughout our meal. It was a dining experience we won't forget, and we highly recommend Hum to anyone seeking incredible food and warm service.

name: Ngon 138 Restaurant (Qu√°n Ngon 138)
address: 138 Nam Ky Khoi Nghia Ward Ben Nghe, District 3, Ho Chi Minh City 700000 Vietnam
description: Ngon 138 Restaurant is located in the heart of Saigon, in an ancient house of Hue, and offers a rich and delicious banquet menu since 2001. It is ideal for organizing event parties for friends, partners, and company year-ends, as it brings together all the typical dishes of the country under one roof. It has been a reliable destination for many locals and foreigners who love Vietnamese food.
example_reviews: Central location, atmosphere of a rich man‚Äôs home in the countryside, and most comprehensive menu of typical dishes from all regions of Vietnam. Only missing are fertilised egg embryos (tr·ª©ng v·ªãt l·ªôn or balut in the Philippines). None of the dishes is the best in its category, but they‚Äôre all pretty good. Excellent service from friendly staff. Prices are very reasonable; ignore comments from cheapskates who would be better home eating at the market or just staying home!

We ate here twice during our stay. First time we ordered nine dishes as we didn‚Äôt have a clue about Vietnamese food. Next time we went we had a better idea on what and how much to order. The prawns were excellent and the waitress put on gloves and peeled them for us. Very informal dining but a lovely way to spend an evening. I would class it as outside dining and maybe the floor could be cleaner but that‚Äôs down to untidy diners. First evening was ¬£40 nine dishes, bottle of wine and two beers. Second time ¬£32 less dishes same amount of drink.

No air conditioning, but plenty of fans to keep cool. Right across the street from the Independence Palace. Good place for lunch, but also okay for dinner. This place is rather informal in a good way. Menu has lots of pictures and English translations of each dish. Perfect restaurant to experience local cuisine in a setting that isn‚Äôt too fancy (not like those white tablecloth french colonial restaurants). The menu is quite extensive‚Äîlike the Cheesecake Factory in the USA, so you can try a variety of Vietnamese exotic dishes if you‚Äôre feeling adventurous. Bathrooms reasonably clean.

name: Reflections Restaurant
address: 19-23 C√¥ng tr∆∞·ªùng Lam S∆°n 3rd Floor, Caravelle Hotel, Ho Chi Minh City 70000 Vietnam
description: A fine-dining restaurant with a cosmopolitan outlook, Reflections‚Äô award-winning team is dedicated to serving creative dishes from around the world to diners in the heart of Saigon. Claiming a discreet perspective above one of the city‚Äôs most prominent intersections, this third-floor restaurant is a fitting space to reflect on the changing faces of Vietnam. Photographs on the walls pay tribute to Saigon‚Äôs heritage, and patrons have a front row view of the lights of Lam Son Square and the Saigon Opera House. Enhanced by the warm, intuitive service the Caravelle is known for, Reflections aims to create a magical, memorable dining experience every time.
example_reviews: The quality of the food was very good and the service attentive and prompt. We enjoyed the setting and the fact that there was no loud or inappropriate music. Less agreeable was the fact that all courses of a three course lunch were served on a tray simultaneously. This inevitably meant that the main course was cold by the time we had consumed the entr√©es. Perhaps the management interpreted a Business Lunch as placing the emphasis on speed and efficiency. In our judgement this should be reviewed in favour of a "course by course" serving approach rather than "all at once". (The day we ate there were only a handful of other diners so there was no time pressure on the staff.) This would considerably have enhanced our enjoyment.

First class service in a building of a long and vital heritage. The menu was well combined und delicious prepared while everything was of a high quality standard fitting to the higher prices here. Especially if you search for a location which is quiet and has a great view this restaurant is a good pick.

I feel quite satisfied I suggest that the lamb dish in the set needs more fat in the sauce. Because sheep don't eat dry food. Dessert and appetizers are okay for me The waiters here are very cute, Tran is very enthusiastic and gives thoughtful advice

name: M·∫∑n M√≤i - Tao ƒê√†n
address: 34 Vo Van Tan Vo Thi Sau Ward, District 3, Ho Chi Minh City 70000 Vietnam
description: M·∫∑n M√≤i serves authentic Vietnamese cuisine, which we relish. Having set foot in foreign lands, we've come to appreciate local, homely dishes even more. This is our reason for opening this bistro to share our love for Vietnamese delicacies with friends worldwide. Let us share a few notes here and there about the origins of our dishes so that your meal takes on this air of leisure. We draw inspiration from the hearty meals our Grandmothers and Mothers prepared and select the freshest local produce to turn into homely dishes, be it a salad, a stew, a soup, or a dessert. We do everything with care because we want to convey the elegance of Vietnamese cuisine and the warm hospitality of Vietnamese people. Please note that we also have a takeaway option. If you can't dine in, ask our staff to wrap savory Saigon delicacies to enjoy at home. May you have a festive meal.
example_reviews: Second visit to this restaurant and really worth the trip: DELICIOUS, fine, tasty. Bcp people but it was Friday night, better book. After a small papaya salad with beef jerky grilled absolutely divine and to finish in style of banana grilled with coconut juice and here even the decoration and service were at the rendezvous.

Excellent service and amazing food. We ordered several dishes to taste and all of them 10/10. We were told we were ordering too much food for 2 people so they advised us which dishes to remove, which proves they care about customer satisfaction over financial gain. Loyal to the service and the food. The building itself is unique and deserves a mention. Highly recommend if you find yourself in Saigon!

This restaurant is fabulous from the stunning external design, the interior decoration, the interesting menu and the helpful and attentive staff. We had been recommended to this restaurant by some travellers we met in Hoi An. When we got to HCMC we tried to book online but there was no availability. We took a gamble and turned up shortly after opening time and helpfully they managed to fit us in. Ms Nhu Lam patiently helped us through the interesting local menu and we had a chicken with sticky rice under a dome, a beef dish, some greens and from memory we had a rice dish with duck. They really get the attention to detail right without being over fussy. Mr Phuong Vu and his team do a great job!

name: Towa - Japanese Cuisine & Lounge
address: 92-94 Nam Ky Khoi Nghia Saigon Centre, Level 28, Ho Chi Minh City 700000 Vietnam
description: Towa offers an interpretation of the art of Japanese cuisine through originality and flavor. Our guests are encouraged to discover or rediscover the authentic Japanese cuisine alongside classic Ginza Style Japanese Cocktails known for their minimalism and sublime attention to details in an intimate ambiance. Towa's uniqueness makes it an unforgettable visit where a wealth of sensory experiences
example_reviews: The food is great. We had a set menu and it was delivered without to much waiting times and tasted great. Service was very punctual and able to explain all the varieties of food. It is on the 28th floor so the view is great and the restaurant is decorated nicely. I do think they could choose different type of music with more ambiance, but it is not loud, so this didn‚Äôt bother me too much.

Beautiful location with a great view of the city. Right in the center next to the shopping mall so it was convenient. We came for the omakase experience and it was around $100 per person which was reasonably priced and the food was delicious. I thought it was little at first but by the time we finish the whole tasting, I was so full. Hung, our server, was very attentive and took good care of us. My husband loved it and we would come back next time we are in the city.

A very upmarket dining experience in a private Japanese dining room just for the two of us (yes, shoes had to come off before entering, tatami mats everywhere). We could order from two menus one Japanese ‚ÄúTowa‚Äù, the other Cantonese ‚ÄúLai‚Äù. We started off with an incredible sashimi spread prepared by Towa‚Äôs chef before moving onto a selection of Cantonese dishes from Lai and finished up with a huge bowl of fruit. There is also a great selection of teas available by the pot in the Towa drinks menu if like me, that is your preference over alcohol. Tonight a perfect pot of black Oolong tea was a great match to the cuisine. Faultless service, Delicious food, Great atmosphere. What else could you ask for?

name: Banh Mi Huynh Hoa
address: 26 Le Thi Rieng P. Ben Thanh, Q.1 26 - 30 - 32 L√™ Th·ªã Ri√™ng, P. B·∫øn Th√†nh, Q. 1, Tp. Hcm, Ho Chi Minh City 700000 Vietnam
description:
I think this is one of the most well-known banh mi in HCMC. I went there late at night, roughly 9 pm., there was a queue (10 people)  so we joined. The queue processed fast, as there was only one thing to order, one banh mi costed 68,000 VND and the queue for walk-in order was separated from food delivery. Then we were moved to another queue after payment, where we would get bahn mi with separated vegetables, pickles and cucumber.

You can also ask the staff to cut bahn mi in half so it‚Äôs easier for you to share. Eating whole banh mi is too much for me, so I think half for a meal is about right.

It was meaty, there were at least 4-5 types of meat and sausages inside. My recommendation is to open the sandwich and put all the pickles and vegetables in it, since the vegetables like coriander, spring onion and pickles added such a nice touch. The green chilli (came mixed with the vegetable) might be too spicy for some westerners, but it spiked the flavour. If you don‚Äôt like spicy, please try to pick it off the vegetable before you add the vegetable to the filling.

Overall, it‚Äôs a big hit for me. I‚Äôd definitely come back or else, I would order Grab to my hotel next time in HCMC.
example_reviews: I think this is one of the most well-known banh mi in HCMC. I went there late at night, roughly 9 pm., there was a queue (10 people) so we joined. The queue processed fast, as there was only one thing to order, one banh mi costed 68,000 VND and the queue for walk-in order was separated from food delivery. Then we were moved to another queue after payment, where we would get bahn mi with separated vegetables, pickles and cucumber. You can also ask the staff to cut bahn mi in half so it‚Äôs easier for you to share. Eating whole banh mi is too much for me, so I think half for a meal is about right. It was meaty, there were at least 4-5 types of meat and sausages inside. My recommendation is to open the sandwich and put all the pickles and vegetables in it, since the vegetables like coriander, spring onion and pickles added such a nice touch. The green chilli (came mixed with the vegetable) might be too spicy for some westerners, but it spiked the flavour. If you don‚Äôt like spicy, please try to pick it off the vegetable before you add the vegetable to the filling. Overall, it‚Äôs a big hit for me. I‚Äôd definitely come back or else, I would order Grab to my hotel next time in HCMC.

A friend recommended this place to us and said "it's the best Banh Mi you'll ever have" and he was not wrong!
