Stopped here for lunch with family of 5. English menu available we had steak / ribs/ special rice with chicken. Good portions although rather too much sauce on the steak. Delicious cocktails too. Entrance hidden behind a large food stall.

The restaurant ambience is typical local. The food is good ( their speciality as beef are good) The Personal is playing with their phone instead of doing the service witch is pity because can be a very good place. The place is on the first floor

name: King BBQ Hai Ba Trung
address: 20 Hai Ba Trung Hoan Kiem, Hanoi 100000 Vietnam
description: King BBQ is the brand of a Korean barbecue restaurant chain developed by Redsun-ITI Corporation bringing original Korean cuisine to Vietnamese customers. What makes the difference from these other restaurants is the food, especially Korean popular barbeque beef made by 40-year-experienced Korean Chef Park Sung Min.
cuisines: Late Night Sushi Restaurants in Hanoi
Late Night Vietnamese Restaurants in Hanoi
example_reviews: Meats bbq perfectly by staff who can speak Chinese. Very satisfied with service of a 20years old waitress that recommended us on what to order from our buffet menu. My family enjoyed our dinner.
we had fun, beer and BBQ. staff was friendly. let us stay longer than opening hours. Korean style but finally we can get hot chilli
The men and women here are friendly and also the service is fantastic. One of the better locations for BBQ around Hoan Kiem Lake. Thank you King BBQ for the entire great experience.

name: Green Inn - Plant-based Restaurant
address: 41 H√†ng N√≥n, Hanoi Vietnam
description: A Haven In The Heart Of Hanoi. Located on Hang Non Street, bustling in the heart of Hanoi, Green Inn always strives to create a sense of tranquility and gentleness for diners when they come to enjoy their meal. Like a sanctuary for vegetarian souls seeking tranquility amidst the bustling and crowded Old Quarter, Green Inn serves as a place for those looking for peace in the heart of the lively ancient streets. As you step through that small wooden door, it seems like all the noise has been left behind. Bringing Vietnamese Culinary Culture To Foreigners. Green Inn not only aims to promote the growing popularity of vegetarianism among everyone but also hopes that foreign guests, who follow a vegetarian diet, can still enjoy traditional Vietnamese dishes. That's why Green Inn aims to offer Vietnamese dishes with familiar and refined flavors. All vegetarian dishes at Green Inn are inspired by traditional Vietnamese cuisine, adjusted to suit different palates.
cuisines: German Restaurants for Lunch in Hanoi
example_reviews: The outside made us want to dine in this restaurant. We did the right thing. The welcome was very good. Being 8 people, we found a table in a quiet place. The mushrooms in donuts were excellent. For dessert we asked for fresh fruit that was not on the menu. We had 3 different kinds of fruit. Very good experience in a vegetarian restaurant for carnivores.

I found this restaurant by coincidence and it was the last and also by far the best meal during my four weeks in Vietnam. I went to the lunch buffet that takes place 3 times a week and the all vegan food was amazing. The best Pho in my life, phantastic choise of vegetables, mock fish and meat, even desert. 95.000 Duong including green tea! Everything had a different and unique taste. I took another portion away for a friend and they were extremely generous by giving me all kind of food containers. I just wish I had discovered this restaurant on my first day in H√† Noi.

The restaurant creates a peaceful ambiance, even though it is situated in one of the most bustling areas of Hanoi. The cuisine is delightful, healthy, and cooked with minimal oil, making it both satisfying and easy to digest. What's even better is the reasonable price (we have three girls and order 5 dishes and 3 drinks). Strongly recommend !

name: Banh Mi Zoon - Bami Bread
address: 33 Ngo Huyen Str Hang Trong Ward, Hoan Kiem Dist, Hanoi 100000 Vietnam
description: We are one of the best restaurants in Hanoi. Our Banh Mi (Vietnamese Bread) are most special about taste, materials, etc and famoust with foreign travelers who come to Hanoi. We make sure will bring all best quality of Vietnamese breads to our customers. Please come for enjoying our Banh Mi !
example_reviews: It is good to taste the cake here. The menu offers a wide variety of sandwiches that you can order or choose from. The food is reasonably priced.
The sandwiches at this place are hard to beat. The menu offers many custom made sandwiches you won't find elsewhere. Price is equal to other places.
We had the pork/pate banh mi and it was by far the most delicious enjoyed to date. Even better, there were no issues with my hubby's "delicate" tummy.

name: Long Phung Restaurant
address: Rd Hoang Dao Thuy 2nd Floor, 29T2 Tower, Hanoi 100000 Vietnam
description: The Chinese Cuisine has long been famous around the world. With its thousand-year history, the art of Chinese cooking is saturated with cultural impacts and uniqueness. Learning from its neighbours‚Äô cookery, Long Phung Restaurant with its finest Chinese chefs, working with passionate, creative Vietnamese cooks, creates an interesting mix of Chinese dishes that can satisfy the Vietnamese‚Äôs palette.
cuisines: French Restaurants for Lunch in Hanoi
German Restaurants for Lunch in Hanoi
example_reviews: I was recommended this restaurant by a friend but I was totally disappointed. Service is not good, the waitress, at least the one who served us was not happy and conscientious. Most of the dishes are very oily and heavy as Chinese cooking style, but the seasoning is good enough. Space is quite small, and environment is very noisy (due to the guests).
Not very good, bad sausage, rice okay, chicken, beef not good, soup a little better. If I go again, I won't go, not delicious, expensive, few dishes, bad. General opinion.

name: Pho Vui
address: 25 Hang Giay Hang Buom, Hoan Kiem, Hanoi 100000 Vietnam
description:
The restaurant is located in the busy area of the Old Quarters Hanoi near the busy Beer Street area. Family-run business. This is one of the local foodie blogger's favorites.

The large stock pot simmering in an open kitchen. Plastic tables with low stools spread out on the sidewalk. I ordered the Jumbo Special bowl. It is topped with sliced beef, fatty briskets. The broth is clear but beefy very rich taste, on the sweet side, and must be for simmering the beef bones and bone marrow. Squeeze some lime, add chile and some pickled garlic to take it up another notch. Make sure to order the quay, the fried chinese donut and dip it in. You can order lemon tea and some strong coffee from the lady across and she will bring it to your table.

The lady is happy with a smile and made sure that I enjoyed my bowl. Well-maintained and clean.
example_reviews: The restaurant is located in the busy area of the Old Quarters Hanoi near the busy Beer Street area. Family-run business. This is one of the local foodie blogger's favorites. The large stock pot simmering in an open kitchen. Plastic tables with low stools spread out on the sidewalk. I ordered the Jumbo Special bowl. It is topped with sliced beef, fatty briskets. The broth is clear but beefy very rich taste, on the sweet side, and must be for simmering the beef bones and bone marrow. Squeeze some lime, add chile and some pickled garlic to take it up another notch. Make sure to order the quay, the fried chinese donut and dip it in. You can order lemon tea and some strong coffee from the lady across and she will bring it to your table. The lady is happy with a smile and made sure that I enjoyed my bowl. Well-maintained and clean.

As a westerner with over 75 trips to Hanoi and my favorite cuisine being Pho Bo, I feel somewhat now ready to give this review. I have eaten hundreds of bowls of Pho Bo around Hanoi over the past 15 years and many bowls at Pho Vui, the happy pho place. They have the best. It is without question my favourite. I go back, and back and back again. Consistent every time and beautiful üòç
I order big mix beef pho on 12h pm, the portion is bigger than I thing. Its really delisious flavorful and alot of topping . Highly recommend for all guy visiting Hanoi

name: Buffet Poseidon Times City
address: H·∫ßm B1, Tttm Vincom Mega Mall Times City, 458 Minh Khai, Hai B√† Tr∆∞ng,, Hanoi Vietnam
description: Buffet Poseidon is the largest chain of hotpot, BBQ, and seafood buffet restaurants in Vietnam. Inspired by Poseidon, the Greek god of the sea, the brand is dedicated to bringing a diverse and exquisite culinary experience to all diners. At Poseidon, guests can enjoy a lavish selection of over 200 meticulously crafted dishes, with premium seafood as the highlight, including crabs, lobsters, mantis shrimp, sea snails, salmon, shrimp, squid, and many more delicacies. Diners are invited to indulge in an unlimited feast, featuring a fusion of Asian and European flavors, expertly prepared by top-tier chefs, ensuring an unforgettable gourmet experience.
cuisines: Mediterranean Restaurants for Lunch in Hanoi
Mexican Restaurants for Lunch in Hanoi

name: C·ªßi Restaurant
address: 31 Hoang Cau street No 3, Alley 31, Hanoi Vietnam
description: A Southern Vietnamese restaurant in the heart of Hanoi which offer an authentic taste in a green and quiet place with a nice touch of Indochina d√©cor. Ideal corner for: - Business dinerA Southern Vietnamese restaurant in the heart of Hanoi which offer an authentic taste in a green and quiet place with a nice touch of Indochina d√©cor. Ideal corner for: - Business dining - Couple - Friends & Family And for expat and international travelers to taste the authentic Northern Vietnamese food in the heart of capital.
example_reviews: Wow that was delicious! The restaurant is beautiful and the service was excellent. We were grateful for the man on the street who had signs in English asking if we were looking for the restaurant. There‚Äôs no signage and even though google maps showed us it was very helpful to have his confirmation that we were in the right place.

name: 37 H√πng V∆∞∆°ng Restaurant
address: 37A Hung Vuong, Dien Bien, Ba Dinh, Hanoi 100000 Vietnam
description: H·ªá th·ªëng Nh√† h√†ng 37 H√πng V∆∞∆°ng g·ªìm nhi·ªÅu c∆° s·ªü v·ªõi m√≥n Ph·ªü, v√† c√°c m√≥n ngon Vi·ªát Nam ƒë∆∞·ª£c gi·ªõi thi·ªáu phong ph√∫ v√† ƒë·∫∑c s·∫Øc.
cuisines: French Restaurants with Private Dining in Hanoi
German Restaurants for Lunch in Hanoi
example_reviews: Everything in this restaurant tasted authentically Vietnamese and deliciously good! We ordered a feast and I super enjoyed the oysters! The staff were friendly and helpful. Especially the beautiful young lady at the reception. She took excellent photos of me and my daughter!
Although the stone bowl pho is a bit expensive, it has delicious broth, supple noodles, fresh meat, expensive but suitable quality, you should try it!

Cheap bia hoi, 12.000VND‚Ä¶this is outside the main restaurant and is like a beer drinking hall. If you are Aussies/Euros come here for drinking but I would not recommend ordering food. I ordered spring rolls and instead received these pork things steamed in banana leaf‚Ä¶I ate 2 of them, chewy and not that nice. When I got the bill and asked about the spring rolls after lots of laughing I had eaten 2 steamed pig knobs, wangers doodles, p3n1s. As a tough Aussie bloke not normally a hat I eat but I more feel sorry for the 2 pigs more than myself. if you love a steamed pig knob, check out the photos.

name: TungLok Heen
address: Hoa Lan, Vinhomes Riverside Long Bien, Hanoi 10000 Vietnam
description: Head Chinese Chef Adrian Chua is Singaporean and puts on a culinary extravaganza in extravagant surroundings. His presentations are spellbinding and served up by an amazing staff. Vui, Hien, and Nhan made our visit especially memorable.  Kudos for assembling a world-class team.
example_reviews: Head Chinese Chef Adrian Chua is Singaporean and puts on a culinary extravaganza in extravagant surroundings. His presentations are spellbinding and served up by an amazing staff. Vui, Hien, and Nhan made our visit especially memorable. Kudos for assembling a world-class team.

This is one of my favourite restaurants in hanoi. I've been in tunglok Singapore twice so this place is really brought me the "wow" feeling like I was in Singapore The decor concept is remained, the food have the same taste and staffs here are really nice & helpful I just wonder why the restaurants is not so crowded as it should be. I think they should promote it more one social

i was here with my family 2 weeks ago by the recomendation of my friend. i had heard many "wow" before really in here tasting this awesome dimsum and indeed it did not let me down even a bit. The dimsum is served in the traditional way with a a steamer, thin crust, spicy sauce and alot of meet inside. we also order some other dishes but dimsum's still impressed me most the total payment is quite high for the daily meal but worth for an outside family lunch/dinner

name: Cousins Tran Quoc Toan
address: 19 ngoÃÉ Doan Nhu Hai, Hanoi 100000 Vietnam
description: Western Cantine and Bar
cuisines: German Restaurants for Lunch in Hanoi
example_reviews: If you're looking for western food at big-city western prices, I suppose you'll be happy. The ambiance here is really great. The service is impeccable. And the food was tasty - but the portions were really small for the high prices. The restaurant is located on a small, charming little alley. The bar is extensive but we didn't have alcohol. The pesto was delicious - but again, USD 2 for four tiny slices of ham was ridiculous.
Loved the extensive wine lists and their black squid ink risotto. Had a nice Prosecco to pair with and the bill was less than 60 for three people

My company had year end party in Cousins Tran Quoc Toan last Dec. Didnt know there‚Äôs a place like this in such a small valley Doan nhu hai. The resto was very warm and cozy, a fireplace during cold Hanoi weather inside a 100 years-old villa made our diner really impressive, not to mention we had great tarta beef and perfect trout with pasta. Since then, Cousins was one of my favorite place

name: Club Opera
address: 5 Dang Thai Than French Quarter, Hanoi Vietnam
description: Attentive service and tasty food. Had the usual spring rolls, bun cha and a very tasty mango salad. Ambience was lacking as it was dead - surprising for a Friday evening. At 60$ with no alcohol thought it was a bit pricey for Hanoi.
example_reviews: Attentive service and tasty food. Had the usual spring rolls, bun cha and a very tasty mango salad. Ambience was lacking as it was dead - surprising for a Friday evening. At 60$ with no alcohol thought it was a bit pricey for Hanoi.
Nice staff Starters are just alright nothing special Main course chicken was dry and cold very disappointing Not worthy of the price at all

We stumbled upon Club Opera while window shopping in the streets of the French Quarter. For hungry, clueless pedestrians, what a lucky find! Although we'd had several great food and dining experiences during our time in Vietnam, our dinner at this sweet little restaurant in Hanoi turned out to be the very best of all of them. In both flavor and presentation, our seafood dinners were excellent. We also very much enjoyed the ambience of the room which, similar to our hotel at the nearby Sofitel Legend Metropole, offers a historically elegant fusion of French and Vietnamese cultures. Like others, we agree that our meal was expensive by Vietnamese standards. Nevertheless, as New Yorkers enjoying a humongously generous USD-VND exchange rate, we cannot not fairly complain that our tab was inappropriate for such fine dining. We highly recommend Club Opera!

name: Khai's Brothers - The Hanoi Taste
address: 26 Nguyen Thai Hoc St., Hanoi 10000 Vietnam
description: The charming hundred year old temple at 26 Nguyen Thai Hoc Street. Khai's Brother is a wonderful destination that you really find a subtle service with the cultural treasure of Vietnamese cuisine in different traditional flavors. By the exclusive original tastes and dining experience, your feelings will be stylized as a part of the local followed by a variety of drinking, dishes offering under Lunch and Dinner Buffets
example_reviews: My first meal in Vietnam was lunch and what a treat. You enter the restaurant and out at the back there is a beautiful shaded courtyard with plenty of seating. Around the outside of the area is the food freshly prepared and cooked while you wait. It was very tasty and you could return to the buffet as many times as you wished. A good way to try local food and experience some new tastes. Staff very friendly and helpful.
We really enjoyed our options at this buffet style every style of cooking. Their patio is outstanding and setup is amazing.

Offering a range of traditional Vietnamese dishes, Khai's Brothers has a very pleasant atmosphere with good service and attentive staff. Whilst the prices were not as keen as other establishments in the locality, the setting is very relaxing and service was nicely paced.

They also have a few good wines, including by the glass.  Service was very efficient and quick.  This was a very nice dinner!

example_reviews: My daughter and I chanced upon this restaurant and thought it would be worth trying, given its clean and professional appearance, as well as its reasonable prices and moderate clientele. Upon entering, we were greeted warmly by the staff, who took the time to explain the menu and offer recommendations. We decided on the all-you-can-eat seafood option, which included complimentary water, although we did order additional drinks. We began by ordering a tower, and the waiter kindly offered to peel the prawns and crab for us. As we waited, we ordered another tower for four, and the food continued to arrive as we placed our orders. The cuisine was expertly prepared, aromatic, and flavorful. Dessert was also included in the meal. I would highly recommend this restaurant and was impressed by their desire for feedback on the service and food.

5 star Food fresh and delicious, choose more Top service, specialized people to remove chickpeas for you, very convenient There's half of the shrimp, taste fresh. Pricing economically affordable, will definitely come again to eat, also recommend to relatives

example_reviews: We ordered a pour over using Finca Soledad Syndra roast, a single source bean from Peru. The pour over was clean, light, high acidity with floral tones. The barista who made our pour over was knowledgeable about the bean and its origins, and informative about their brand and how they source their beans which are roasted onsite. We would recommend this to anyone who enjoys a good brew and reasonably priced beverages and pastries. We enjoyed ourselves while we were there.

If you are having too much of condense milked- Vietnamese coffee and fancy for more decent experience, it is where you should stop by. Relaxing atmosphere comfortable sitting demonstrated their keen on giving you a solely- coffee experience . They are very experienced and passionate in coffee beans. Staff can tell you all the stories about the beans.

Introduced by my friend as we are heavy coffee drinkers with espresso machine at home. The coffee is special with high score beans sourced directly from farm. The staffs are also very knowledgeable and give us very details about each type of beans, what method to use, which pastry is compatible with the coffee choice. Although the price may not be suitable for normal daily coffee dosage, we think it‚Äôs worth it

name: Le Petit Bistro Da Nang
address: 81/09 Phan T·ª©, Da Nang 550000 Vietnam
description: Welcome to Le Petit Bistro Da Nang, where exceptional dining meets warm hospitality. Building on the success of our H·ªôi An location, we bring the same cosy charm, exquisite cuisine, and attentive service to Da Nang. Your hosts, Peter and Thuy Lawson, ensure every detail reflects their passion for quality. Guests love our French, Italian, and European dishes, including Duck Confit, Beef Bourguignon, and Mediterranean-style Lamb Shank. Our handmade fresh pasta elevates dishes like Spaghetti Vongole, Napoletana Fusilli, Chicken & Mushroom Mezze Maniche, and Mushroom Pappardelle. With Peter‚Äôs family heritage in breeding Aberdeen Angus cattle in Scotland, we serve only the finest Aberdeen Angus beef. A warm, inviting atmosphere, paired with a curated European wine list and the owners' personal touch, makes every visit special. Discover an unforgettable culinary experience at Le Petit Bistro Da Nang.
cuisines: Fast Food Restaurants in Da Nang
Street Food Restaurants in Da Nang
Late Night BBQ Restaurants in Da Nang
Cafes for Breakfast in Da Nang
example_reviews: We decided to have dinner at Le Petit Bistro based on reviews and after looking at the menu. The restaurant and experience were amongst the best we've had in Vietnam. The authentically French food, ambience and staff were outstanding. We enjoyed talking to Peter who co-owns the restaurant with his wife. The chef also came and talked to us after we'd finished our meal. It was nice of them to take time to talk to us and we had nothing but positive feedback from them. As noted in other reviews, there are many high end French restaurants in Danang that charge near US prices. Peter noted that the restaurant is only a little over a month old and they want to build a customer base so are committed to providing the highest quality food, generous portions, at competitive prices. The meal we had last night would have cost three to four times what we would have paid in the US and we had superior service. Try this restaurant before everyone else figures it out!

A welcome contrast to Asian cuisine in a city with such a vast choice of seafood. This was without doubt the most enjoyable dining experience during our month long stay in DaNang. The French onion soup with garlic baguette was a generous bowl, but light and delicately sweet with a sprinkle of cheese. The ribeye was tender and cooked to perfection, medium rare, with beautifully seasoned fries and a creamy dauphinoise side. My partner had the Duck a l‚Äôorange which was cooked sous-vide style at low temp and it was tender and succulent. The desserts were also quintessentially French with Cr√®me Br√ªl√©e and a Chocolate Souffl√© to finish. We enjoyed meeting the English chef who clearly enjoys his profession and sourcing the very best ingredients for their menu. If you are looking for unpretentious sophistication with very reasonably priced menu then Le Petit Bistro is a great choice.

An alley located cozy restaurant with impressive service and crusine. Highly recommend the Duck A L‚ÄôOrange served with Dauphinoise Potato üòã Partner loves the Steak Frites Chargrilled House Cut of Steak with Rosemary Salted Fries, Garlic Parsley Butter. Thank you for arranging the window seat, we had a great night and looking for tasting menu next time we visit

example_reviews: If you're in Da Nang and craving authentic Vietnamese cuisine, this cozy gem is a must-visit! The prices are incredibly affordable, making it easy to indulge without breaking the bank. A special shout-out to Huy, the attentive and friendly staff member, who went above and beyond to ensure our dining experience was top-notch. His hospitality truly made the meal even more enjoyable. Highly recommend this spot to anyone in Da Nang looking for great food, excellent service, and a cozy vibe!

example_reviews: I found this place while looking for a restaurant that suits the local atmosphere rather than Korean tourists. I was able to eat Tomahawk for half the price in Korea, the owner was friendly, and I was able to get a T membership discount, which was nice. Satisfies.

Was the perfect location to see the dragon bridge light up. The staff were so attentive and the food excellent. The waiter was very friendly and attentive making sure we were completely happy with everything. One of the best meals we have had in na nang

This is a great restaurant for a steak dinner. Lots of family-friendly options too like pasta and hamburgers. We came on a Friday night and booked for 7.30pm. The timing was perfect as we were ready for coffee and desert by the 9pm Dragon Bridge show. Top tip: get your reservation in early and request a table upstairs on the veranda. When we booked the veranda was fully booked, but a group left around 8.30pm and the restaurant staff very kindly let us move tables onto the veranda for our desert. It was a great spot for the kids to see the Dragon Bridge show.

name: Le Comptoir Danang
address: 16 Che Lan Vien, Ngu Hanh Son, Da Nang 550000 Vietnam
description: Indulge in Chef Olivier's culinary delights, paired perfectly with wines by Sommelier Myriam. Savour local ingredients & French finds on our menu, explore unique wineries & grand crus, and feel at home in our warm, elegant bistro. Le Comptoir: where food & wine become an experience.
example_reviews: This is undeniably one of the best French restaurants we have ever been to in the world! We arrived in Da Nang yesterday and the restaurant at our hotel was closed, so we went out to find place to eat. And it was just there on the street in front of us after we walked for only a few minutes. We didn‚Äôt have a reservation, and they normally cannot accommodate walk-ins, but it was our lucky day because they found us a table. (Please don‚Äôt just show up because you really must make reservation.) Everything was amazing, Including the butter for the bread (they have 4 kinds to choose from!) The sommelier (wine professional) helped us choose the perfect pairing for our meal. They have two set menus, but because I am gluten intolerant, we chose appetizers and entr√©es from their a-la-carte menu. Not everything I chose was gluten-free, but they were able to make changes so that I could eat everything! Thank you so much to the chef and the sommelier and the wonderful servers who took such good care of us. We love this restaurant, and we will definitely be eating here again.

A friend recommended me to celebrate my birthday in this restaurant. The price is reasonable and the taste is ok, especially the black snowfish, which is very delicious. The staff has good service attitude and the restaurant atmosphere makes you comfortable. They also gave me a free dessert and took a photo for me. I was very happy when the photo was taken. Thank you to the owner for the arrangementüíïIt is best to make a reservation, otherwise you may have to wait a long time to be seated.

I went to dinner in Da Nang with my wife. It's a bit of a distance from the city, so I took a GrabCar. The shop is in a quiet residential area. The appearance of the shop is also very nice. I was a little nervous because it was a famous restaurant, but they welcomed me with a friendly smile, and I was relieved that the atmosphere inside the restaurant was relaxing. Also, the work of the staff is crisp and comfortable. I asked for a five-course course of Wagyu beef and ordered black tea because I couldn't drink. Cooking has given my brain a very good pleasure in complex flavors that I have never tasted from a single item. All five dishes were wonderfully delicious and I had a satisfying time. The black tea was so good that I ordered the same again and he gave me a little secret recipe. I can't believe it's in there! I was so happy until the last dessert (the smell of bushkan) that I was really glad to include this restaurant on this trip. It was a very good memory. Thank you for the best food and service.

address: 26 T√¥ Hi·∫øn Th√†nh, Da Nang 550000 Vietnam
description: Moc Seafood Restaurant space is characterized by ancient Vietnames with deep color and warm. This gives dinners a cozy and comfortable space like being in their own home. In addition,Moc Seafood Restaurant also offers a rich menu and reasonable price,not only suitable for foreign guests but also Vietnamese people.Come to Moc Restaurant and enjoy the ancient atmosphere of Vietnam!

example_reviews: I was genuinely surprised by how packed M·ªôc Seafood Restaurant was! Even at 9pm, there was still a line of people waiting, so I‚Äôd definitely recommend making a reservation in advance if you don‚Äôt want to wait. The atmosphere has a charming Vietnamese style, warm and welcoming. However, because it was so crowded, it was a bit noisy and made conversations a little difficult. Now, let‚Äôs talk about the food ‚Äî absolutely worth the hype. The seafood is incredibly fresh, and the prices are very reasonable for the quality. The menu offers a wide variety of options, including live seafood. I highly recommend trying the lobster and grouper sashimi ‚Äî both were sweet, tender, and full of flavor. Every dish we tried was well-seasoned and delicious. Overall, despite the crowd, it‚Äôs a fantastic spot for seafood lovers. Just plan ahead and come hungry!

Delicious fresh seafood dinner. We did not have a reservation and waited for about 20 minutes to get a table. We were not seated outside but in the multi-story building ext door. The waitress escorted us to our table. Incredibly fresh. We all had lobster and prawns. They took us out to choose the lobsters and weighed them for us so we knew how much we were paying up front. The tamarind prawns were amazing (minimum order was 300gms). We ordered 500gms between 2 people. We also had a 750gm lobster with garlic butter sauce- very rich. Prices are amazing with it working out around $50Aud / head including drinks and bread for mopping up the sauce. There are also several non-seafood meals for those who do not eat seafood. They also peel your prawns as well!

Exactly what we hoped and wished for. You had seen the reviews, photos and a few YouTubes about the restaurant and made it our first meal when we landed in DaNang. We had some trouble with reservations, but contacted them via FB messenger and it was promptly and efficiently sorted. Arrived to a lovely greeting and given time to look over the menu but it wasn‚Äôt really needed as we knew exactly what we wanted and was promptly taken to the tanks to select our dinner. Service was amazing, friendly and it was a real treat to have our freshly cooked seafood peeled and prepared for our very ravenous tummies after a long 24 hour traveling. We thought the garlic butter would be our favorite but to our surprise the salted egg was outstanding. (Garlic butter still very yummy) We over ordered but the price compared to home costs was still totally worth it. We are now totally spoiled as we will always compare this delicious food and brilliant service and we have all agreed, there won‚Äôt be anywhere else that can do it better.

When I stepped into Rang Indian Restaurant in Da Nang, I felt as if I had fallen into a miniature India in the heart of this beautiful city. Every little corner of the space looked like a vibrant painting, promising to create stunning photos that make you want to capture those wonderful moments forever. As I immersed myself in that colorful atmosphere, I could not help but be amazed by the culinary journey that awaited. The menu here is incredibly diverse and rich, with each dish not only delicious but also presented with such finesse, like works of art on a plate. Although I am not a die-hard fan of Indian cuisine, I was enchanted by the essence and allure of the dishes here. The concept is not only colorful but also holds a touch of mystery, which made me love this space even more. The staff at Rang is also very charming and enthusiastic, contributing to making my experience even more complete. If someone asked me about Indian cuisine in Vietnam, I would not hesitate to recommend they visit Rang and try any dish from the menu. I am sure everyone will be drawn to the unique flavors, and what‚Äôs more, the prices here are extremely reasonable, making me feel truly fortunate to enjoy high-quality dishes with excellent service without worrying about costs. Rang is not just an ordinary Indian restaurant; it is truly a place that harmonizes the art, culture, and exquisite cuisine of India!

We have visited end of January 2025 and had a fantastic experience. The atmosphere very chill, modern and welcoming. The stuff was extremely friendly and top notch service. I took malai kofta - the best one I‚Äôve ever tried. I highly recommend everyone, though the price may look a bit above the average but the quality of food and service worth it. I‚Äôm definitely coming there again.

example_reviews: üåüüåüüåüüåüüåü A True Taste of Vietnam at Citron! Dining at Citron was an exceptional experience from start to finish. This Vietnamese restaurant offers a perfect blend of authentic flavors, stunning ambiance, and impeccable service. Open for lunch and dinner, it‚Äôs the ideal destination for anyone looking to indulge in high-quality Vietnamese cuisine. The menu showcases traditional dishes with a refined touch, using fresh, locally sourced ingredients. From the perfectly crispy crab spring rolls to the rich and aromatic Pho broth, every dish was bursting with authentic flavors. The DaNang blue bone garfish was a standout‚Äîexpertly cooked and beautifully presented. The restaurant‚Äôs design is breathtaking, with elegant Vietnamese-inspired decor and a relaxing atmosphere. Whether dining indoors or on the terrace, the setting enhances the experience, making every meal feel special. Service at Citron is truly five-star. The staff is professional, attentive, and knowledgeable about the menu, always ready to recommend the perfect dish or wine pairing. They ensured we had a seamless and memorable dining experience. If you‚Äôre looking for an authentic yet elevated Vietnamese dining experience, Citron is a must-visit. Highly recommended for both locals and travelers!

This restaurant truly lives up to its 5-star rating. The food is delicious, creatively prepared with fresh ingredients, and each dish offers a distinct, rich flavor. The ambiance is elegant and spacious, with stunning views that create a relaxed and comfortable atmosphere. It's the perfect place to enjoy a special meal with family and friends, offering both a culinary delight and an unforgettable experience.

We had afternoon tea and breakfast. Afternoon tea time was such a strong wind that napkins flew on the table, and the tea cooled quickly. The sweets were all delicious, especially canel√© and scones. Breakfast was not the first thing in the morning, but when I told them what I wanted to eat outside, they took turns to show me around. There was so much alcohol, I was dazzled. In particular, the bread was plentiful and everything looked delicious. Some of them were made on the spot, such as pho and egg dishes. erika, who was in charge of the table at breakfast, was very kind and took nice pictures from various angles. The views are so great that I think it's worth stopping by or just sitting back and getting a taste of the atmosphere. Please note that some photos are quite dark depending on the time and place, so you may not be able to take them beautifully with your phone.

example_reviews: Nice restaurant atmosphere and service is OK nothing more nothing less. Needs to be taken off the Michelin guide definitely. We tried out this restaurant followed the review on Tiktok from a food blogger. The food is good, some dishes portion are not worth the price, for example the grilled chicken. We ordered 1/2 grilled chicken but the portion looks like there‚Äôs only 1/4 of a chicken. The Madame Lan grilled fish is truly a must try one, plus the stirring squid with pineapple. The Luk Lake beef we requested medium well but it too hard for chewing like well-done instead. The restaurant is an open space, no AC so it will be hot for lunch, but ok for dinner with fresh air. Price is a bit high for a local restaurant, it is more touristic nowadays as many travelers visit, not much local residents. Staff is not attentive at all, especially the girl that serve our table. She delivered the drinks but pour it all over the table and my friend‚Äôs clothes, no apology nor clean it after that. Very bad attitude, they are more focus on foreigners than Vietnamese. My tour guide booked the table under my name but the hottest apparently said there‚Äôs no table reserved under my name, it took 10mins to find out my reservation but then the table had someone else used it. Overall experience is not really pleasant except some of the food

Nh√† h√†ng Madame L√¢n: A Feast for the Eyes, But Not the Palate Located beside the charming river in Danang, Nh√† h√†ng Madame L√¢n welcomes guests with its elegant d√©cor and picturesque setting. While it offers a delightful feast for the eyes, it leaves something to be desired when it comes to the culinary experience. Pros: Beautiful Decor: Nh√† h√†ng Madame L√¢n is dressed to impress. The d√©cor is beautifully put together and offers endless opportunities for those picture-perfect moments. From the intricate design details to the well-thought-out placement of decorative items, the visual aesthetics are indeed commendable. Great Selection of Food: One of the highlights of Nh√† h√†ng Madame L√¢n is its extensive food selection. Catering to different tastes and preferences, the menu provides a wide variety of options that promises to tempt every palate. Great Location: Situated next to the river, the restaurant enjoys an enviable location that not only adds to its charm but also makes it easily accessible. The view of the river complements the dining experience, enhancing the restaurant's overall appeal. Cons: Mediocre Food: Despite its great variety and impressive appearance, the food at Nh√† h√†ng Madame L√¢n falls short in taste. Described as extremely average and lacking any distinct or memorable flavors, the culinary experience does not live up to the expectations set by the venue's lovely ambiance and d√©cor. Pricey by Local Standards: Considering the mediocrity of the food, the price range at Nh√† h√†ng Madame L√¢n might seem a bit steep, especially when compared to local standards. The disconnect between price and taste quality might leave some patrons feeling underwhelmed. Conclusion: Nh√† h√†ng Madame L√¢n is a beautiful dining spot in Danang, perfect for those who appreciate visual beauty and a fantastic location. However, if your primary focus is on a satisfying culinary experience, you might find it lacking. The restaurant's broad selection of dishes and wonderful ambiance make it a place worth visiting, but set your expectations appropriately regarding the food's taste and price. Ideal for special occasions or for those looking to enjoy a picturesque dining environment, Nh√† h√†ng Madame L√¢n serves as a reminder that beauty doesn't always translate to flavor.

name: La Maison 1888
address: InterContinental Danang Sun Peninsula Resort, Da Nang 550000 Vietnam
description: La Maison 1888, the only One Star Michelin restaurant in Central Vietnam, captures the essence of haute French dining, with the distinct gourmet experience of delectable √† la carte menu of distinguished classic French cuisine in Danang. This signature restaurant has already becoming the number one gastronomic destination in Vietnam.
cuisines: Street Food Restaurants in Da Nang

example_reviews: A restaurant well deserving of its Michelin star. Beautiful surroundings, excellent friendly service, fabulous food. After reading a number of reviews on Trip Advisor giving La Maison‚Äôs food low ratings, I was anxious to make my own decision. The conclusion is that those reviewers could have been eating in different restaurant or the food has improved exponentially since they were there. The meal that my wife and I enjoyed was as good as any Michelin one star restaurant that we have been to. Some dishes, such as the GRATIN√âE D'OIGNONS, were what one might typically enjoy in a 3 star restaurant. I had asked for a pescatarian menu degustation, which resulted in only one change from lamb to spaghetti. I then imagined a bowl of spaghetti bolognaise or similar, but received an imaginative and very tasty creation in which I only found the spaghetti forming a wall of 2 cm pieces when I dug into it. I suspect that the vegetarian menu would be well worth trying. The 8 course menu was expensive but very good value for money. The dishes involving truffle had a very generous quantity of Perigord truffle shaved over them. There were two choices or wine menu paired with dishes. One involved 8 wines, including older vintages, and cost the equivalent of about USD298 per head, while the other, which we had, consisted of 5 generally younger wines costing the equivalent of about USD156 per person. The five wines were well matched and a couple were quite special but, considering they amounted to about 2/3rds of a bottle in total, if I went again I‚Äôd probably choose a couple of older wines from the wine list for a similar or larger cost. The beautiful surroundings and the cable car ride to the restaurant add to a memorable evening. I‚Äôd recommend La Maison 1888 to any food lover visiting Danang.

We had an enjoyable dinner at this famed French restaurant in Da Nang. The ambience of the restaurant is very homely and feels like you are in a small upscale bistro in Europe. We had the Spring tasting menu designed and curated by Pierre Gagnaire. In keeping with Pierre‚Äôs signature style, both the source of ingredients and gestronomic techniques had the nice balance of classic French cooking with a detectable octave of Asian note. The staff was very professional rendering the right level of attentive service respecting the customers‚Äô enjoyment of each course leisurely. The wine pairing selection made by the sommelier was a perfect match to each course and complimented the special flavour meant to be enjoyed. Gastronomy is an artistry. Like any art form, personal preference, taste and experience all play a factor in its appreciation and enjoyment. We were glad that we picked La Maison 1888 during our visit to Da Nang despite some not so positive comments and reviews. We would not be surprised that La Maison will get its own star if Michelin has decided to include Da Nang in its guide in the near future.

Had dinner in this highly acclaimed French restaurant in Danang. The setting was beautiful as the restaurant was housed in a French-styled mansion on the slope of the very exclusive Intercontinental Danang hotel. The restaurant interior deco was nice and the service attentive but not intrusive. The ambiance was excellent and romantic. However, the food served, although nice, fell short of expectations of a restaurant of such reputation and pricing. If you have to pay about VND6 million (USD244) per head in Vietnam for a dinner, you'd better expect something very extraordinary. There wasn't any wow factor. For less than 5% of the pricing, you could actually eat an excellent Vietnamese meal in a local restaurant in Danang city!

We went to a couple other steak places in Da Nang and this was by far the best one. It‚Äôs a fairly new restaurant so not a ton of reviews but this was our favorite place in Da Nang!

example_reviews: We came to Olivia's Prime Steakhouse to celebrate our girl's birthday after search many Da Nang fine dining restaurants. We ordered salad, chicken bbq, ribeye steaks. Salad was fresh, chicken bbq was delicious and steaks were fresh, wonderful and cooked as our request. I have never had such delicious steaks before. They use wood grill instead of gas grill like other restaurants, that is why the steaks are so special. Staffs were very attentive to take care of our group. They offered a free cake for birthday and also chocolate vodka for everyone at the end. Although it was pricey but we both agreed that it was worth: luxury restaurant, 5 star service, perfectly cooked steaks - can not expect more. Many thanks for hosting our group. Sure to go back. Highly recommended.

Wow, what a culinary delight! Olivia's Steakhouse in Da Nang exceeded our expectations in every way. The steaks were cooked to perfection - tender, juicy, and full of flavor. The lamb cutlets were equally impressive, with a beautiful char on the outside and a deliciously pink interior. But what really made our experience stand out was the exceptional service. Our server was attentive, knowledgeable, and friendly, making great recommendations and ensuring our glasses were always full. The atmosphere was sophisticated yet cozy, making it perfect for a special occasion or a night out with friends. We can't wait to come back and indulge in Olivia's incredible steaks again. 5 stars isn't enough - we'd give it 10 stars if we could!

cuisines: Fast Food Restaurants in Da Nang

South American Restaurants for Lunch in Da Nang
Spanish Restaurants for Lunch in Da Nang
example_reviews: I ordered margherita pizza, T-bone steak, and carbonara, and I recommend the steak the most! I ordered it medium and it was well cooked and good. The sauce that came with the steak was also delicious. I came around 11:30 a.m. on a weekday, there were hardly any people and the food came out quickly.

We had dinner two nights, the food was delicious. We have ordered pizzas, two varieties one day and two varieties another day and they were all delicious. The two waitresses who served us on the two different days were both wonderful. We sat at the top and at night you could see the entire river with views of the ships. It was a super nice experience One of the girls was trying to speak in Spanish which we found very nice. Thank you very much, highly recommended place in terms of quality, price and location.

While in Da Nang, Vietnam on vacation my friend, and I decided stop in at the Cardi Pizzeria on Bach Dang, which we learned is one of 4 Cardi Pizzerias located there. We‚Äôre so glad we did, because we ended up having a delightful encounter with their wonderful waitress, Anna. She began by greeting us with a big smile, and a lot of enthusiasm. To our great relief, since we speak no Vietnamese, she spoke excellent English, so we asked her how she had learned to speak it so well. She told us she had learned it on her own, mostly by watching American movies, which was quite a surprise. When taking our orders, she repeated them back to us, word for word, to verify them, which demonstrated her professional attention to detail. Unlike most other places we‚Äôve eaten at, throughout Southeast Asia, she delivered our food, and drinks together, which was another nice, and very welcome touch that we were grateful for. We each had a small pizza, which is just about the perfect size for one person. I had a coconut smoothie that was absolutely fantastic, but I can‚Äôt remember what my friend had to drink. Anna was attentive, outgoing, personable, friendly, and quite frankly, very refreshing. We ended up having a somewhat lengthy conversation, interspersed with lots of laughter. Anna‚Äôs an excellent waitress, and it‚Äôs obvious that she enjoys her job, because her happy-go-lucky attitude shines through. By the time we finished eating, and left, we felt we‚Äôd had a good meal, and found a new friend. If you‚Äôre ever in Da Nang, and stop in at the Cardi Pizzeria on Bach Dang, and you‚Äôre lucky enough to have Anna as your waitress, you‚Äôll be able to make some marvelous memories, while having a thoroughly enjoyable experience. Our only regret is that we had such a fun time, that we forgot to get a selfie with Anna to memorialize our time there. I think it‚Äôll be okay, though, because we‚Äôll make sure to remember to do it the next time we stop in.

The most special thing that makes "B√°nh X√®o Cu·ªôi" different from others is that B√°nh X√®o is made from rice flour ground in the traditional way, while most other restaurants prefer using industrial rice flour because of its convenience. example_reviews: The restaurant offers hand-crafted traditional dishes in a premium setting. We tried the Seafood Fried Rice and Crab Spring Rolls - both absolutely delicious. The Vietnamese coffee selection is impressive, with the salted coffee providing an interesting contrast to the sweet egg coffee. The attentive service and lovely music created a relaxing atmosphere perfect for couples. A must-visit for authentic Vietnamese cuisine in Da Nang!

This is a restaurant with a bright cafe atmosphere. Although located off the street, the environment is very clean and the staff are friendly and uninhibited, so enjoy a comfortable dining experience here. Korean green bean pancakes are crisp and tender on the outside, with a rich meat filling that complements vegetables, rice paper and fish sauce. The watermelon served later was also very refreshing, adding a pleasant ending to the meal.

This cozy restaurant was such a great find! The food here was absolutely phenomenal! The texture of the pancakes here reminded me of my mama‚Äôs pancakes from when I was little, which left me feeling very nostalgic. Every dish I tried was delicious. The restaurant was very clean. The service was fast. The staff was very friendly and helpful; my non-Vietnamese speaking friend was explained about each dish he inquired. The hostess spoke perfect English. I would recommend everyone to try this place! 10/10!

name: Cabanon Palace
address: 27-29 Loseby Street Cordial Grand Hotel 21st Floor, Son Tra, Da Nang 550000 Vietnam
description: FRENCH RESTAURANT & ROOFTOP WINE BAR Experience an authentic french culinary dinner at Cabanon Palace restaurant: a family legacy of tastes and traditions, proud of the authentic flavors from French Riviera.
cuisines: Street Food Restaurants in Da Nang

Late Night Mediterranean Restaurants in Da Nang
example_reviews: It was a special meal to celebrate my birthday. The oysters were particularly good as well as the crab bisque. The chef took time to chat to all diners, explaining the restaurant‚Äôs history, full menu and suggested wine pairings. Whilst not the cheapest place in town the standard of service, food and general experience was definitely value-for-money.

I ate at Cabanon Palace just before Covid hit and it was amazing. They've moved location, but the food is still fantastic (phew). The perfect place for an anniversary dinner. We started with Fois Gras, followwing some delicious canapes. The Fois Gras was perfectly cooked which can be an issue in VN. We followed with a Steak and Stuffed Squid. Both delicious. A must do if you are in Da Nang!

Amazing food, wonderful service. Started with some freshly shucked French oysters and foi grois. The hanger steak was perfectly cooked - so much flavour and beautifully tender. Paired with amazing handcut chips and a jus that was a major highlight. Lobster bisque sauce with scampi and cote de boef an interesting and wonderful combination. Some calvados before dessert helped clear our stomachs for the French cheesecake, an old family recipe (paired with a beautifully balanced sorbet). Could not recommend this restaurant enough , very authentic and extremely well priced for the quality of food. Every dish was very well thought out and considered, and the service was welcoming and knowledgeable. Also a very good wine list with many great French reds that do not break the bank.

example_reviews: Lan Gio offers an exceptional fusion dining experience that merges Chinese and Vietnamese cuisines. The restaurant‚Äôs seafood dishes stand out for their freshness and creativity, while the smaller appetizers, such as the delightful money bags, are both light and flavorful. The service at Lan Gio is commendable; the staff are attentive The restaurant's interior is also noteworthy, featuring a beautiful, warm design. Located near the scenic Han River, Lan Gio is ideally situated for anyone in Da Nang looking to enjoy a meal in a prime location. Additionally, it offers affordable pricing, making it an accessible choice for both locals and visitors. Highly recommend stopping by to try this experience.

Lan Gio Dam Da Huong is a fantastic Vietnamese restaurant that truly stands out! The food is absolutely excellent, with authentic flavors and fresh ingredients that make every dish a delight. The staff is incredibly friendly and attentive, always ready to help with a smile. What‚Äôs more, the prices are very reasonable, offering great value for such high-quality meals. Highly recommend this spot for anyone craving delicious Vietnamese cuisine in a warm and welcoming atmosphere!

Fabulous Vietnamese restaurant just opposite the Pink cathedral in bustling and super noisy Da Nang. Beaten by unusually strong wind and busy rush hour streets, we found a sanctuary of peace, serenity, warm smiles, wonderful hospitality and delicious food. Very nice minimal decoration- which is super pleasant for the eye after all the colourful lanterns and illumination around- pleasant instrumental music, very generous portions charged with taste and flavours. I would absolutely recommend it for any traveller! A small touch - they even have bamboo baskets for lady purse:-)

description: Food is delicious and reasonable price, staffs are helpful and gave a good recommendation. The owner is very nice. I went there because it seemed easy to enter near the hotel. The menu says this is a bestseller, so I asked for the bestseller pho on the very first page. Seasoning was my favorite. The passion fruit juice was delicious. The service is good. The cold tea was also delicious. I went there at about 5:30 and it was empty, but around 6:00 the crowd kept coming in and it was full.

We loved this place and went back twice. The Pho, Mi Quang and Prawn spring rolls were stand outs. Service is excellent, prices are terrific and the place really shows off a variety of Vietnamese dishes. I put the stand outs in but we really loved all the dishes, including Sweet and Sour Pork, Braised Pork, Spring Rolls and Chicken Wings. We would go back again if we were not leaving. name: TinTin Seafood Restaurant
address: 100 Pham Van Dong Street, Da Nang 50409 Vietnam
description: TinTin Seafood & Bar Da Nang is the perfect destination for seafood lovers, offering a wide variety of the freshest and finest live seafood. From lobsters, crabs, fish to unique seafood delicacies, all are prepared fresh on-site, ensuring the most delicious and flavorful dishes. Whether you are looking for a traditional seafood platter or something special, TinTin has something for everyone. In addition to our outstanding seafood, we also offer a luxurious karaoke space for you to unwind and enjoy time with friends, family, or colleagues. The restaurant is also an ideal venue for hosting parties, birthdays, and gatherings, with a spacious, cozy atmosphere and full amenities. Come to TinTin Seafood & Bar to indulge in a memorable seafood feast and fun-filled karaoke moments with your loved ones. We promise an unforgettable experience that combines high-quality seafood, entertainment, and lasting memories!
cuisines: Fast Food Restaurants in Da Nang
Street Food Restaurants in Da Nang
example_reviews: The service was excellent, they were very attentive and even offered to shell the prawns for us. Like me, the staff was incredibly polite, spoke excellent English, and made excellent recommendations. In addition, the location was spotless. The lobsters at TinTin Seafood Restaurant are huge, live, and caught right from the tank. They are so fresh and delicious, and they are very reasonably priced and the overall atmosphere is very beautiful. I highly recommend TinTin Seafood Restaurant to anyone who wants to enjoy a delicious and memorable meal.

TinTin Seafood Restaurant is hands down one of the best seafood restaurants I've ever been to. I ordered a 1.2 kg grilled lobster that cost a little over $50. The food was prepared with care, and the grilled lobster was cooked perfectly. The meat was firm, delicious, and fresh. The staff even helped me peel the lobster, which I really appreciated. I was very satisfied with the service here. Everything was excellent, from the atmosphere to the staff.

The best seafood restaurant in Da Nang After receiving a recommendation from an acquaintance, I made a reservation directly through Google Maps. It's very convenient with free pick-up service to the hotel. As soon as you get out of the car, employees will wait in front of the door and guide you with a large parasol. The menu is written in various languages, making it easy to understand and order without a translator. The seafood in each dish was very fresh, and when I personally selected the lobster from the aquarium, they not only cooked it deliciously, but also prepared it so it was easy to eat, so I was satisfied with both the taste and the service. The store has a spacious and cozy atmosphere, and the private VIP room is equipped with karaoke facilities, so it was even better to enjoy drinking and singing together. There is a massage shop on the second floor, and the staff skillfully massages the desired area and intensity according to your needs, so your fatigue is completely relieved. This place has the advantage of offering a full course including meals, drinks, and massage. All of the people I went with had a delicious meal and were satisfied, so I plan to visit again when I travel again. If you travel to Da Nang, I highly recommend you go there. I think it will soon be selected as a Michelin 5-star restaurant.

Golden Meat House Barbecue Restaurant: Airy and large space. Unique and modern interior. Fresh and premium materials. Best place to dine with your passion for BBQ cuisine in general and Korean cuisine in particular. Golden Meat House - Stone Grill BBQ & Meat Shop Opening hours: 10:00 ~ 22:00

example_reviews: I had an amazing experience at this Korean BBQ restaurant! The staff was incredibly friendly and attentive, making sure we felt comfortable the entire time. The food was absolutely delicious ‚Äî the meat was fresh and perfectly seasoned, and the variety of dishes really impressed me. The ambiance was also great with a beautiful view, which made the meal even more enjoyable. As it was March 8th, they also gave flowers to all the women, which was such a lovely gesture! Overall, everything was perfect, and I would rate it 10/10. Highly recommend!

This is the most premium samgyup barbecue place I‚Äôve ever been to. The staff are very, very accommodating. Each table gets a dedicated server who cooks the meat for you, so all you have to do is sit back and enjoy. It really makes you feel pampered while you eat, like you‚Äôre getting dinner and a show at the same time! Everything was so yummy, and the quality of the food really stood out. As expected, it‚Äôs expensive, but you definitely feel like you‚Äôre paying for a premium experience. I really enjoyed it!

We had a fantastic dining experience at Golden Meat House! From the moment we arrived, the staff were incredibly welcoming and attentive ‚Äî always ready to assist with grilling, give recommendations, and ensure we were comfortable throughout our meal. Their service was top-notch and made us feel well taken care of. The food was equally impressive. Every cut of meat was fresh, well-marinated, and full of flavor ‚Äî especially the pork belly and beef short ribs. The side dishes were generous and delicious, and the overall quality of the ingredients really stood out. Golden Meat House is a must-visit for Korean BBQ lovers. Great service, excellent food, and a warm atmosphere ‚Äî we‚Äôll definitely be back!

example_reviews: PLEASE VISIT! This is an absolute gem of a restaurant. The food was delicious from start to finish, staff were absolutely brilliant and the owner was so kind to come round with the biggest smile on his face checking how our food was. He told us all about his restaurant and even offered us a table on the top rooftop floor so we could get a superb view of the dragon bridge. The team were absolutely fantastic! My partner and I couldn‚Äôt recommend this place any more! Thank you team!

A home run. Owner Carmen is charming. Food was excellent. Bonus: view of dragon bridge from roof top dining area. We ordered: bruschetta, pumpkin soup, pasta carbonara, pasta bolognese, and the tiramisu. All authentic and delicious. The menu doesn‚Äôt say what the house red wine is but Carmen said it was a Merlot from Sicily. The meal cost somewhat higher than traditional Vietnamese food but less than you‚Äôd pay in the West. Also: paper, not plastic,straw used :)

Halfway through our trip we could not resist the temptation to eat Italian and we decided to try this place and.... surprise!!! We really found a place that made us feel really at home! Credit to the kitchen made with quality products, and the Owner who welcomed us and made us feel like lifelong friends! Super recommended, to feel at home and why not to make friends as happened to us!!!

This is just the best sushi we've ever had! Just super tender rice, delicious fish, just a delight, everything is so fresh and delicious! I highly recommend this place for Japanese food lovers! We went together with the baby and she ate it all with pleasure! And a very nice girl waiter.

Amazing premium quality shabu and sushi. Price is more than affordable compared to Bangkok. Service is very friendly and helpful. Fish is really fresh and beef is soft. The atmosphere is relaxing and not crowded. So far this is my favourite place to eat in Da Nang

Brilliant Restaurant aims to become a cuisine center in the heart of Danang, collecting the culinary essence of Asian countries in harmony with the traditional cuisine of Vietnam.

example_reviews: A large, charming and well decorated restaurant which offers a wide range of fresh fish, shellfish and shellfish. Here, you simply choose the cooking method and pay the price based on the weight of the chosen animal. Prices per kilo are displayed directly on the aquariums and the waitresses tell you directly the final prices according to the quantity chosen. The staff is very pleasant and smiling. An excellent experience and exceptional products!

Da Nang is full of seafood restaurants, so I was wondering where to go, but I decided to go here because the atmosphere looked good. We went in November without a reservation for two people, but we were able to sit at the open table on the first floor. It's a huge restaurant with the whole building as a restaurant, so it seems that you don't need to make a reservation. The casual yet high-class atmosphere was great. You choose the fish from the fish tank. There are pictures on the menu, so I think it's best to choose the food you want to eat and then the fish. Most of the staff can speak English and are kind. The menu is well-written, so it's fine even if you only speak Japanese. We ordered a bottle of wine and a la carte dishes, and it cost about 10,000 yen for two people in Japanese yen. I think it would be more expensive if you ordered shrimp or something. The streets around here are lively, so you can take a stroll on your way home or stop by a beach bar.

It's a very delicious restaurant. It was so delicious that I went there for dinner three days. My was very kind and told me about the market price of seafood, so even Japanese people can feel at ease. If you don't eat the market price, it will cost about 5,000 yen for two people. On the last day, we had a luxurious lobster meal and it cost about 12,000 yen. The portions are large, so a small size is enough for two people. I want to go again. Thank you My üòä

name: Wild Rice
address: 6 Ngo Thi Nham Street, Phan Chu Trinh Ward, Hoan Kiem District, Hanoi 100000 Vietnam
description: Not sure why our tour company booked us here.  The food was just average.  The service was fine but the meal felt rushed.  With so many really great places to eat in Hanoi had I known this was where we were going I would have booked someplace else independently.

example_reviews: Not sure why our tour company booked us here. The food was just average. The service was fine but the meal felt rushed. With so many really great places to eat in Hanoi had I known this was where we were going I would have booked someplace else independently.
We had a multi course meal here with a large group of people. The seafood soup was excellent. All of the dishes served were well prepared. The staff was attentive and helpful.

Visited as part of a tour group, so had a set Dinner Menu provided. There are lots of courses but thankfully they are not too large. I am sure there were Spring Rolls, soup, rice, vegetables ,fish , chicken ,meat , noodles , followed by fresh fruit & coffee / tea. We were a group of 23, service was good but fairly fast. Had we just been a couple we would rather have taken another 30 minutes or so over our dinner.

name: Leo's - Cocktails & Co.
address: 16 Lo Su street 2nd Floor, Hanoi Vietnam
description: Discover a cozy cocktail bar nestled in an ancient Hanoi house, steps from Hoan Kiem lake. Handcrafted cocktails with only the freshest local ingredients created by our welcoming crew. Come see why we are a local favorite!
cuisines: BBQ Restaurants for Lunch in Hanoi
example_reviews: This cocktail bar is beautiful with a classic and cozy atmosphere. The menu is diverse, from classic to modern cocktails, all delicious and attractive. Service staff are friendly, professional and always willing to advise customers. Prices are affordable compared to the quality, creating an enjoyable and memorable experience for anyone who visits.

On our last night we found this little gem of a place, perfect (and I mean PERFECT) cocktails. Its tucked away on a quiet street but this should be sometging to add to your trip! The manager Thuong was an absolute star and so helpful, knowledgeable and welcoming and so we're the other staff. I can't wait to come back here! üòç

The best handcrafted cocktails in the city! My friends and I stumbled upon this place after we had an evening walk by the river. We only came in for one drink but ended up having 6+ drinks. All the drinks on the menu are so good but best drinks were created by Lee, who was our bartender. He is so talented and is able to concoct any cocktails to our preference. All the servers there were really fun and cool. Ask for the one to beatbox and do magic card tricks. This cool and chill bar is one of the best cocktail places we‚Äôve ever been to. We will be back for sure. Highly recommend coming here!

name: Rue Du Camp Cafe & Bistro
address: 50 Trang Thi Hoan Kiem, Hanoi 100000 Vietnam
description: From Arabica coffee beans nourished in soil with fragrant aroma of roasted fire, processed into elegance Italian coffee cups; To quintessential bowls of Chicken Pho in the luxury atmosphere or the green pearls color of the soup from Vong village, bearing the essence of autumn Hanoi. Together, all of elements harmonized in a ‚Äúsurreal‚Äù atmosphere, subtly sophisticated at Rue Du Camp. Each decoration evokes Vietnamese features that are both strange and familiar in contemporary inspiration.
cuisines: Pizza with Private Dining in Hanoi
Seafood Restaurants for Large Groups in Hanoi
example_reviews: We visited Rue Du Camp cafe/bistro early on a Saturday evening. We went up to the 1st level seating area. Waitress was attentive and friendly. We ordered a battered prawn appetiser followed by Szechuan beef and Teriyaki beef. Both were nicely presented on a large platter with smaller dishes - one vegetable broth, one salad and the main plate with rice and beef. The broth was very lightly flavoured and not very hot (in keeping with all establishments we've used in Hanoi - lukewarm broth seems to be the way of things here!). The salad was fresh and tasty, the beef and rice were delicious. We had a beer and a Rosebud tea. The tea was presented in a glass teapot on a glass burner/tealight stand. The rose buds slowly infused and opened to release their flavour. It was lovely. All in all we spent VND560,000/GBP20/USD24 + tip as no service charge was included. Excellent value for money.

As we were walking from the Temple of Literature to the Opera House along Trang Thi we noticed this restaurant's beautiful interior wood work and decided to check it out. Returned later for supper and the food was fantastic. Had meet some people in Siagon who were also in Hanoi and invited them to join us for supper a few nights later and the restaurant did not disappoint us again. On the North East corner of Trang Thi and Hoi Vu, it is not difficult to find and well worth it. The cost of the meals was also very reasonable.

First time here as introduced by friends. nice location, close to everything in town. u should note that bearing 50 of trang thi str., but there're a few 50s there and this shop is actually at the joint with Hoi Vu. nice settings out and inside, mix of east and west, lot of sunshines and greens the shop now has lotus theme for drinks and foods. I tried the lotus cofee a mixture of vietnamese cofee with minced and sweet lotus. interesting. we ordered lotus trunk salad, beefsteak and lotus roasted pigeon vemicelli soup. foods was so so 3 over 5 scale

name: Vamos - Tapas Kitchen & Bar
address: 19A ƒë∆∞·ªùng T√¢y H·ªì, Hanoi Vietnam
description: Inspired by Spanish cuisine and culture, Vamos Tapas Kitchen and Bar was born to blow a new breath into the Hanoi culinary map. Vamos offers the most authentic experience of Tapas culture - the essence of Spanish cuisine. The combination of Asian and European cuisine in the OPEN KITCHEN SPACE and Mediterranean atmosphere will be fully displayed at Vamos Tapas Kitchen & Bar (No. 19A, Tay Ho st, Tay Ho dist, Ha Noi, Vietnam)
cuisines: South American Restaurants for Lunch in Hanoi
example_reviews: The restaurant's space is extremely cozy, friendly with a bit of Spanish, Latin, and Mediterranean style, looks very pleasant, I haven‚Äôt found any tapas restaurant similar with this style in Hanoi. If I had to choose, I would choose to sit outside near the open kitchen bar. Foods is Spanish Fusion, I ordered some dishes, all is truly impressive, excepted sweet potation chips, it is a bit hard, pale and oily About drink, you guys if come here must try cocktail named Frambuesa, it has light pink color, so good and looks beautiful too. Ah, that night I also ordered one shot tequila named ‚Äúclase azul resposado‚Äù just because of curious, really it‚Äôs most expensive tequila i have known ü´£ üò∞, it costs equal one my dinner üò± but it‚Äôs worth

Had a great dining experience in Vamos!! Especially the chic atmosphere in the restaurant, friendly staffs, wide selection of food and drinks and the decoration of the restaurant is so perfect for photos on instaü§≠. I personally love the roasted suckling pig a lot which is always my favourite Spanish dish. Definitely will go again !!

At the end of a tour of Vietnam from south to north. I wanted something other than the beautiful Vietnamese food that we had been eating. I was told how extraordinary this place was in Hanoi. I was not disappointed, we started with a few tapas dishes and then had the Spanish Seafood Paella, finishing off with the cheesecake. The authenticity of the food is amazing, I am aware they source a lot of their product from Spain, so it‚Äôs no wonder it‚Äôs authentic. Has the opportunity of meeting Mr Tam and Miss Thuy. What beautiful people. Please support this restaurant, I am not easy to please, but I thought it transported me back to Spain or South America.

name: The Australian Bistro and Coffee
address: 126 Yen Lang Thinh Quang, Dong Da, Hanoi 100000 Vietnam
description: The OB located in the heart of Hanoi which is run by an Australian chef. We offer all high-standard food and services at a reasonable price so that everyone can come to enjoy the romantic, cozy atmosphere. cuisines: Pizza for Large Groups in Hanoi
Late Night Seafood Restaurants in Hanoi
example_reviews: I highly recommend The Outback Australian Bistro and Coffee, I went there for diner with my friend, staff is very friendly, gave us good advises on foods and drinks. And the food was awesome ! Pizza and Spaggetti were so delicious and i cannot describe how good it was . I will come back for sure !!

My husband and I accidentally had dinner at this restaurant. However we were so supprised and thought it was worth every single penny. The price was so cheap and delicious that we def will comeback soon. My steak was so tender and creamy sauce was so yummy. My husband had chicken roulade with mashed potato also nice and juicy. Staff were soooo friendly and hospitable. We def will comeback The Outback.

Had dinner here with a group of friends and we all had a good experience. Food was really good and service was exceptional. Our server, Chu B√° Th√¥ng, was very attentive and friendly. Would definitely come back again with friends.

name: El Gaucho | Ba Dinh
address: Unit L1-16A, Vincom Center Metropolis, 29 Lieu Giai Ngoc Khanh Ward, Ba Dinh District, Hanoi 100000 Vietnam
description: Food is our passion and it is our aim to establish the benchmark in Southeast Asia and beyond for a contemporary, specialised steakhouse concept. We are proud to serve you the finest steakhouse-style food, using only the best available meat products sourced from selected farms in Victoria, New South Wales and individual farmers and ranchers in the United States.
cuisines: Thai Restaurants with Private Dining in Hanoi
Vietnamese Restaurants for Lunch in Hanoi
American Restaurants with Private Dining in Hanoi
example_reviews: Had been to El Gaucho in Trang Tien previously and found the lunch set to be good value. Same could be said here at Vincom in Ba Dinh. Had the salsicha this time as the starter. The spicy sausage was a good complement to the mixed green salad and proved a good appetizer for the main course. I had the rib eye and it was cooked to the medium I asked. Nicely seasoned and juicy. The steak fries were too big for my liking and perhaps normal cut fries would be a better pairing for the steak. In any case, good value for lunch. Expensive, certainly. Service was prompt and I had no complaints.

Ate a good steak served with excellence by the young staff there. No complaints. I DO however have a bone to pick with El Gaucho itself: They make things up that don‚Äôt exist. There is NO SUCH THING AS ‚ÄúPlatinum USDA Prime‚Äù. It is quite simply NOT a thing. It does not exist. Which leads me to ask: What are we really getting? Is the ‚ÄúUSDA Prime‚Äù not really prime? But something lower? Is the ‚ÄúPlatinum USDA Prime‚Äù (which again, Google it, DOES NOT EXIST except in the fertile minds of El Gaucho marketing staff) actually exactly the same thing as the USDA Prime on the menu? Just an idiot trap? If you Google ‚ÄúPlatinum USDA Prime‚Äù you will find only references to El Gaucho. They fabricated it out of whole cloth. This ‚Äúgrade‚Äù of meat does not exist anywhere else. There is no explanation anywhere about what it is. It is BS. El Gaucho serves BS along with their bull meat. So something is dishonest about El Gaucho. Either the USDA Prime is not ‚Äúprime‚Äù but ‚ÄúChoice‚Äù or lower, or if you are dump enough to pay a premium for ‚ÄúPlatinum USDA Prime‚Äù you will probably get the same steak you would have gotten if you had ordered the USDA Prime for MUCH LESS MONEY. I would love El Gaucho Management to explain themselves. I hesitate to return, due to the corporate dishonesty. Again, my meal was fine (I had a USDA Prime Ribeye, 300 grams, because I wasn‚Äôt about to order a side of BS with my steak) and the service was excellent. I just don‚Äôt think they are selling what it says on the tin. False advertising. ‚ÄúPlatinum USDA Prime‚Äù is NOT A THING.

From the moment we walked in, my family and I were greeted by the friendly staff. We ordered off the cheesburgers off the lunch menu. The food tasted amazing and for incredible value. ◊™◊ï◊ì◊î ◊ú◊ö ◊ï◊©◊ô◊ê◊ô◊® ◊§◊†◊ô ◊ê◊ú◊ï◊î◊ô◊ù ◊¢◊ú◊ô◊ö ◊ï◊¢◊ú ◊ô◊©◊®◊ê◊ú

name: Banh Mi 14
address: 14 Ngo Huyen Hoan Kiem, Hanoi 100000 Vietnam
description: Our Banh Mi store is very small but very good, clean and cheap! I can make one Banh Mi in about 5 minutes, you can take away very easy! Come and check it out guys!
cuisines: Vietnamese Restaurants for Lunch in Hanoi
American Restaurants with Private Dining in Hanoi
example_reviews: We ate here twice, once on an amazing food tour (shout out to Vietnam is Awesome) and once on our own. We tried several different sandwiches and they were all amazing. Highly recommend!
It is interesting how is not famous on Tripadvisor. I think it¬¥s the best shop of Banh mi. We went there a couple of times. The prices, the food, the place. AWESOME!
The baguettes, as well as the yoghurt meals, are superb and cheap. The owner is really friendly and quick.

name: Bo De Quan Vegetarian Restaurant
address: 164 Au Co Street, Tay Ho District, Hanoi 10000 Vietnam
description: this is a vegan/vegetarian restaurant with a wide variety of dishes served buffet style.  We went with a guide as part of a larger evening tour and he explained all of the food to us.  Without a guide you may be guessing what each dish actually is, but it all tastes good.  No worries about accidently eating meat.  There are a lot of Mock Meats (which are important for cultural reasons).  Definitely a place to come if you are vegan.
cuisines: Thai Restaurants with Private Dining in Hanoi
Vietnamese Restaurants for Lunch in Hanoi
