I came here, because of the holidays, other place i looked for was closed. How happy i am that i did. Variety of veggie dishes, everything is fresh, You can eat as much as You want. Soups are amazing. You have also fresh fruits, salads, fried options.

name: Tu Lun Beef Noodle
address: 23 Hai Ba Trung, Hanoi 10000 Vietnam
description: the Beef Pho was really nice, the broth obviously had a lot of time and effort put into it and it really showed. nice hand done noodles
example_reviews: the Beef Pho was really nice, the broth obviously had a lot of time and effort put into it and it really showed. nice hand done noodles

One of the best Pho that i've had in Vietnam so far. However this place is small with rather little seats and you will likely need to share table with others. Not the cleanest eatery but really really good Pho.
Simple, but great taste. Cant say anything more. Just try it! Every incredient you can order more if its not enough.

name: Thien Tra Dao
address: 29 Alley 26 Vo Van Dung Dong Da, Hanoi 100000 Vietnam
description: Thien Tra Dao serves artisan tea and vegan food in a peaceful place with two floors and zen music played in the background. Located in a quiet alley. Menu is in Vietnamese and English. Has English speaking staff. Est. 2017. Open Mon-Sun 9.am to 10.pm
example_reviews: My fave place to have healthy vegan food. I came here many times before, usually had bun cha or the fresh rolls, now they have less food options but I don‚Äôt mind cuz my fave dishes are still there. Will definitely come back to try more tea (there are a lot!). P/s: they persuaded me to try the Pad thai because the weather was cold. Worth it! Hot and spicy and the portion is big!

In a peaceful neighborhood with delicious food!! This is a hidden gem. The Cinnamon Orange tea (I got it hot) was amazing!!! Best tea I have had by far. The sticky rice was delicious as well and the salad hoa qua nhiet doi was perfect!! A must visit place- even if your not vegan üòä Follow @travelingypsey on Instagram & Google Maps Safe Travels!
Very creative dishes and arrangements. Its nice to find a restaurant in hanoi that is clean & takes pride. The staff is warm and mindful as well. Will def be ordering again. Thank you!

name: Sushi Bar II
address: 51 Xuan Dieu, Tay Ho, Hanoi 10000 Vietnam
description: Awesome sushi, and we ordered way more than we could eat.  It's mostly made fresh for you, and we got a few extras like miso soup and a starter thrown in for free.  Excellent service and great food.  We live nearby and will be back.
cuisines: German Restaurants for Lunch in Hanoi
example_reviews: Awesome sushi, and we ordered way more than we could eat. It's mostly made fresh for you, and we got a few extras like miso soup and a starter thrown in for free. Excellent service and great food. We live nearby and will be back.

We were a group of five who booked a table last min on Sat night that they managed to fit us in. The menu is a little overwhelming as there is so much choice. We opted for a selection of sushi, tempura dishes with edamane beans. All was super tasty and fresh, perfect sharing as a group with a few tiger beers on tap. Bill worked out less than ¬£10 each for decent amount of food and a couple of drinks each.

After three times at this place I can recommend without any doubt, Service is fast, if you are a sushi fan everything is prepared fresh open to the guest. I had several non sushi dishes , always hot And fresh. So if you do shopping in the mall and want to eat something fresh and healthy it is better than fat fastfood you get around.

name: Parosand Sky Bar Restaurant
address: 9th Floor, 537 Lac Long Quan Xuan La, Tay Ho, Hanoi 100000 Vietnam
description: Pilot Restaurant is located on the 9th floor that offers both Vietnamese and Western food. It is a perfect place to catch up with friends and family and enjoy fusion cuisine as well as wide selection of wine.
example_reviews: Overall we were impressed with the restaurant and sky bar. The food was of good quality, comparable to some other popular Western cuisine restaurants in the Old Quarter. There were a variety of drinks and they were delicious too. However, we were generally disappointed with the music, as it was a little too loud and the playlist seems to have had only pop songs. There weren't any classical songs or house ones, which are what we expect on the sky bar. If you don't mind chilling in mediocre music then this place should probably be on your to-go list. Oh, and we must also mention that the view here is spectacular. You'll love it.
Sensational place to have breakfast. Value for money sensational and the staff can not do enough for you

name: Local Bar
address: 16 Ta Hien Street Hoan Kiem, Hanoi 10000 Vietnam
description: Great bar on the Old Quarter's busiest street where regulars and new friends come together for great drinks and cool music to party the night away.
cuisines: Eastern European Restaurants for Lunch in Hanoi
example_reviews: Small place. It was a good experience. Cheap drinks. Lucky to have 2 rounds of Sheesha served in happy hours. Happy Us !! Happy High !!

I love my visit. The staff are eztremely friendly. They speak a little english but that‚Äôs okay, all you need are the basics. The people are crazy fun but you will be left alone if you wish to. It‚Äôs a fun and safe place to hang out. The crowd maybe wild most of the time but it is a decent place and you‚Äôll feel secure. The sounds ^high five^ took me back to the 90s disco and lead me to present. Plus, you‚Äôll feel at home. The staff will even walk you to your ride (when you go there alone). Thank you guys!!! Will surely comeback. Can‚Äôt wait
I have been there at the midnight , music so nice , i can dancing with my friends, and drink not so expensive !

name: Pizza 4P's Lotte West Lake Hanoi
address: 272 Vo Chi Cong street., Hanoi 11210 Vietnam
description: Visited here twice over 3 days. The second time (Monday) the staff were excellent. The food was served quickly and was delicious. The only downsides: Vietnamese need to respect eating environments - 2 fellow diners were coughing and constantly clearing their throats; they had finished eating and were just lounging about. No-one can be seated next to them and be expected to enjoy a meal.

A fun place to eat, lots of energy, friendly and accommodating staff and the food was great too. I would definitely return

description: We sampled a variety of Hanoi food. We loved the snail soup with brinjal, the grilled fish, the grilled chicken kebab. Plenty to eat till we were stuffed. The service was just okay, the food was great though.

This restaurant serve many traditional Vietnamese dishes. The food is very good. Nice staffs. The atmosphere is like a rural village in Vietnam.

Well, recently, my company held a year-end party in this restaurant. It's a little bit difficult to find this place but when you arrive, it won't make you disppointed with nicly and warmly decorated atmosphere like you are in countryside. I recommend you to try beef grilled in bamboo. It's delicious. Also, a quite simple dish is a fried sweet potato. The dessert is decorated well.

name: Chops Lotte
address: 56 Pham Huy Thong, Hanoi 100000 Vietnam
description: This is the 3rd Chops to open in Hanoi and is situated on Pham Huy Thong. With great views looking straight over Ngoc Khanh Lake. Serving gourmet burgers, tempting starters and salads coupled with a fine selection of craft beers on draught and bottles. Great atmosphere with a non stop playlist of classic rock. The restaurant is over 3 floors and has an outside seating area on the top floor overlooking the lake.

Asian Restaurants for Large Groups in Hanoi
BBQ Restaurants for Lunch in Hanoi
example_reviews: Absolutely superb burgers here including vegetarian, smoothies and juices also available as well as a gorgeous bar with interesting pale ales. Very cheap for what you are getting too.
I have been living in Hanoi for 4 years and haven't found better place with burgers. The location near the lake is great and staff is super nice.
Perfect burgers, amazing place, would 100% recommend!!!! Really great meat and atmosphere. Thesauces were very nice too

example_reviews: I ate at a different restaurant of the same chain but I think they would be similar in quality. The foods were not special but the main plus is their affordable price

Cute little diner. Attractive decor. Low prices for steak. I had the rib eye and, yeh was ok but nothing to write home about. The sauce though was shocking and the chips and salad portions so small you could have put it on your fork in one go. I think this is a complaint others have highlighted in TA. The staff were strange, insisting we sit in the corner as there was not enough of us to fill a big table. We were the only customers for the entire time we were there so I don't know what that was about. My girlfriend had the lamb and it was considerably better than the steak.

Visited here after a 2 year gap. The waitress could not understand the simple menu presented in English - ‚ÄòFrench Fries‚Äô was looked at in amazement. The glass of red wine was dirty. We had to remind them about the coke we had ordered. The food was simply plonked on the table as the waitress and her male colleague woofed down bread rolls within clear sight of customers.

example_reviews: I went there almost every morning during my 3-week trip for breakfast. Chewy stick rice with various toppings to combine. Best stewed pork belly I ever have.

If you‚Äôre looking for the ultimate Vietnamese experience, this sticky rice is a true standout. The sticky rice is delightfully chewy and aromatic, paired with tender, well-seasoned meat that melts in your mouth!

Spacious and airy space, good and thoughtful service, delicious and clean food, convenient parking ‚ù§Ô∏è‚ù§Ô∏è‚ù§Ô∏è
Today I stopped by 100 Hai Ba Trung and had lunch. The food here is very delicious and the restaurant is very clean. The staff is also quick and very enthusiastic.

name: Quan Bia Minh
address: 7A Dinh Liet, Hanoi 100000 Vietnam
description: Just 2 minutes walk from the north end of Hoan Kiem lake at the lake end of Dinh Liet St
example_reviews: I ate here on my last night in Hanoi. I was on my own so sat upstairs on the balcony overlooking the busy street below. I ordered a beer and started with the pork spring rolls, which were really delicious. I ate a lot of spring rolls in Vietnam and these ones were up there with the best. For main meal I ordered a beef dish with chilli and lemongrass and was disappointed. I was served a huge plate of onion, with beef and carrot scattered throughout. Unfortunately I‚Äôm not a fan of onion, so I found myself picking around it. The flavour was a bit bland also. Had I just had beer and spring rolls, it would have been much better.

Hot day and really just stopped by for a local Bia Hoi. Sat on the terrace and people watched, which is something even novice people watchers like me can get into. The rhythms of this city are strangely recognizable under the superficial appearance of randomness. Service a bit slow ‚Ä¶ and it was not busy. But, good local beer and viewing of life.
Many choices in the menu, nice local upstairs and delicious pho. The only problem was that our dishes arrived with 15 minutes difference...

name: Manwah Taiwanese Hotpot Thai Ha
address: 1 Thai Ha 2nd Floor, Dong Da, Hanoi 100000 Vietnam
description:
If you are familiar with haidilao, then you may imagine this chain as an attempt to copy it.  Which is fine, if it is done well.  Unfortunately it falls short of the following issues:
(1). Soup base.  The Taiwanese special soup was good, but there were too many lotus seeds inside.  The tomato soup, my favourite for hotpot, was average.  
(2). Meats.  This is the first steamboat restaurant I have ever been to, that does not have chicken in the menu.  The waiter said there is duck, but he himself cannot find it in the menu.  He then served us a plate of duck‚Ä¶ (?!).  However, fried chicken is offered in the buffet.  Since I‚Äôm on missing items, this is also the first steamboat restaurant I have ever been to, that does not have plain steamed rice in the menu.  Yup, NO RICE but noodles.
(3). Desserts.  Although there is a large variety, some items tasted ‚Äúfunny‚Äù eg the black glutinous rice, the red ruby.  The ‚Äúraindrop‚Äù was amazing, though it tasted rather bland.
(4). Service.  There are minor attempts to provide a high level of service eg. One waiter came to help us peel the prawns - unfortunately, he came only after we were done with two of four prawns.  No one came to remove the foam from the soups.  Soup refilling needed to be asked for.  Soup ladles were not sufficient.  I note that the condiments were not regularly refilled either.

Our first and last visit,

This is the best hotpot in Hanoi with excellent services from restaurant manager and their staff. Truly 5 Star rating

A broad range of options, for all budgets. The most important in hotpot is the control of the temperature and you are provided with an effective tool to modify it depending on the food you put inside (e.g. octopus, red meat, meatballs, etc.). The deserts are average. The tables at the periphery are right next to the shopping mall pathway so not recommended as they are noisy. Better choose inside tables. Need to book in advance as it is popular.

name: Tomato Seafood
address: 82 Le Van Huu Street, Hai Ba Trung District, Hanoi Vietnam
description: Fresh seafood everyday, in a clean and modern restaurant with reasonable price and friendly staffs. This seafood restaurant brand has 2 locations in town: 82 Le Van Huu, Hoan Kiem & 33 Nguyen Thi Dinh, Cau Giay.
example_reviews: New place for who want to try seafood combo. 765.000 vnd for 2 pax. Included : baked oyster. Sauteed vegetable. Fried bebe. Crab hot pot. Service is ok. Nothing special when leaving here.
I am Vietnamese. I find seafood here, when the taste is quite good. However, sometimes you have to wait for many guests

address: 04 Vu Ngoc Phan, Hanoi 10000 Vietnam

This was a good place to have a beer or two, with western style food, while watching the world go by on the round-a-about from the 4th floor. All very clean and reasonably priced.

And we did manage to get one of the edge tables that give a great view over Hoan Kiem Lake. But personally the reason I really liked it was that it did two draft house beers and one of these was a really good dark beer. We found it a very good elevated spot to take a break from walking the lake and rest with a decent beer for a while. Oh and the Free Wi-Fi worked well as well..

example_reviews: Now when I go alone, I order Butter Chicken. One person's portion is enough to eat enough for two people, so if you're on a diet, remember to tell the chef to add some butter & rice!! 10 points of unique Indian flavor, rice grains are very loose & delicious. Will come back thanks

- delicious food, chicken curry sauce is quite suitable, rich and creamy. Long grain rice is sticky and fragrant. Eat with roll sauce - You order Khanh something lovely + friendly staff - The minus point is that the food I ordered was quite spicy and had a lot of flour, so I got bored eating it quickly. Few green vegetables because I'm used to eating green vegetables in Vietnam.

Yummy curry! We had Paneer tikka masala and Daal Makhni. We also had buttered Naan, garlic butter naan and Mango Lassi. It was all yummy. We enjoyed our meal and will come again. Khanh was very helpful with our order.

name: Cincin H√† N·ªôi
address: 80 Hang Trong, Hanoi Vietnam
description: Found this little gem by chance on a hot Friday afternoon looking to escape the heat for a cool wine and snack. Greeted by a young fresh exuberant team who went out of their way to look after us for what ended up being a couple of hours of relaxation, soft background music, great wines and fantastic cheese platter and pate which is no mean fete given the location.  The small restaurant is brilliantly decorated but what made it extra special was to watch a team of four young, polite, attentive and jovial staff who clearly enjoy their work and love being with and attending to customers.  What a refreshing and positive experience to see positive enthusiastic young people at work.  Definitely on our visit again list and highly recommended.

Cincin was an unexpected delight to encounter. Great food and drinks in a modern contemporary setting. The staff were attentive and the ambience was lovely. We were able to take a break from the hustle and bustle of Hanoi to enjoy a small bite to eat. I chose the chilli and garlic prawns, truffle chips and the profiterole's. I also had the oolong milk tea. All was delicious! I would recommend this place to all.

name: Swing Lounge
address: 21 Trang Tien, Hanoi 100000 Vietnam
description: Swing Cafe & Restaurant offer you a classic but trendy atmosphere right in the heart of Hanoi. It's a great place to meet your business partners, hang out with your friends, or simply finish your ongoing novel with a cup of tea by the window overlooking the crowded Hanoi street. We offer various Vietnamese and Italian cuisines, as well as a large selection of teas, coffee, juices and delicious desert cakes. Swing Music Lounge opens every evening and it's truly a place where you can enjoy LIVE singers perform the best Vietnamese and English songs every nights. A dazzling perform stage, a romantic candle lit table, a delicious signature cocktails, a glass of the finest wine, or just simply a cold beer... we have it all!
cuisines: German Restaurants for Lunch in Hanoi
example_reviews: The restaurant first floor ambiance is interesting and the food is good. We went on a Saturday night before the show and it was extremely quiet, almost empty. Around 21:00 we then went up to the second floor where is the stage and it felt suddenly more crowded. I might be wrong but it seems that the place is mostly frequented by a young Vietnamese middle class. The staff kindly gave us the possibility to get a table and it looked like everyone else had their seats reserved in advance. Before the band there was 2 lady singers performing each 3 recorded songs as a warm up. The rock band was very talented, the atmosphere very cool but the sound was so loud that eventually we needed to cover our ears most of the time. After an hour we decided to leave before bursting our eardrums... Maybe it is not always loud like that but if that's the case then it is a bit of a shame as it makes it really hard to appreciate what is being played. Drinks are a bit pricy but you don't pay any entrance fee so it balance up the value. A cool place to hang out and if I may suggest bring some ear plugs just in case...

Really cool ambiance here, it seems like a popular music (live band) venue over the restaurant, the food was really delicious but getting the order and getting a waiter after was so hard just to get some pepper and salt. Thankfully one of them speak English the price was quite decent, spent 480000 for 3 people (3 meals and 1 fresh juice and 2 teas) I recommend this place if you have time and patience it's worth it.

We have really enjoyed the quality food, actually snacks, some finger foods, and softdrinks. Seem that evything went smooth but it just overall, this place a bit lack of smiles. From the satff. Great if the manager could look into this issue.

name: Let's Sushi
address: 13B Quoc Tu Giam Van Chuong, Hanoi 100000 Vietnam
description: The sashimi is fresh and soft. It melts long in my mouth. The sushi is flavorful and chewy. The Japanese beef is tenderly soft and with the sauce, it explodes a good taste in my mouth. For dessert, I have the mochi ice-cream. Overall, this deserves to be 100/10.
cuisines: German Restaurants for Lunch in Hanoi
example_reviews: The sashimi is fresh and soft. It melts long in my mouth. The sushi is flavorful and chewy. The Japanese beef is tenderly soft and with the sauce, it explodes a good taste in my mouth. For dessert, I have the mochi ice-cream. Overall, this deserves to be 100/10.
It was really good sushi. Good service too. The toilet is a bit dirty but this seems to be quite normal in Hanoi. If you are around pop in and enjoy. Yummy Sushi. And fresh.
Very decent sushi which was enjoyed by all. Close to train station which was useful for us. Kids enjoyed the gyoza and prawn tempura.

name: Ete Resto Cafe
address: 95 Giang Van Minh Ba Dinh District, Hanoi 100000 Vietnam
description: ETE offer a choice of western food. We are known in Hanoi for our burgers that in large size are quite impossible to finish! We also have food such as tartines,sandwiches, salad, fish and meat like 'tournedos' beef, chicken etc... We also have a vietnamese food. ETE is also a cafe/bar that offer a really big choice of drinks (soft,fresh fruit juices, belgium & local beers cocktails, spirits, wines). We are very near to B52 Museum, Ho Chi Minh Mausoleum and Museum.
cuisines: American Restaurants for Large Groups in Hanoi
Asian Restaurants with Private Dining in Hanoi
example_reviews: I‚Äôve been dropping into Ete/Resto Bar for the past 4-years and it never disappoints. It reminds me of an East Village dive, a saloon, a place to chill, drink booze and beer (cheaper than the average Hanoi bar) and eat good food (burgers, pizza for me). There are three floors, each with its own personality but its the main floor, with the winding bar and comfortable stools and funky ambiance that keeps me coming back. I can smoke thuoc loa (outside) and mingle with a collection of locals and expats. The service is exceptional and debit cards are welcome. Oh, and it opens early and stays open late. My kinda joint‚Ä¶
My wife and I stumbled across this place by accident on our recent trip to Vietnam. We enjoyed the Vietnamese food so much that we went back for a second visit.

My first time went to Ete bar was 10 months ago. First impression about the atmosphere was quite good. It was clean, music was relaxing and people were nice. If you don't know them well, they might show you very cold faces, but trust me all the staffs here are really really awesome and funny. Most of the staffs can speak both English and Vietnamese. So it's easy to order things on menu. Foods are so amazing. They have the best tastes ever. You maybhave chance to see three fat cats sometimes( around 4 pm till 7pm ).

name: New Sphinx Beer Bar
address: 02 Lang Ha, Hanoi 100000 Vietnam
description:
A very good place if you would like to have beer, Vietnamese Foods and Great Shows!

Great selection of beers and good foods!

Waitress are very friendly but not really good in English!

Shows are great and all dancers are really energetic!

If you would like to feel the night life of Vietnam, here is the place!

name: The Candles Restaurant
address: No. 6, Bao Khanh Lane, Hoan Kiem District, Hanoi Vietnam
description: Enjoy discreet dining in our beautiful Hanoi Pearl restaurant. There are plenty of traditional local specialities and international dishes in an intimate and informal setting to tempt you in our gorgeous restaurant. In-room-service is available from 06.30 am to 10.00 pm so you can enjoy delicious meals and snacks in the privacy of your room or suite.
cuisines: German Restaurants for Lunch in Hanoi
example_reviews: We had a great experience here. We occupied the terrace seating , open to the sky and stars. With the lights and music and gentle breeze, it made it all the more special. Waiters, though pleasantly mannered, couldn't take specific orders. The food was delicious, all credit goes to the chef and his team! Desserts are a must try! So are the cocktails.

Our entire experience, from the outstanding food that was beautifully presented, to the wonderful service provided by our attentive server, Julie, made our Christmas dinner special. I highly recommend this gem in the Hanoi Pearl Hotel.üòäüëç
Fantastic food, a lot of variety. Western and Vietnamese. Impeccable service! We had a birthday that night. They went out of their way to decorate!

name: Crust Pizzaria
address: 3 Alley 12 Dang Thai Mai, Hanoi 100000 Vietnam
description: Daily fresh made pasta and 72 hour cold fermented pizza dough, home fermented jalapenos, garlic and chili sauce. Quality all the way with only fresh ingredients.
cuisines: BBQ Restaurants for Large Groups in Hanoi
example_reviews: For me The best pizza in Hanoi. The crust is perfect, thin and crunchy and a can hold the ingredients well. I do missing more toppings options such as corn, eggplant, green olives, etc. I do think extra cheese is necessary especially with the pepperoni. Wood oven would have make it even better, but still it's very good pizza
The pizza is absolutely fantastic here. If you have a western taste palate you will love it. Staff very friendly and service good. I will return here for sure.
Pizza and pasta are good, OK, but not other things. Friendly staffs. Good for young couple or teenages

example_reviews: We've just moved to the area and this place is just down the road, and we'll be back in future. It's reasonably quiet although the usual bike/car horns can get irritating. There's indoor and outdoor seating, and quite a few books inside if that's what takes your fancy. Staff were great although it was very quiet (we were probably first customers of the day). I'm not sure what it's like when it is busy. I had the omelette and my wife had the Eggs Benedict, it has most of the brunch staples but there are some Viet things thrown in as well. Coffee is also pretty good. Prices are reasonable and we'll be trying it out again soon.

name: Vietnamese street food
address: 8 Quan Su, Hanoi, Vietnam, Hanoi 10000 Vietnam
description: Authentic Vietnamese street food. We offer a variety of dishes featuring Vegetarian options. No MSG is found here, ensuring that you leave feeling just as good as before, or better! cuisines: South American Restaurants for Lunch in Hanoi
example_reviews: We went on a street food tour with 'Long' who was a very experienced and entertaining guide. Our hotel, The Angel Palace, organised this for us. We tasted some amazing food and Long explained all the ingredients so we knew exactly what we were eating.......and it was all fantastic.
Lots of street food & its worth trying. Most all of it is good & cheap. We tried it all & didn't get sick.
We were treated to some amazing street food and culture by eating here, just be patient with communicating if you don't speak Vietnamese

name: Citadel Skybar
address: 12 - 14 Dinh Ngang 9th Floor, Hanoi 100000 Vietnam
description: I went to the sky bar in the afternoon to watch the beautiful sunset and the open space. Moreover, I was served by bartender Hung Cao, who was great, professional working style, enthusiastic with customers, drinks were delicious and suitable for me. I have been to many restaurants but this is the best experience because the space and staff make me very satisfied and memorable.

Frenkie Viet was the best person we met in Vietnam, very friendly to guide on dishes based on our personal choices and suggesting the best way to eat and spend quality time with friends . Thank you Frenkie!!!! Thank you Citadel Sky Bar

It was such an awesome choice to spend my birthday here!! The room was awesome, clean and comfortable, and the balcony was a bonus. I think what made it special was the service from the staff. I feel so so welcome! This afternoon while I was in my room, I had a knock on the door and it was two of the the service staff with a cake in hand, singing HBD to me. I honestly didn‚Äôt expect that and it really made my day. At the sky bar, I also got a little free shot for my birthday. They pay super attention to details and I think the only way I could properly thank them is to leave a review (which I am usually too lazy to). So thank you to the receptionist Minh (he looks like a superstar) and Trang, and the friendly bartenders Tu, Haivu and Viet for being so welcoming! I will definitely come back again when I‚Äôm at Hanoi next!

example_reviews: This is a hidden gem in Hanoi! At the end of our trip, both my partner and I agreed that this had been the best Bahn Mi we had during our week in Hanoi. It‚Äôs difficult to find as you must walk up some stairs as the restaurant is on the second floor. They serve vegan options, and we‚Äôre attentive to my partners nut allergy

Great spot off the beaten track and best Banh Mi we have tried whilst in Hanoi. Omelette, mushroom and cheese was the veggie option which was lovely and well priced at 30k VND (¬£1 ish). Very friendly host.

Hard to spot, because it‚Äôs upstairs on a fairly busy through fare, but it‚Äôs a cute little nook. The food was stellar. The spring rolls were fresh and tasty and the banh mi sandwiches were next level. Slightly crispy baguettes, with perfectly cooked chicken (maybe done in coconut oil?). Tasted exquisite.

example_reviews: 5/5 great food, service and location. We ate at this spot while we were in Hanoi. I enjoyed the fried garlic chicken and fries. The chicken was perfectly fried and seasoned. Great staff and location. We had the opportunity to see the train pass while we ate. Such an awesome city.
The chicken was sooooo good. It was moist and flavorful. I got both the ginger and the garlic and both were amazing. Definitely worth checking if you are in the area.
Great Zangi and udon üçú. Friendly staff and taking care. Specially auth favor from Hokkaido Japan. Best recomment. I will come again üòçüòçüòç

The dumplings were not of my taste but the salad was okay. Nice street atmosphere and cheap prices. Service was nice and fast.

name: Au Lac Club
address: 3 Nguyen Khac Can, Hanoi 1383 Vietnam
description: We tried the Au Lac as it was close to our hotel and we had a good experience. Reasonable prices and decent food - I had a noodle soup and my wife the bbq pork washed down with some local beer. We did sit outside though as they still allowing smoking inside in Vietnam
cuisines: Middle Eastern Restaurants for Lunch in Hanoi
example_reviews: We tried the Au Lac as it was close to our hotel and we had a good experience. Reasonable prices and decent food - I had a noodle soup and my wife the bbq pork washed down with some local beer. We did sit outside though as they still allowing smoking inside in Vietnam
Second time eating lunch here, good selection on the menu fast service and nice atmosphere well worth a try

We were about to get some supper after a fairly long trip from Laos and wandered down the hotel to the back bar. I noticed the restaurant over the road which was full of clients on the footpath having a great time so I talked the wife into going there instead. We sat inside and watched the wine flow outside, the order which wasn't large was placed and we ordered a wine and waited and waited and waited. I stopped our waiter who was racing outside with carafes of expensive wines several times but he would smile and indicate "just a moment". After an hour we gave up and plodded back to the hotel. I am sure it was a lovely restaurant but we will never know.

name: The Deli Restaurant
address: 52 Bat Su street, Hoan Kiem district Hanoi Delano Hotel, Hanoi 10000 Vietnam
description: The Deli Restaurant & Bar is situated on the ground floor of Hanoi Delano Hotel- an upscale and stylish boutique located right in the heart of The Old Quarter at 52 Bat Su Street.The Deli offers a classy and contemporary vibe for a tasty lunch or dinner, Includings: - Vietanmese Cuisine - Set Menu Vietnamese, Western Menu - Ala Carte Menu - Cooking Class ( Vietnamese ) - Pub served wine, Beer, Drink - Happy Hours from 15:00 until 18:00 Daily ( Buy 1 get 1 Free )
example_reviews: Great place to get a bite to eat and escape the busy streets of Hanoi's Old Quarter. Our waitress Mai was extremely attentive and did everything to make our experience a memorable one.

Fabulous food to be enjoyed here. We have had Vietnamese food, steak and burgers and everything tasted great. The staff is very friendly and makes sure that your every need is attended to. Def will recommend this place

Nice and cozy ambiance that is perfect for a dinner date, or family gathering. They offer a wide range of food from Vietnamese cuisine to hamburgers, spaghetti, pizza, etc. Great staff and they speak fluent English! I love the Fuji beef dish that I ordered. It's sooooo TENDER and JUICY and I love the sauce that goes with it. The Deli Restaurant is definitely A MUST TRY if you want to escape the hustle and bustle of the city for a while and enjoy the great ambiance with various food options.

name: Surf'n'Fries
address: 17 Nha Tho, Hanoi 10000 Vietnam
description: European franchise with restaurants in 11 countries. We serve best fries in town with specially marinated chicken,corn dogs and burgers. All of our food is served in specially designed environmentally friendly packaging. You can either dine in or enjoy our food while strolling historic sites of old quarter. We are happy to serve you!
cuisines: Vietnamese Restaurants for Large Groups in Hanoi
American Restaurants for Lunch in Hanoi
Asian Restaurants with Buffet in Hanoi
example_reviews: a little good fatty food to taste and to have fries with cheezy fries, nice, not too expensive, near the church, peaceful and coloured

I kept walking by this place near my hotel, and after a few days I decided to try it. The large fries are just 59,000 VND and are served in a cone shaped container (the tables have holes built in to hold it upright), one choice of seasoning, and two dipping sauces. The two sauces (I chose spicy cheese and hotino) were the stars of the meal. It was a bit of a wait, although understandable for a Saturday night. There's a play area on ground level for children, so sit upstairs if you want some peace and quiet.

The burgers are really tasty, especially the hamburger ! The fried potatoes are so nice too, cut in many different ways with a big variety of sauces to choose! We visited this place twice and it was a dinner that we really enjoyed. The stuff doesn't speak very good English but they are very willing to service you. Normal prices. I would suggest you to eat on the 1rst floor if you are annoying of the children playing on the ground floor.

description: Welcome to 5th Royal Rajhistan Indian Restaurant Hano Indulge in an authentic Indian culinary experience at 5th Royal Rajhistan Indian Restaurant Hano, where traditional flavors meet modern elegance. Our menu features a wide array of vegetarian and non-vegetarian dishes crafted with the finest ingredients and aromatic spices that transport you to the heart of India. Whether you‚Äôre in the mood for classic favorites like butter chicken and biryani or exploring regional specialties, our chefs bring the essence of Indian cuisine to every dish. Enjoy a warm and inviting ambiance with attentive service that makes you feel at home. Our team is dedicated to providing an unforgettable dining experience, ensuring every visit leaves you craving more. Perfect for intimate dinners, family gatherings, or celebrations, our restaurant offers a vibrant and welcoming atmosphere. Join us at 5th Royal Rajhistan Indian Restaurant Hano for a journey of flavors that promises to delight your taste buds an

example_reviews: Amazing ambience and the food is simply brilliant, awesome taste and don't miss this place if you want mouth watering Indian food. The service is extremely good and kind and quick, special thanks to Mr. Naresh nautiyal who took care of us really well. Great job

We stayed here in Hanoi 5 days tried all menu food is amazing portion size is big food price is really really cheap compare chef came to ask us if your food is delicious good nice friendly service recomendid

I was looking for pure vegeterian Indian food and i found this restaurant was amazing. Food was so delicous and authentic. People were so nice and friendly. Price very cheap to be honest. Hightly recommend !

name: Botanica Restaurant
address: 116/ D4 Giang Vo, 3 Thai Phien, 7 Kim Ma Thuong, Hanoi 100000 Vietnam
description: Botanica Restaurant 3 Thai Phien, Hai Ba Trung, Ha Noi. Boutique Restaurant is very close to Vincom Centre, Ba Trieu, Hanoi
example_reviews: If you like a good steak at a reasonable price, then Botanica is the place for you. A great variety of beef cuts on offer, great salad and crispy baguette. Situated close to VinCom, Ba Trieu, it is very central and yet not touristy. You won't be disappointed.

Had the pork ribs at 150,000 Dong. They were tender and juicy, came with fries and a small portion of very good salad including 2 small buns. Will definitely go back. Waiter and waitress spoke very good English. Read on for more detailed unnecessary information. We went on Christmas Eve specifically for the ribs. They weren't on the menu because we were told it was a holiday menu. They made us 2 sets of rib dishes anyways because we asked for them. I noticed that some items were blanked out on the menu. For a restaurant in Asia offering Western Style food, this place was excellent. Went to S&L's dinner last week which is actually run by an expat and both dishes we ordered (fish&chips, entree platter) were below average, very expensive and disappointed us to the point of never wanting to return, feeling that we had wasted our money. I am a Canadian with 18 months of experience travelling Asia. Botanica is an excellent place to go for really good steak meal at a reasonable price.
I happyned to eat lunch. I feel good food,friendly service,beautiful space. I think the ideal place to date with friend. Thanks very much!

description: The first western Chinese restaurant in Hanoi serving up classics such as peking duck, beef in black bean sauce, chow mein, dimsum and sweet n sour chicken balls. Also a range of authentic dishes. Set in westlake the restaurant has an award winning design and is also the home to Opium cocktail bar serving Asian themed cocktails and classics into the small hours.

example_reviews: Delicious ü§§ and excellent prices and portion sizes!!! Staff is knowledgeable and friendly!! It‚Äôs a quite, yet festive and relaxing atmosphere. Perfect for a casual evening with friends or a date. It was beautifully decorated for Christmas üéÑ as well! The veggie chow main was delicious, along with the peppered chicken and seafood dishes. They are open late, yet the food is always hot and fresh! Very happy with the service, price and taste!!! We will be back! Follow @travelingypsey on Instagram & GoogleMaps!!!

I had an amazing time at Opium bar and The Great Wall restaurant last night! The food surpassed my expectations, incredibly delicious. The ambiance was stunning, with a romantic and cozy feel. The lighting truly set the perfect mood. What stood out the most was the exceptional hospitality ‚Äì the staff was unbelievably friendly and inviting. A fantastic experience overall!
This is a decent spot; came across it and ordered home. The prices are ok and the portions and big. If you're craving Chinese, try it out.

name: Oc Nong Ha Trang
address: 1A Dinh Liet Hang Dao, Hoan Kiem, Hanoi 100000 Vietnam
description: Delicious snails! We got the big ones. They reminded me of the ones I used to eat in Italy as a child. My granfather used to pick them up and my grandmother used to cook them with tosato sauce. These ones are served with a sweet sauce. Really nice.
example_reviews: Delicious snails! We got the big ones. They reminded me of the ones I used to eat in Italy as a child. My granfather used to pick them up and my grandmother used to cook them with tosato sauce. These ones are served with a sweet sauce. Really nice.

This is clearly a local hotspot! First I noticed it was very crowded, not even a free table, on the contrary, they even put extra table opposite and those were also occupied. People seemed to be enjoying very much, and that intrigued me and wanted to eat there. It took some 10 minutes to get a table. Seated on small plastic chairs, in the midst of the locals we were excited for the experience. We ordered snails, frog legs (they bring them from a neighbour lady), kumquat juice and beer. Omg!!! The freshness and taste of everything! First, they brought us a huge bowl of garlic and chilli, and another one of very flavourful green herbs, all to accompany the dishes. What followed was a real feast of joy and awe! While we were enjoying our meals, we noticed some clams at our table neighbours and we ordered a portion of those too. Omg!!! The broth the clams were cooked in was something out of this world: pineapple, lemongrass and I don‚Äôt know what else, but it was amazing! Very fragrant, fresh and nourishing! It‚Äôs a small restaurant but oh, they cook amazing, besides the quality ingredients they put a lot of soul and smiles into their dishes. We both felt very satisfied and left excited to dive deeper into the exquisite Vietnamese. Highly recommend them!
Snails here is good! But the best is dipping sauce! Fast serving but only snails, the rest of the menu will take quite sometime to prepare! Price is ok!

name: Su Buffet
address: 64 Nguyen Du Street Hoan Kiem District, Hanoi 10000 Vietnam
description: Nice restaurant with white color designate. Clean and good service. Buffe with lot of choice, good quality. but the price a bit high. easy to find, near the Lake (Thien Quang lake).
cuisines: American Restaurants with Buffet in Hanoi
example_reviews: Nice restaurant with white color designate. Clean and good service. Buffe with lot of choice, good quality. but the price a bit high. easy to find, near the Lake (Thien Quang lake).
This buffet has a lot of variety from Vietnamese, to meat to seafood. Ok priced and food is good. Check it out if you're in the area and very hungry.

The restaurant is opulent. Chandeliers and spiral staircase Three rooms laid out with a multitude of different foods - just help yourself I was part of a large party We were served a selection of dishes including oysters, baked oysters, salmon sushi, large shrimps, beautifully cooked steak with a spicy sauce, roast ham with pineapple, roast pork, grilled fish, salads etc.The waiters were discretely removing the clutter of shells, bones etc. We were then told to help ourselves to the buffet on the floor below It was like Aladdin's cave. Just so many choices The food is beautifully laid out - tureens of soup, rice, noodles, sushi, large fish, chicken feet, clams, cockles, sardines, bahn mi, Vietnamese sandwiches etc. etc.(Also pizzas for teh kids) Another room with a myriad of deserts I sampled a few items - too full to do the buffet justice All the food was well prepared - most was very, very good, I tried a desert of a warm coconut broth with sago - really nice and at my host's insistence a mango pudding - also really nice An absolute foodie' paradise Really worth trying out - make sure you come here hungry

name: Mum
address: 36 Hang Mam, Hanoi 10000 Vietnam
description: We are committed to provide at a fair price-nutritional,well-prepared meals only using the finest ingredients in our recipes.No food leaves our kitchen that we ourselves would not eat.
example_reviews: The best restaurant in Hanoi! Fresh food, beautiful presentation, economic prices and lovely staff! If you¬¥re lucky enough, you¬¥ll get to meet "Mum"!

Visited late evening and found it to be so busy, always a good sign in this little eateries! We decided to stay in line and wait for a table to become available. We looked at the menu before sitting so not to waste any time, good customers we are. The staff told us about how they cook everything fresh to order in a tiny kitchen so we were shocked and quite happy to see nothing wasted or being sat around in the kitchen for too long. The food was delicious, we ordered a variety of items, Pho, Bulgogi and coconut rice along with some snack starters and we couldn't be happier with the meal. Very good value for money and generous portions. Everything was seasoned well and tasted delicious!

This little restaurant doesn't look like much from the street but there's a nice seating area upstairs where you can get off the busy Hanoi street and have a great dinner. They have several veggie and vegan options and the prices are great. Definitley worth a visit while in Hanoi.

name: Com Tam Chat
address: 4 Dinh Ngang Hoan Kiem, Hanoi 100000 Vietnam
description: Com Tam Chat(C∆°m T·∫•m Ch·∫•t) is a well known broken rice restaurant in Hanoi, probably the most famous place to eat the simple combination of a grilled pork chop over the top of a bed of rice, known in Vietnamese as com tam suon nuong (c∆°m t·∫•m s∆∞·ªùn n∆∞·ªõng).
example_reviews: I tried it in Saigon, and luckily it was in Hanoi. The restaurant offers the foods are cheap & super delicious. It is a must to try their pork belly cos once you eat & you will never stop having it again.
I just have one word to talk about tasting of foods here is wonderful. I believe that C∆°m T·∫•m Ch·∫•t will become a famous food brand in the nearly future!!!
Had 1 full plate of broken rice covered with pork chop, fried egg, etc. Impressive taste. Great meal.

name: Nachos2go
address: 39 Ta Hien Street Corner of Ta Hien & Hang Bac Streets, Hanoi 100000 Vietnam
description: Real nachos. Really good. Our nachos are made with pure corn tortillas and ingredients like cheddar cheese, jalape√±o peppers & fresh cilantro, topped with our medium spicy salsa & sour cream. A hearty meal for one. A tasty snack for two or more. Beer, soft drinks and tequila shots! Street side seating next to the Trung Vang Theater - a great place to people watch. Open daily from noon to past midnight.
cuisines: South American Restaurants for Lunch in Hanoi
example_reviews: Not a review, but FYI the proprietor has opened MexMix, a full menu restaurant serving authentic Mexican cuisine made with fresh baked tortillas and dried chilies imported from Mexico. Plus there are other home cooked recipes from around the planet. Yep, those addictive margaritas are still being served. It's about a 10 minute taxi ride from the Ta Hien address of Nachos2go. Or check out MexMix on Trip Advisor.

We went here at midnight, it‚Äôs a hole in wall stall with plastic stools on the pedestrian walk. We were tired of Vietnamese food and wanted to have nachos and burritos. The nachos were one of a kind, homemade, tasted very unique, thick chips, I for one preferred the good old style nachos chips, this was a miss for me. On the other hand, the burritos tasted like heaven. There were beers and tequilas available too. Won‚Äôt mind going back to having another of these although for Hanoi the prices of 3-4 USD seemed on the higher side.

Stumbled across this place yesterday and ended up going there twice in the one day! The nachos were delicious on both occasions. Beef nachos weren't on the menu but they were happy to make them for us. All made on site and the owner prepares some of the ingredients from home. Met the lovely owner and was good to have a chat to her! Might pop back later today for the burrito!!

name: Bangkok Thai Kitchen
address: 15C Dao Tan Ba Dinh, Hanoi 100000 Vietnam
description: Went there to see a friend and had ordered a lot of food from this Thai restaurant during my stay in HANOI. Loved all the food there. close to Thai food we have in Thailand but not 100% i give them 85%

Perfect vegeterian green curry, you can order with toVfu or without. So good we ate there 3 times already. Very friendly place and great service. For all you craving for some GOOD thai food after all the fried rice THIS IS THE PLACE FOR YOU!

I've been to the Giang Vo location a number of times but this was my first time here. I cannot get over how delicious Bangkok Thai Kitchen is. My massaman curry was phenomenal with the perfect sweetness and without so many potatoes that they overwhelmed the dish. The chicken and rice perfectly absorbed the amazing sauce. I know that I often say that I plan to return to places...but I actually already have plans to go back next week!

name: Pho Thin Lo Duc
address: 19B Hoang Ngoc Phach, Hanoi 100000 Vietnam
description: The short introduction in CNN Travel tell everything about Ph·ªü Th√¨n 13 Lo Duc: "Trying street food is a really important part of understanding and experiencing Hanoi culture. People here love food. They are passionate about it and very picky. "They won't eat at restaurants unless they're very good. So, if you see an empty street food restaurant -- don't go. "While in Hanoi you must eat the national noodle soup: Ph·ªü, usually made with thin slices of beef, a slow-cooked beef broth and spices like cinnamon, anise and ginger. "There is not a week that goes by where I don't eat at least one bowl of ph·ªü. I'd suggest a local stall called Ph·ªü Th√¨n. "It's just one lady who has been doing the same soup for years. She has no fridge, so she goes every day to the market and the food is always fresh." https://edition.cnn.com/travel/article/hidden-hanoi-nancy-chandler-map/index.html
cuisines: Japanese Restaurants with Private Dining in Hanoi
Late Night Mediterranean Restaurants in Hanoi
example_reviews: Same simple, clear, authentic and tasty bowl of pho. No need to write much. I love the traditional setting in Lo Duc, but this branch can be for bringing my friends and families.

Amazing pho!! Plenty of green herbs, very very busy and an 'in and out' kind of vibe. Don't think they serve any beverages or at least the don't advertise it at all. Come for one thing, just pho! 60,000 for 1 pho. The tastiest we've had so far.

We visited a well-established local Four specialty store. We stood in line, but it was well worth the wait! I was impressed by the beefy soup and the perfectly textured noodles. The two of us finished our meal while staring at each other's deliciousness. I was able to experience the essence of Vietnamese cuisine, including the local atmosphere.

Delicious bread, very suitable for taste. You should enjoy more coffee and sandwiches. Service staff are enthusiastic and friendly

name: Ramen Haron
address: 40 Ling Lang, Ba Dinh, Hanoi 10000 Vietnam
description: This is the best ramen that I've found in Hanoi - it is as good or better than the ramen that you would eat in Japan. Rich, buttery broths, fresh noodles cooked to perfection, generous slices of meat, all the right flavors and tastes. The tonkotsu is my favorite so far. Service was great when I ate at the restaurant, though they also deliver, which is quick, easy, and hassle-free. Great experience!

Not a ramen or food connoisseur in general, but I'd say this is the best ramen restaurant in Hanoi after visiting several other places. Distinctive and flavourful broth. If it weren't for the long distance, I'd be a more frequent visitor. Recommended.

Been trying a lot of ramen spots in Hanoi a came across Ramen Haron after reading the reviews online. It's down a small alley so don't let that throw you off. The ramen was absolutely incredible and the staff were very friendly and attentive (given how busy they were). The prices are very reasonable for what you get. Definitely check this out if you are in the mood for REAL ramen.

name: Milk And Honey
address: 46 Tu Hoa Cong Chua, Hanoi Vietnam
description:
We returned here for a second time as we had been just after tet before and they were running low on a lot of food and we didn't feel the first time reflected the restaurant very well.
There were four of us for brunch on a Sunday morning, and we could see that they had updated their menu since our last visit.
The two men ordered salmon eggs benedict and a sandwich and us ladies both ordered the Dutch cinnamon waffles but hence there was only 1 portion available. So not the best start, one of us changed the order to a sweet waffle instead.
The service was the same as last time and very slow, drinks arrived one at a time and spread out, to the point where some ordered a second drink waiting for the food. The eggs benedict looked amazing when it arrived and apparently tasted as good as it looked, lots of food envy! The cubano sandwich was large but also quite greasy with the melted cheese and a but hard going to eat for that reason. My portion of dutch waffles arrived and it was huge, there was so much cream and cinnamon apples on top of the waffle, to be honest it was so unnecessarily large that it could have been divided between the 2 of us who wanted it. The worst part was the other sweet waffles ordered as a replacement was pathetic in comparison, it had a small dollop of cream in the middle and looked rubbish compared to the Dutch portion and the prices were so similar.

The coffee was perfectly prepared ‚Äì a really delicious taste experience. It was served along with a lune blueberry-scone and a lune brownie, both of which tasted heavenly. A real pleasure! We were so excited that we have already decided to come back tomorrow. Can highly recommend!

We booked in advance for four people on Saturday afternoon but needn't have bothered with how many tables were available. What was super frustrating was that the menu had little stickers over about a third of the menu saying the items were not available. We manage to navigate round the and placed our order only for the waitress to return and let us know that some of the items we ordered - the sweet waffles were also no longer available, which ss we had chosen here for a waffle brunch was annoying. We managed to get 4 sandwiches which were actually really tasty along with a fruit smoothie. Hopefully if we returned on another day they actually have most of the menu available to taste

name: Peachy Craft Beer
address: 39 ƒêinh Ti√™n Ho√†ng T·∫ßng 2, Hanoi 10000 Vietnam
description: This is my second visit in a few days. What a hidden gem. Massive choice of craft beer, great decor and a balcony overlooking the lake. There‚Äôs a few craft beer bars in the old quarter now but really impressed how roomy this place is. Well worth a visit. Although it‚Äôs in a prime location it can be easily missed but 100% worth it.
cuisines: Late Night Mediterranean Restaurants in Hanoi

There‚Äôs a few craft beer bars in the old quarter now but really impressed how roomy this place is. Well worth a visit. What an amazing place, food and beer are awesome. Staff are so friendly, and the place is so modern but with some outstanding touches, like hand made tables and chairs. It‚Äôs hard to find, not well advertised, so try it before word gets around and it‚Äôs gets too popular. I normally don‚Äôt go for beer but really enjoyed the salted lime beer and pilsner.

Funky little bar over looking lake in the Old Quarter that provides a great selection of local craft beers. A hidden gem that can be hard to find but well worth finding it. The balcony was so great to sit on and watch the traffic go by. Highly recommended.

name: LA Rock Hanoi Restaurant & Coffee
address: S·ªë 26 Ph·ªë L√£n √îng Ph∆∞·ªùng H√†ng B·ªì, Qu·∫≠n Ho√†n Ki·∫øm, Hanoi 10000 Vietnam
description:
Restaurant near our hotel in old Hanoi...
Probably a recent establishment... Large rooms on the ground floor and upstairs... Very designer modern decor...
Welcome and attentive service but too reserved...
Very extensive and varied menu...
Careful and quality cuisine...
Average quality/price ratio...
Please note that drinks (beers and bottles of water on the tables) are charged at double the usual price, wet towels provided and appetizers served at the start of the meal are charged without prior notice...
In the end, a bill almost doubled compared to previous meals of similar quality...

After a long night out, this was the perfect atmosphere to start the day with. The energy was very comforting and welcoming. The staff are very kind and helpful, not to mention the food is delicious and professionally presented. Would definitely recommended coming here.
Hands down the best spring rolls I‚Äôve ever had. Light as a feather and so tasty. Good value for money and attentive staff.

name: An Phuc Vegetarian Restaurant
address: 20, Lane 113, Pho Hoang Cau, Dong Da, Hanoi 10000 Vietnam
description: An Phuc serves fresh vegetarian dishes bursting with so much flavor that the absence of meat will not be felt. The venue offers a warm interior that is the perfect spot to people-watch as you dig into your delicious meal. The menu includes tofu, spring rolls, vegan rice, vegan hotpot... The staff are warm, with smiles all around, adding to the experience. The portions are also rather large and the prices extremely cheap. You will find yourself returning here time and time again during your stay.

Late Night Middle Eastern Restaurants in Hanoi
example_reviews: Menu is perfect. The food was absolutely wonderful, from preparation to presentation, very pleasing. We highly recommend it.
We had a couples dinner at this restaurant an it was delicious, cheap,and the servers were very kind
My Vietnamese friends take me to An Phuc restaurant. I like Thai vegan hotpot in here. Good meal and good experien in Hanoi.

name: Green Inn - Plant-based Restaurant
address: 41 Hang Non, Hanoi Vietnam
description: Located beside Hoan Kiem Lake, Green Inn - the plant-based restaurant will give you enjoyable experience of traditional vegan cuisines. Our warm and friendly staff will make sure your dining time will be best served in our unique modern folk restaurant.
example_reviews: Many restaurants advertise vegetarian food and it√¢‚Ç¨‚Ñ¢s just five dishes in the menu. The Green Inn is 100% vegan. The dishes are inspired by traditional flavors but it√¢‚Ç¨‚Ñ¢s the ingredients that make them unique and delicious. The dishes feature many kinds of mushrooms which in the USA are at a premium. But the prices here are great. I had the pumpkin soup, Pho and mango sorbet. All delicious. I will be back in the area in a few days and plan to go back to try the rest of the extensive menu.

Stumbled across this restaurant and so glad I did! Really serene ambience, good service and delicious food. I had the Nam Bo mixed noodle from the Autumn menu. Great flavours! Ordered the Banh my to go and very excited to try. Menu has a good selection and you can pay by card.
Best vegan food we had in Hanoi. Lovely ambience and terrific food. Vietnamese food. Papaya salad was amazing. Also had lunch specials. Excellent service. A must visit

name: La Vong Grilled Fish
address: 14 Cha Ca Hang Bo, Hoan Kiem, Hanoi Vietnam
description: Visit this street after a long day of sight-seeing for a traditional dish of fish fried tableside with herbs, spices, onions, peanuts, and rice noodles.
cuisines: Late Night Middle Eastern Restaurants in Hanoi
Pizza for Large Groups in Hanoi
Late Night Seafood Restaurants in Hanoi
example_reviews: One dish only at VD170,000 per person, serve on a mini cooking plate with boiling oil, the dish is quite special but consider expensive base compare to local food, restaurant is on the second floor and need to walk up via narrow staircase

It is the original cha ca,located at no 14, cha ca street,the street name after the dish.but beware of another cha ca la vong,it used no 14 too,but different place.the original one dont use 14 cha ca as sign,so if you see the shop sign like 14 cha ca or something,then it is another one.anyway,the original one is not very luxury look,it is very normal place.so you may miss it.they sell one dish only,that is cha ca the grill fish.it is a traditional northern vietnam food,you hardly find it in the south.the price for one person is VND170,000,(cannot share),not cheap.the marinated fish in hot pan will arrive at the table, alongside a basket of think vermicelli, fresh herbs, roasted peanuts, chili.it may oily,but the taste is good,and the portion not big,so make it a bit expensive. service is nothing special to say,but ok,the staff or owner wont ignore you,due to language barrier,they dont speak much,instead,they will do everything for you,so order is not a problem.if you are the first time in Hanoi,this place still worth a visit,at least try once.

Full of locals which is always a good sign, the food was tasty and the novelty of cooking the fish and herbs yourself on a burner is fun. However, this restaurant is really aimed at locals and takes tourists for a bit of a ride. Although not expensive by Western standards, it becomes very apparent that they√¢‚Ç¨‚Ñ¢re charging you 3-4 times what they√¢‚Ç¨‚Ñ¢re charging the locals for what felt like an overly small portion. While it seems somewhat petty to complain over 6K VND (25 cents), they added this to the bill for wet wipes that they gave us without asking. Knowing that they√¢‚Ç¨‚Ñ¢d already charged ya a lot more than locals this felt galling. Finally, although the food came very quickly service was otherwise non existent - the English speaking member of staff did nothing to be proactive and only explained the meal and process after we had flagged him down and asked several times.

the menu is quite extensive. foods are fresh and taste more Japanese authentic flavors.

Then the waiter found out about the missing sauce and he offered a whole new set. I was very surprise and please about both the food and the service. Definitely come back!

name: Cheers Bar
address: 5 Ch√°¬ª¬£ G√°¬∫¬°o, H√É¬†ng Bu√°¬ª‚Äúm, Ho√É¬†n Ki√°¬∫¬øm, H√É¬† N√°¬ª‚Ñ¢i, Hanoi Vietnam
description: A late-night venue to grace Hanoi's Old Streets. We are open from 4 pm till 2 am every day of the week. Serving authentic Sri Lankan and Vietnamese food every day. The home of Hanoi Reds and an excellent place for Music, Food, Laughter and a great mixture of drinks. Come and join us for a night of fun at Cheers. All sports events live with English commentary.
cuisines: German Restaurants for Lunch in Hanoi
example_reviews: Cheers is a cracking hole in the wall with indoor and outdoor seating. The staff are excellent, punters can choose their music and they'll make the effort to get sports on should you want them! Draught beer, spirits, lots of different people but in an area with so many options and tourists the regulars give it that welcoming feel. Cheers to cheers.

I couldn't get myself out of this bar! Jessica is an outstanding person, very friendly and happy! The bar had the world cup on and music if wanted. The alcohol and service there was phenomenal and even had their own brewed cider which went down a treat!! Lovely place!

I√¢‚Ç¨‚Ñ¢ve been to cheers bar many times and it√¢‚Ç¨‚Ñ¢s always an enjoyable time. There is often a big crowd for any sporting event early or late making it a great place to watch games and meet people. They have a large selection of drinks at a good price along with a wide variety of Vietnamese and western foods you can eat at the bar. The location is also perfect because you are right in old quarter but also close to the main road making it an easy place to find. I recommend it to anyone visiting Hanoi.

name: Little Charm Restaurant
address: 44 Hang Bo Hoan Kiem, Hanoi 100000 Vietnam
description: Little Charm restaurant has Italian style which is located in the central of Old Quarter. In our restaurant, we serve both Italian Food and Vietnamese food which are great choice for your lunch or dinner with friends or family. Our best seller food are Little Charm Special Pizza, Beef Burger, Hanoi Pesto, Ceasar salad...
cuisines: Late Night Vietnamese Restaurants in Hanoi
example_reviews: We arrived back at our hotel late on Christmas Day. We were hoping to get something delivered and the front desk gave us Little Charm Restaurants take out menu. We ordered a pepperoni pizza and some cheesy bread. Their prices were reasonable. It was going to be about 30mins before it arrived. They arrived on time and the food was still very hot. It was all very really good but not game changer. The pizza was much smaller then expected (Comparing to Canadian sizes).

If you go at the hostel, I take breakfast included, you have a lot of choices. But coffee and juice are instants. For the rest, same price than for another touristic restaurant. At the night, you can enjoy the street food outside.
Quiet restaurant in the busy old quarter. Lovely food - local and western both were fresh and great tasting! Would recommend!!

name: The Leopard Sport Club
address: 27 Hang Giay Hoan Kiem, Hanoi 024 Vietnam
description: A great location in the heart of Hanoi, right in the action of the Old Quarter. What a warm welcome from The Leopard Sport Club, had such a wonderful time enjoying the draft beer and great food. Highly recommend to people for a great night with friends!
example_reviews: Located near the busiest bar street un Hanoi. Great Staff.Good drinks.Good laughs.They let you play tour on music.Will be coming back again ;)
Nice bar, good atmosphere free football table to play on! Helpful staff very friendly and speak good English
Had a lovely time with iced tea and coffee and delicious sandwiches. The staff were very nice and music on point!

name: V's Home

description: Words cannot describe how delicious the food is ! If only all vegan food was that good everywhere! We had the carbonara, sweet potato pizza and a beetroot noodle soup. Everything was excellent and the place is so cozy and wonderfully decorated. Prices are beyond reasonable for organic, vegan and delicious food.

Situated in old quarter hanoi and near our hotel...this was nice finding to quench our hunger as we both we‚Äôre vegetarian. I would say this is authentic Vietnamese restaurant. Food was ultimate, reasonable and they took only 15 min to prepare our order. Recommended dish is spring rolls.

Amazing food, great decor with a very welcoming calm vibe. The ethos and commitment to organic food and flavours is fantastic. The began carbonara is to die for. Literally the best I have ever tried. Left us speechless the flavours, freshness and taste. It‚Äôs also a social enterprise supporting rural school building in Vietnam. Do not miss this place. Amazing üíïüëèüèªüôè thank you üòÑ

name: Tam Cuisine - Hanoi Cooking Class & Culinary Experience
address: 481 Ngoc Thuy, Hanoi 100000 Vietnam
description: Taste Hanoi, the heart of the Red River Delta! Explore Hanoi's culinary legacy through the enchanting tale of T·∫•m Cuisine. Inspired by the folklore of T·∫•m C√°m, our venture embodies the spirit of T·∫•m‚Äîa resilient, diligent woman symbolizing Vietnamese strength. From cooking classes to private dining, we celebrate Hanoi's rich traditions while preserving its authentic flavors. Join us on a gastronomic journey steeped in folklore, where every dish tells a story. Inspired by Tradition: Dive into Hanoi's culinary legacy rooted in Vietnamese folklore. Experience Authenticity: Join local women-led cooking classes & workshops. Seasonal Menus: Discover Hanoi's flavors, served harmoniously with each season. Private Dining: Indulge in tailored meals showcasing Vietnam's rich food heritage. Sustainable & Authentic: Engage in genuine cultural exchanges, supporting local communities ‚ú® Preserving Tradition, Crafting Memories: Explore Hanoi's culinary secrets.
cuisines: Sushi Restaurants for Lunch in Hanoi
Thai Restaurants with Private Dining in Hanoi
Vietnamese Restaurants for Lunch in Hanoi
example_reviews: Incredible experience and highly recommend. Shopped in the market and continued to a beautiful home on the Red River to prepare (with expert assistance) one of the most delicious meals we‚Äôve had on our Vietnamese trip! Meal was customized for us (I have a shellfish allergy)‚Ä¶delicious, unique, authentic food experience!

An Incredible and a must do cooking experience, from shopping in the local market to expertly guided preparation for the most delicious authentic meal. We felt so welcome in the beautiful home on the Red River to enjoy conversations, questions, & learning new techniques, It was one of our most favorite meals and special times while visiting Hanoi.
The setting in the river was lovely and the food was delicious. We learned some good techniques as well! We will visit again, for sure!

name: Bien Nho - Seafood Restaurant
address: 2B Trang Thi, Hanoi 10000 Vietnam
description:
I was looking for the BEST seafood in Hanoi and found the Bien Nho seafood.
restaurant. On arrival I was shown to the tanks of fresh seafood along the far wall that included Lobsters of all sizes, Crabs of several different verities, clams, oysters, dozens of large and small fish types along with sea urchins and abalone. I chose 12 Oysters on the half shell and 2 extra large lobsters for me and my girl to enjoy. WOW what a meal. We were both stuffed when after we had our coffee at the end of the meal. With our drinks, salads and sides we spent $250.00 that night. It ant cheep but I can't wait to go back and enjoy this fine restaurant again.
cuisines: Seafood Restaurants for Breakfast in Hanoi

example_reviews: I was looking for the BEST seafood in Hanoi and found the Bien Nho seafood. restaurant. On arrival I was shown to the tanks of fresh seafood along the far wall that included Lobsters of all sizes, Crabs of several different verities, clams, oysters, dozens of large and small fish types along with sea urchins and abalone. I chose 12 Oysters on the half shell and 2 extra large lobsters for me and my girl to enjoy. WOW what a meal. We were both stuffed when after we had our coffee at the end of the meal. With our drinks, salads and sides we spent $250.00 that night. It ant cheep but I can't wait to go back and enjoy this fine restaurant again.

The Bien Nho Seafood Restaurant offers enjoyable dining in an elegant setting and a diverse array of really tasty seafood dishes :)) It is located a short distance from the southwest corner of Hoan Kiem Lake (and a few minutes walk south from St. Michael's Cathedral). This is one of those places where your meal can be comprised of really, really fresh foods (i.e. live fish and crustaceans), which are priced by the kilogram. While many of the dishes seem to be best suited for a larger dining party, solo folks and couples can still find yummy items on the menu (eg, the soft-shell crabs, which are fried and served with your choice of a delicious sauce). And the service -- having eaten at dozens of places across the city, I would say that the wait staff (with several English speakers) at Bien Nho are at the top of the list in this category... every single person was super friendly, extremely attentive, and provided the most outstanding and courteous service... Enjoy this great restaurant :))

name: India Palace
address: 10B Quang An Tay Ho, Hanoi 100000 Vietnam
description: India Palace brings authentic, grandeur Indian sub-continental cuisine to your table. From the 'simple and straightforward' roti and dal, to the delectable, sophisticated creations that have come out of the imperial kitches of the Mughal Empire, think succulent kebabs, exotic curries, and uniquely fragrant biriyanis. Our focus is to serve our royal 'gods' with delicous and authentic Indian food with recipies, as old as time, in a luxurious and elegant manner.
cuisines: Late Night Sushi Restaurants in Hanoi
Late Night Vietnamese Restaurants in Hanoi
example_reviews: Dined here on Dec-21,2023. This table service restaurant didn't have soup. This restaurant serves Indian tour groups.

We reached the restaurant walking from the intercontinental hotel. We were there for dinner. We tasted the biryani, Kadai and the masala which was good. The bead was very good. The place is nice and the view is beautiful if you are setting by in the balcony.
good food but staff was not much friendly. need to improve for drink. i found too much raw sugar in my orange juice.

I stopped by this restaurant while waiting for the bus to go to Cat Ba, really this is the best food I ate that day. When I returned I had to come back to this place to continue eating this dish

address: 24 Ta Hien Hoan Kiem, Hanoi 10000 Vietnam
description: A new restaurant locate in the center of Hanoi Old quarter. With experienced staffs we would like to bring you a memorable time in our city with typical Hanoi and Vietnamese foods.
example_reviews: We walked in from the heat outside and was greeted by a wonderful staff he gave us the menu we ordered our drinks it came out straight away then we ordered our dishes our little boy took ages to decide..the staff was so awesome that he waited so long..when the meal came out it was beyond amazing it was so delicious and full of flavor the duck was awesome..we will be definitely going back..after the meal the owner came down to great us and she even gave us free dessert it was fresh mango and delicious guava..kids were very happy

Food here it's verry good for everything. The staff, they so happy and so friendly. I hope i can go to here one more time and i thing everybody should go to restaurant Com Viet because food here so nice

Amazing food and staff in han√≥i, Real Vietnam food, good quality. Cheap price, deep fried eggplant, spring rolls, chicken with cashewnuts, all good!! Quiet Place and nice people Was fant√°stic. 100% Recomended!!

name: Taste Of Vietnam Restaurant
address: 140 Nguy·ªÖn Khuy·∫øn, ƒê·ªëng ƒêa, H√† N·ªôi Vietnam, Hanoi 100000 Vietnam
description: Taste of Vietnam serves typical Vietnamese dishes for tourists who come to visit and experience Hanoi in particular and Vietnam in general.You will have the opportunity to explore Vietnamese cuisine that is made up of a delicate combination of ingredients
example_reviews: It nears the Temple of Literature. The a la carte menu is very great, has a lot of different dishes included. Staff were very friendly. The ambience of restaurant is cozy and inviting. Specially the lighting is soft and warm.
We had lunch under the lanterns in this cozy restaurant asking for vegan dishes. We were pleasantly surprised by the kindness and helpfulness of the staff. Very good food. Highly recommended!
Nice restaurant, we had lunch there after seeing the temple of literature. Friendly service, clean local, very good pumpkin past, recommended.

name: Furbrew
address: 8b/52 To Ngoc Van Street, Tay Ho District, Hanoi Vietnam
description: Furbrew is a craft beer bar. All our beers are made in Hanoi by Furbrew. We allways have six beers on tap. Our beers are modern craft beers. IPAs, wheats, ales. We do the beer. Food is available from nearby restaurents.
example_reviews: We visited the 100 garden brewpub in Tay Ho on a wet Tuesday night but there was plenty of seating undercover. Lots of beers and a really good menu. We enjoyed a really tasty Hot Dog and nachos and then a fabulous smoked meat platter. Lucky for me it was adult paint night which I enjoyed immensely chatting to others there to paint and meeting the owner Trung. Worth the trip out of the centre of Hanoi for a relaxing evening.

Just outside of the old quarter of town, only a 15min cheap cab ride. They had 20 different taps on. Happy hour was from 4-6pm when they open. Good variety of beers, it was a bit hit and miss but ok. They serve food as well but we didn‚Äôt eat. The staff were all friendly.

This is a cozy, 2-story taproom in Tay Ho with a wide range of craft beers. Note that they have a larger facility with a beer garden nearby. We visited here twice in November 2019. With 20 beers on tap and many more in bottles (go upstairs). Many of the bottled beers seemed over-priced but the draft beers are reasonable. Beer flights (4 beers) are available from the beers on tap. The service is very good with enough spoken and printed English to put us at ease. For food, they offer service from 2 local places, one of which was recommended by friends living in the area. I recommend a visit but enjoyed nearby Turtle Island Brewing a bit more.

name: Silk Garden Restaurant
address: HH01 To Huu Van Phuc, Nam T·ª´ Li√™m, Hanoi 100000 Vietnam
description: The Main Restaurant located on Level 3 will provide the All-Day-Dining option for in-house guests. Enjoy your all day dining with buffet breakfast and a la carte fusion menu with themed buffets. The open kitchen design and buffet will create a lively environment supported by music. Open daily for lunch and dinner: 11:00 a.m. ‚Äì 11:00 p.m.

example_reviews: Serviecs good, meals perfect! I like meals! I will come back! ‚ù§Ô∏è‚ù§Ô∏è food excelent and my waitress - Th·ªßy very good, friendly and lovely.

The first time come to restaurant in the new hotel. My friend stayed there and we have breakfast in silk garden. Beautiful palace, buffet station so lovely with many choice. Especially, staffs were friendly .My friend is gluten fee. So M. Ann - manager who best take care and show him all the food that he can eat . And her team ( amber, vivian and sophie) were helpful also. Hope they will keep good working like that. Thank you Ann & team.

I visited it when i try to see my friend.Even paying the normal price, this restaurant is good choice value for money. The food selection is vast, and very good and tasty too. Make sure you go early to avoid queues and get the food served freshly. Also,make sure you go on an empty stomach. Taste is good but service is great. I was served by Ann ,her local name is Chang or Jang i dont know. She was super caring and helpful. Everytime my cup was nearly out, she appeared and top it up so that i a think that it was always full. Great service!

name: Hidden Gem Restaurant
address: No. 42, Hang Cot Street Hoan Kiem District, Hanoi 10000 Vietnam
description: What a cool restaurant this is! Loved its mission of recycling, sustainability, living "green" & respecting the neighborhood in this alley. Check out the posters on the stairwell, reminding you to not pollute, respect the earth, recycle, etc. Dining is on the open aired third floor, where so much cool recycled furnishings are. Wooden window shutters are recycled into benches for seating, beer bottles have their second life as hanging lights, motorcycles continue to vroom as tables. And the food...colorful noodles dyed pastel colors with natural plant colorings (check out my pictures!), eye candy colored purple-topped, refreshing lemonade, chicken banh mi presented with an eye for beauty & more. And the egg coffee!  The coffee may be a bit bitter, but the whipped egg "cream" top is a painting unto itself. You can even learn how to make it here, if you like. Come for the food, come for the mission, but DO come here, just outside of the bustling Hanoi center, but remember, be respectful of the neighbors: no loud motorbikes.

Thai Restaurants for Lunch in Hanoi
