Good food, quick, clean and nice setting. Cleaniness was important since most of family restaurants in Hanoi didn't look hygien.

name: 3Pias Clubhouse
address: 30 Bat Su, Hanoi 100000 Vietnam
description: Cocktails & Kitchen Bar
cuisines: Late Night Thai Restaurants in Hanoi
example_reviews: Wow! What a find. We popped in for a drink and ended up with the most incredible cocktails and tapas! The staff were knowledgeable and passionate about the fusion of Vietnamese and food from around the world with great sourced ingredients the cocktails and food had real theatre! It was so good we booked to return with friends for dinner and they didn‚Äôt disappoint we were a largest group and we all order something different‚Ä¶. Covering most of the menu and everything was exceptional! We had a wonderful evening here a real stand out spot!

Wow! Fabulous interior design of old Hanoi with soft lighting and comfortable high chairs. Dapper dressed staff, polite and offering attentive service. The cocktails range from the fabulous well known to the artful sculptures of creativity with the wow wow wow factor. We sat in our own area just off the street, eating fresh duck salads, tomato carpaccio, duck with taro mash. The desserts of brownie and a mango sorbet delicious. We washed it down with a chilled French red after the cocktails. We weaved our way happily back to our nearby hotel in Old Hanoi.
Staff was amazing! Drinks were amazing! Atmosphere even better. When they didn't have what I ordered they just made me a custom drink based on what I described! This bar is ART!

name: Leu Coffee
address: 2nd Floor, No.1, Ta Hien Str, Hoan Kiem, Hanoi 10000 Vietnam

i went to this bar and we met hung and it was a low lovely experience where we felt very looked after and at home. thanks for so much we felt very cared for and appreciated we loved verything and the love we felt was next level ‚ù§Ô∏è

The first times I came Leu Coffee & Bar, I had a good experience in here. Leu has a good view and space which makes vistor feel very interesting about it. Especially, it has some sit in the street. But the suprise in here is about drink, the drink in here is so amazing. About the service, all the employer are so funny and sometimes they teach vistor some Vietnam word

name: Ruby

The truth western food style with luxury space. The wait-staff are nice and helpful. The restaurant has some VIP room with multiple capacities so it‚Äôs suitable for both family meeting and business meeting.

Located in a street where a lot of liquors are sold.

Stumbled upon this place while walking the streets and swatting away the hawkers trying to shun us into their restaurants. Little gem! Good food, beer and pretty well priced. $30 for 4 people.

name: The Rows Hanoi
address: 80 Hang Gai Hoan Kiem, Hanoi 100000 Vietnam
description: Located in a small lane at 80 Hang Gai, The Rows Hanoi brings an atmosphere of the Old Quarter of Hanoi once upon a time to the customers. Also, with a variable of drinks, foods and also Free Wifi, our staff truly wish that anyone come to our cafe can enjoy their time and feel the love from Hanoi in our services.
cuisines: Late Night Mediterranean Restaurants in Hanoi
example_reviews: Been in Hanoi a day and a half and been to The Rows three times. Look out for the welcoming automated mannequin on the street and go down the alley beside her. The staff are welcoming and the drinks are cheap. Strongly recommended.
Best place to relax from noisy old Town Hanoi. Very good draft beer for good price. They also have different craft beers. Cosy place to relax and drink.
Nice hidden gem, very atypical though! Good spot for a draft beer in a quiet environment! It worth to go and see !

name: Hong Ngoc Dynastie restaurant
address: 29 - 30 - 34 Hang Manh, Hoan Kiem, Hanoi 10000 Vietnam
description: Belong to Hong Ngoc Hotel Group, this restaurant offers all-day dining, with something for everyone.With pride, we will bring you an authentic taste of Vietnamese, Asian and Western food such as Pho, Banh Cuon, to the Hong Ngoc Legendary Burger, Pizza... Our homemade delicacies including pastries, breads and incredible cakes are considered by locals as one of the best in town. Every morning from 6AM to 10AM, -please feel welcome to our restaurant to try our signature international breakfast buffet.

Late Night French Restaurants in Hanoi

example_reviews: Excellent restaurant. Taken here by locals. Glad they did because the menu was in Vietnamese. LOL. Strongly recommend.
The staff were very attentive. Nothing wad too much trouble. Food was yummy..very tasty indeed. The ambiance of the restaurant is also very relaxing and elegant. Wish I had found sooner.
Tasty Vietnamese food served in a classy and clean restaurant. Linda, our waitress, was very welcoming and polite. I highly recommend this place

name: Manwah Lotte Center
address: 6th Floor, Lotte Center, 54 Lieu Giai, Hanoi 10000 Vietnam
description: We picked this place at random and were not disappointed.  We probably over ordered so it was a bit expensive but worth it.  My (Indonesian) wife has been disappointed that Viet Nam food is so "mild", but the hot pot broth at this meal was awesome, with plenty of kick.  I don't know exactly what we ordered due to language difficulties, but the pig brain was a winner for her, whereas the marinated wagyu was my personal favorite.  Add a beer or to in the mix, a (quite small) included salad and dessert bar and you've got a great day out.  Well worth another visit for us, even if just for the spicy broth/soup.

As this restaurant is in the Lotte Center food hall it felt like being fed in a zoo as people walk by and watch you eating, Not really my thing but the food was excellent and the service outstanding.

Worth it. We took the buffet style hotpot during lunchtime weekday for 319k VND all inclusive. The service was fast. Make sure you get there early because people from work usually go and eat there. Our favorite hotpot was their cheese tofu. They also served desserts like mango sago and ice cream, appetizers like edamame and black fungus.

name: Gu 19 Steak
address: 128 T√°¬ª¬´ Hoa T√É¬¢y H√°¬ª‚Äú, Hanoi 100000 Vietnam
description:
This is a hidden away spot, almost hard to see from the road.  But once inside the front doors it opens up into a pleasant restaurant.  

Staff are pretty good, we were quickly seated and were given some bread to start.  We splurged on some foei gras (and maybe scallops?) to kick off.  My wife had the lamb chops and she reckons they were OK.  My Picanha was so so - just not particularly flavorsome.We washed it down with some Tiger Beer and cocktails. The cocktails were a bit ordinary but it's not really a bar so only to be expected.

Mostly a good place, and pretty reasonable prices for good quality steaks.  Worth a visit and it's close to us so we'll probably give it another go to see if it gets any better.

Beste steak you can find in Hanoi! The staff is really nice and we loved the food. Perfect spot for a steak-lovers! And we really liked the salads too.

name: Ph·ªü S·ªë 10 L√Ω Qu·ªëc S∆∞
address: 10 L√Ω Qu·ªëc S∆∞, Hanoi 1000 Vietnam
description:
I'm not a huge fan of soups. But every once in a while, I love üíô the comforting sensation of a hot ‚ô®Ô∏è broth. But that broth has to be rich and strong in taste. Take me to a ramen üçú spot and I'll always order the more tasteful one (if there's a choice).
There's an exception though: pho. I find pho, in general, kinda dull. But for some reason, I love üíô it... when in Vietnam üáªüá≥! Cause I wouldn't order it out of Vietnam üáªüá≥... ‚úã
This is the kind of dish I only feel like eating in the country, not sure why. When in Vietnam, pho üçú is my go to breakfast. üôå
On that first day back in Hanoi üáªüá≥, we all felt like having something simple for dinner so we headed to Pho 10 Ly Quoc Su in the old quarter for a simple yet comforting bowl of pho. ü§ó
Note that this place is in the Michelin guide... but in Asia, in my opinion, this does not mean a thing and this definitely isn't the reason why we chose that place. üôÖ
The menu is quite simple:1 broth, a few combinations of 3 types of meat ü•© (all beef üêÑ) and 2 types of cooking for these meats. Period.
And that night, some of these options weren't even available! üòì
The noodles were perfect, the beef quite tasty (although, sincerely, it was hard to feel the difference between the types of meat we were served) and the broth, well, kinda dull, as expected... until I added some garlic üßÑ and chili üå∂Ô∏è. Then it became so enjoyable! üëç
This is the magic ü™Ñ of pho üçú: I never expect anything of it, yet I always enjoy it. üòÉ
The place was crowded, noisy, messy and kind of dirty, which is normal in Hanoi, and the service was... let's say sufficient. ü§∑
We paid VND 70K... ‚Ç¨2.5 per person... ü§≠

I don't really get the hype for this place. There is often a queue, the food is okay, prices are normal, the place is a bit loud.

The hype and the queue make NO sense for the below average, tasteless soup we were offered in this restaurant. The broth was TRULY tasteless, the boiled filet beef badly boiled and a little smelly. Had much better Vietnamese soup in other restaurants with less or NO accolades, all over Hanoi. NOT recommended

name: B√™p Vi√™t
address: 1b Ng. B√°o Kh√°nh H√†ng Tr√¥ng, Ho√†n Ki√™m, Hanoi Vietnam
description: During our two day stay in Hanoi, we visited here twice. As a coeliac, I was so impressed with the owners knowledge of gluten free. She told me what I could and couldn't eat and informed me of separate fryers being used for gf/non-gf products. Food was very fresh, flavoursome and staff were friendly.

example_reviews: During our two day stay in Hanoi, we visited here twice. As a coeliac, I was so impressed with the owners knowledge of gluten free. She told me what I could and couldn't eat and informed me of separate fryers being used for gf/non-gf products. Food was very fresh, flavoursome and staff were friendly.

Do not be discouraged by the appearance, it is just places like these that offer you the best cuisine! Rich, tasty flavors, variety of choices, vegetarian options (I ate the vegetarian option of pho with seitan bbq and it was a show!). Very low prices and the lady helps you or Guides in the choices!! Provate,provate!!!

Delicious food and clean facilities. Warm service from Water and her family. Icy cold beers! Can highly recommend the pho, bun cha and beef salad. We visited daily as couldn‚Äôt fault the food and it was well priced. Water was also very kind to our 5 year old son and shared some jokes with him.

name: Sio Sushi
address: No. 29, Lane 47, Tran Dai Nghia Hai Ba Trung, Hanoi 10000 Vietnam
description: Love this place. Usually go in after 11, hot pot is REALLY good. Staff is ok too. The only thing is smoking is allowed inside with no ventilation. So beware of that. Other than that enjoyed the hotpot. Make sure you get it with the cheese! It‚Äôs awesome.  Every time I go there which had been well over 20 times it‚Äôs been good. Sushi ain‚Äôt bad either.

We stumbled across this gem of a restaurant. Amazing food and service, wish I could try all of the food. We had a hotpot (cannot remember the name) and Tempura seafood. Wow! Great! I do recommend this place. Atmosphere is very cool.

If you fancy a place to eat sushi in Ha Noi at reasonable rate, this could be the best choice. Sashimi was good, I loved their Salmon belly. Sushi rolls were also delicious, cannot remember the name but was with prawns, crunchy salmon skin and some eels. They do offer hot pot as well. Good for birthday part or family party.

name: Rainbow Restaurant
address: 37-38 Hang Hanh, Hanoi Vietnam
description: Found this restaurant by accident and glad we visited during our time in Hanoi.  Service food and view all fantastic - thank you!
example_reviews: Found this restaurant by accident and glad we visited during our time in Hanoi. Service food and view all fantastic - thank you!

Wandered in for lunch before heading out to the airport on our last day in Hanoi, was not disappointed. Bun Cha was simply outstanding, chicken skewers almost too much food to finish. Great little find on a non-descript back street in the old quarter.

Went to this restaurant for dinner and lunch. Tried and loved the banh cuon, pho, bun cha, nem nuong (spelling approximate). All delicious, and I know my Vietnamese food. A nice mix of locals and tourists (more tourists at night). The staff are extremely friendly and will kindly provide guidance on how to eat certain dishes. A great place to recommend.

name: Banh Mi Bami Hipp
address: 56 Ngo Huyen Street, Hoan Kiem District, Hanoi 10000 Vietnam
description: Bread Pate is the very familiar food name in Vietnam, featuring Hanoi street food. Bread Hipp opened with the aim of serving Vietnamese and foreign customers from all countries in the world who are familiar with snack from Vietnam. If you come to Hanoi, please stop at Banh Mi Hipp and enjoy the hot, tasty and great pate sandwiches, eggs, and ham.
example_reviews: I‚Äôm a vegetarian and my family are meat eaters, and this is our favorite Banh Mi. We came here every morning I was in Hanoi and was never disappointed.
It's a very nice place, good service and fast serving. I had a lovely chat with the owner. I would come any time again.
10/10 brekky. Lovely jubbly would reccomend. They‚Äôre connected to the hostel so i didn‚Äôt even have to step foot outside to get a quality bahn me for the same price as everywhere else .

Freshly cooked Indian foods available here, if looking for Indian food at Vietnam then visit this hotel.

The owner sat with us and chatted and gave us good advice. Well worth trying. Prices were very good we paid around 215k (¬£7) dong for three drinks, three bottles of water and three sandwiches (bahn mi) which we felt was good value.

name: El Gaucho | Lotte Mall West Lake

description: Food is our passion and it is our aim to establish the benchmark in Southeast Asia and beyond for a contemporary, specialised steakhouse concept. We are proud to serve you the finest steakhouse-style food, using only the best available meat products sourced from selected farms in Victoria, New South Wales and individual farmers and ranchers in the United States
cuisines: German Restaurants for Lunch in Hanoi
example_reviews: El Gaucho serves up hearty, savory Argentine cuisine in a slick contemporary setting. The empanadas were stuffed with tasty beef, onions, olives and eggs. The provoleta cheese was ooey-gooey goodness. The grilled steak was juicy and full of smoky, charred flavor. The Malbec wine list does the food justice. Service slipped a bit as the restaurant got busy. Overall, a great introduction to the irresistible flavors of Argentina.

name: Hem Quan - 96 Chua Ha
address: 96 Chua Ha Street, Cau Giay District, Hanoi 100000 Vietnam
description: Traditional style, rare fine dishes from Southwestern regions of Vietnam.
example_reviews: Great find on a pretty quiet street not far from the Ethno Museum. Can sit on nice outside patio, if desired. Food was excellent. We had a stir fried calamari,grilled pork,bak choi cucumber and tomato salad, and rice. All very good. Service was excellent. Prices reasonable.

Came across the restaurant on a platform (Foody) that widely use in Vietnam to search for nice places to eat/dine at. I decided to give this place a try and went there with my husband and my mother in law. The food turned out to be tasty and not bad for the price as well. The restaurant has a nice ambience, very airy (because we were sitting at the outdoor sitting area) and clean. The staff were pretty helpful, quick and attentive. Which is quite rare in Hanoi to be honest. Food: Grilled chicken with beer: I have had not seen such tiny and skinny chicken in my entire life (it was so small) - However, it was surprisingly tender and tasty. Minced beef porridge: Smell super great, tasty and after taste sweetness. Lotus shoot salad with shrimp and pork belly: this is a standard starter dish as a starter, but it arrived after we had done with our main course, which is super weird. Deep fried tofu with salted egg: Surprisingly good, really soft and the salted eggs gave the creamy and thick taste - However abit too oily. Fried Kangkong (Water spinach) : My most favourite dish of all, it tasted so good that I was amazed with such simple dish can bring so much happiness. It was crunchy, greeny, flavourful and the deep fried garlic together with fresh garlic, it just simply tasty. Price: Affordable Reasonable Overall the experience was good, the food is tasty and I would definitely want to come back here again. Would recommend this place for a family gathering or a small event.
Beautiful menu with a wide range of options for local foods and drinks. The cenue is so beautiful and the staff are so friendly. Great find!!

name: Tam Claypot Rice
address: 14 Nguyen Huu Huan Hoan Kiem, Hanoi 100000 Vietnam
description: Tam Claypot Rice located in center of Hanoi old quarter very near famous place as Hoankiem lake, nice market, Ho Chi Minh museum, Hoa Lo Prison. Special we have "Broken rice" with beef, chicken, fish...have name " Com Tam" is one of traditional dish of Vietnam, we sure you will enjoy.
cuisines: Pizza for Large Groups in Hanoi
Late Night Seafood Restaurants in Hanoi
example_reviews: This lively, colorful restaurant serves delicious food to locals and tourists alike. Their coffee was outstanding, and I'm not much of a coffee drinker. Their egg rolls and their rice with beef and veggies were outstanding.

Their egg coffee was tasty. This coffee was suggested to me by my friend once he tried it in Hanoi and loves it after. And it was not disappointed me too. My friend tried Vietnamese milk ice coffee this time and he loves it as well.

I just found out that there is a small hostel for backpackers on the second floor of the restaurant after the staff introduced to me while I was having a meal there. So I decided to stay at their hostel for 2 nights after coming back from Halong Bay. The price was reasonable when it is only $5 for a night, including Vietnamese breakfast. The room and toilet was very clean and organized. I highly recommend this hostel for any backpackers who want to save money on accommodation.

example_reviews: Great find in Hanoi. funky bar with music selection, best cocktails in Hanoi, great prices, friendly service
We saw this place off the coach to Ha long ,and found it when we returned . Good friendly bar great music and sports on tvs too fair priced drinks . The owner lovely man
Good music. Brilliant service. Excellent draft beer served very cold in frosty glasses. Best Mai Tai ever. Highly recommend

name: Korea Box & Bar
address: 51 ƒê. Xu√¢n Di·ªáu, Tay Ho, Hanoi Vietnam
description:
Came here as part of a large group, some of which wanted the BBQ option and the rest chose various single items from the menu to make up their meals.
They were super quick to bring out all of the food for the BBQ options - however painfully slow with everyone else's dishes. I think they could have been better coordinated with the food so half the tables were not sat there with nothing to eat at the same time as the rest had lots of food.
That being said the food we had was tasty and I would be tempted to come back.
Again the same issue with slow service at the end, we asked for the bill and it turned out they had done separate bills, which was fine, but they only bought over half of them and there was 2 couples who had to chase for theirs to be brought over so they could pay - especially seeing as most of the group had paid and were leaving by this stage.

name: Daebak Korean Restaurant

description: Referring to Korean cuisine is mention to Kimchi, Tokbokki, hot pot and especially BBQ. With fresh tasty grilled slices of meat by special sauces marinated in each fiber of slices of meat, every single bite will melt in your mouth and awakens all of your senses. Come along with that is abundant kinds of "panchan" which will definitely bring you from one surprise to the others. At Daebak Korestaurant, Chef - Kim Sung Sam, a gourmet expert, will bring you such delicate and unforgettable dining experiences from "kimchi" homeland, with the high class of ingredients and typical spices from Korea and the talent and love of cooks. How wonderful a party with friends, family members gathering around, smelling the interesting aromatic of barbecue and enjoy it with "fondly" Korean beverage at Daebak Korestaurant. By a spacious space with 5 comfortable floors, staffs of professional service, we definitely will bring to you the wonderful experiencing at Daebak Korestaurant.
cuisines: Late Night Asian Restaurants in Hanoi
example_reviews: If you want to eat Korean food at Inam University, it's the best!!! The end of the Hoan Kiem tourist course is always a big hit.. haha You can eat really delicious k-BBQ in a comfortable atmosphere. This time I had daechang and tripe and it was really fresh and delicious. I highly recommend it.

Despite being really busy at the end of the year, staffs did a really really great job at taking care of their customers, our order come fast and they stay to help us with the BBQ even without us asking, it‚Äôs their job, yes, but they manage everything so well that there is nothing I can complain. Food is fresh and delicious, price is a bit high compare to other places but I think it‚Äôs worth it
Went here on our last night in Hanoi. The food was excellent and our server Quang was very helpful and spoke very good English. Highly recommend this restaurant

Nestled in a chic, loungy setting inspired by the warmth and charm of haciendas, Chimi Chimi offers a perfect blend of sophisticated ambiance and casual comfort. example_reviews: I came here once in July. The first thing that surprised me when I arrived that the restaurant's space was wonderful, the colors, layout, and surrounding decorations were all in harmony, and the music was also great. I ordered Mixed Green Salad, Ribeye and Pesto Tagliatelle. The dishes are very flavorful & tasty and good for the value. We will come back again for sure. Highly recommended!!!!

Cosy spot for meat & drink! Perfect for dating or hanging out. We start with beef tatare on toast then move to ribeye, end up with burnt cheese cake. Them foods are really on fire with every juicy bites you get! They also have happy hour from 4 pm to 8 pm - buy 1 get 1 for cocktail. Will be back next time!
Had a wonderful time at Chimi Chimi in Hanoi. The atmosphere is elegant yet relaxed, and the steak was the best I've had in a long time. Will definitely be back! √∞≈∏¬§¬©√∞≈∏¬§¬©√∞≈∏¬§¬©

name: Chez Pierre Bistro & Lounge
address: 5 Hoi Vu Alley, Hang Bong, Hoan Kiem, Hanoi  11000 Vietnam
description: Where you can savor the authentic flavors of France
cuisines: South American Restaurants for Lunch in Hanoi
example_reviews: It‚Äôs a cute little restaurant in a quiet street that serves some great food and they have a good liquor bar. We dined at this place twice and the food was always good. We tried a variety of pastas, bruschettas and garlic bread. The food is towards the expensive side as compared to similar places in the city and their portion sizes are small. But then they promise quality of food and offer a good variety of continental that was a little rare to find in the outlets in the city. I would say it was totally worth it.We found the liquor quite reasonable priced. The owner himself overlooks all the operations and service. He is a good guy , passionate about his food business and great to talk to. He is very courteous and always gives his guests a personalised touch. They have nicely done up interiors with a fancy bar as well as some outside seating in a cute covered courtyard. Quite recommended.

We went there for lunch, and the place wasnt ready. It was 12 noon Saturday. The staff communicate well in english, good is alright, but more on the expensive pricing. Bottled water cost 40kVND, carbonara pasta with little cut of hams costing VND 238k. Food taste not too bad. Maybe it will be much better for dinner.

What a spectacular experience at Chez Pierre, seated at a table in the charming courtyard! We absolutely loved the friendly staff and the time taken by the charismatic owner, Pierre, to chat us through the origins of this new restaurant and his ethos to the food. The signature Nicoise Salad was exceptional. Most of us had the rib eye steak and everything about the dish was wonderful. The mushroom sauce and pepper sauce were incredible examples of refined French sauces - amongst the best versions of these we have had. Definitely a marvellous restaurant to visit in Hanoi and we wish Pierre and the team all the best.

name: Don Chicken Hang Bong
address: 250+250A Hang Bong Cua Nam, Hoan Kiem, Hanoi 100000 Vietnam
description: Donchicken has been in Korea since 2007 and is by far one of the leading brands in the domestic dining industry with more than 400 restaurants in more than 6 provinces / cities across the country and JEJU Island. Donchicken has been expanding its brand to China since 2014 with nearly 20 restaurants. In 2015, the Donchicken brand, we bring the wonderful Korean-traditional flavor to Vietnam.
cuisines: Eastern European Restaurants for Lunch in Hanoi
example_reviews: Don Chicken in Hanoi is a delightful restaurant that specializes in Korean-style charcoal chicken. The marinated chicken is perfectly grilled, offering a smoky flavor that's hard to resist. The menu boasts a variety of other Korean dishes, which complement the main attraction wonderfully. The atmosphere is cozy and welcoming, making it an ideal spot for casual meals or gatherings. Service is typically friendly, adding to the overall positive experience. Prices are reasonable for the quality of food served, though it can get busy during peak hours. Overall, Don Chicken is a must-visit for anyone craving delicious Korean cuisine in Hanoi!

Don Chicken on H√†ng B√¥ng offers some of the best tteokbokki and meat dishes in Hanoi. The tteokbokki is perfectly chewy with a great balance of spice, and the meat is tender and flavorful. The staff are friendly and attentive, providing excellent service. The restaurant itself is cozy and inviting, making it an ideal spot for a casual meal. Highly recommend for anyone craving authentic Korean flavors!
10 pop star:) the food is great and staffs are kind and friendly. Definitely coming back and will recommend it to our friends :) pak ang chicken for da gooooo!

name: Hanayuki Dao Tan

description: The seafood sashimi served at Hanayuki was really fresh and delicious. They offer a large variety of raw seafood in their menu. You can order a mix platter of seafood sashimi which includes the likes of tuna, salmon, yellowtail, etc. Presentation of their dishes were beautiful as with many Japanese restaurants. At Hanayuki, you will be offered crispy sheets of seaweed which can be used to wrap the raw fish seafood. This is the first time I have eaten sashimi wrapped with seawood and it does taste good. A must try at the restaurant is the salmon head hotpot. The cut-up pieces of slamon head are cooked with vegetables and tofu in the hotpot, making this a really nice meal.

We saw the banh xeo being made on the street and were sent upstairs which is a part of their house. There is a wardrobe in the room and the owner sits watching the TV. No English spoken but we managed to order by pointing at what others were eating. Oily but tasty banh xeo.

name: Le Art Cafe Wine Bistro
address: 66 Nguyen Thai Hoc Located On Grounds Of The Vietnam Fine Arts Museum, Hanoi 100000 Vietnam
description:
Le Art Cafe is located on the grounds of the Fine Arts Museum.  Initially, we thought it was just a coffee shop, but it actually has a reasonably extensive menu, perfect for lunch.  The interior space was attractive, but the outdoor tables in the garden were even more enticing on this sunny day.  

I chose the grilled chicken Caesar salad (145,000 VND) which was a generous serving with what seemed to be an entire chicken breast with just the right amount of tangy dressing.  It was delicious and filling.  My partner enjoyed his pasta carbonara (also 145,000 VND).  With two bottles of water, the total charge was only 364,000 VND (about $16).

Service was polished and professional.  The menu included English translations; the wait staff also spoke English.  It was a perfect lunch in a perfect location.
cuisines: German Restaurants for Lunch in Hanoi
example_reviews: Le Art Cafe is located on the grounds of the Fine Arts Museum. Initially, we thought it was just a coffee shop, but it actually has a reasonably extensive menu, perfect for lunch. The interior space was attractive, but the outdoor tables in the garden were even more enticing on this sunny day. I chose the grilled chicken Caesar salad (145,000 VND) which was a generous serving with what seemed to be an entire chicken breast with just the right amount of tangy dressing. It was delicious and filling. My partner enjoyed his pasta carbonara (also 145,000 VND). With two bottles of water, the total charge was only 364,000 VND (about $16). Service was polished and professional. The menu included English translations; the wait staff also spoke English. It was a perfect lunch in a perfect location.

Decided to find a cafe nearby while exploring the Vietnamese capital. This is a place for coffee and quick meal right outside the fine arts museum. Price is modest for tourists and coffee with milk is always the perfect option. Sitting in front of a colonial building and sipping freshly brewed coffee is the ultimate Hanoi experience.

Located in a prime location of the capital, Le Art Cafe Wine Bistro restaurant is located inside the campus of the Vietnam Fine Arts Museum, 50m from the Temple of Literature, 200m from Uncle Ho's Mausoleum. With a spacious, airy and very private space. The food was very tasty and good quality. The server was helpful with the menu.

name: Bun cha, Nem cua be
address: 38 Mai Hac De, Hai Ba Trung, Hanoi 10000 Vietnam
description:
Typical Buncha is too sweet for me. This store has the right combination for me. Enjoyed it very much. 

The fried meat roll is splendid too 

Try not to have too many belongings with you as you dine here. Not much space for bags
example_reviews: Typical Buncha is too sweet for me. This store has the right combination for me. Enjoyed it very much. The fried meat roll is splendid too Try not to have too many belongings with you as you dine here. Not much space for bags
Street food at its best, first time trying bun cha and cannot forget it. So much flavour and so fulling, loved this place!!

name: Dung Hoa Pho Co
address: 23 21, Hang Hom, Hanoi 10000 Vietnam
description: Bia Pho Co is the street where many foreigners come by the evening  to have their dinners especially is famous for seafood, pork grills and off course beefs. It is also famous for its night chills of light beers and liquors, an awesome  place to chill at night with friends ‚ò∫Ô∏è
example_reviews: Bia Pho Co is the street where many foreigners come by the evening to have their dinners especially is famous for seafood, pork grills and off course beefs. It is also famous for its night chills of light beers and liquors, an awesome place to chill at night with friends ‚ò∫Ô∏è

It was short walk from our hotel in hang Quat. Menu was all local dishes and prices were reasonable. I order the hot pot steak and my crab spring rolls. Both were tasty. Service was fast. Mostly patronise by local.

We ate dinner here twice. We enjoyed the food and suffered no ugly aftermath (unlike with a couple other places in Hanoi). The place was busy, but we didn't have to wait for a table. Local people also seemed to enjoy the food, as we were the only white people there both nights. The portions were fairly large, and we were both quite filled by one entree.

name: Peace vegan
address: 45 Nhat Chieu Nhat Tan, Tay Ho, Hanoi Vietnam
description:
I've lived in Hanoi for five months now and Peace Vegan is my favorite restaurant. I go on almost a daily basis, if not every second day and have yet to grow tired of it. 

Most Vietnamese cuisine isn't highly nutritional, ie. Rice and noodles, and it's difficult to find cheap meals with lots of vegetables. 

Peace vegan is nutritious, by far the best value vegan buffet I've found (Please let me know if anyone knows where a vegan buffet of the same price is?). Everything is absolutely vegan too, a lot of restaurants labelled vegan sell vegetarian dishes too, which include cheese or eggs. 

Good atmosphere, lovely location, great food, nutritious, dirt cheap. 10 starts from me. √∞≈∏Àú≈†√∞≈∏Àú≈†√∞≈∏Àú≈†√∞≈∏Àú≈†
cuisines: Late Night Middle Eastern Restaurants in Hanoi
Pizza for Large Groups in Hanoi
Late Night Seafood Restaurants in Hanoi

Great selection buffet. Clientele mostly young foreigners, all you can eat tasty vegan food. Tofu prepared 10 ways or more! Relaxed atmosphere.

One of the first cheap vegan buffet opened in Hanoi, 40,000 VND per person. In the heart of expat area, together with English menu they attract lots of expats living in Hanoi. Around 10 dishes for buffet together with free tea, they have a stable amount of frequent customers. Though more vegan buffet opened now with the same price, and better food, they need to improve the buffet menu to compete with other restaurants. Food is good, fresh, though its pretty similar everyday. Cheap menu drinks seperated from buffet. They also serve alacarte menu for dinner.

name: Vivienne Cafe Restaurant
address: 4 Au Trieu Hoan Kiem, Hanoi 100000 Vietnam
description: Great location with a super nice balcony on the first floor facing the plaza in front of the cathedral. Awesome for watching people come and go. Very comfy chairs. Extraordinarily friendly staff. Thank You !!!
example_reviews: We stopped there to have a glass of wine, unfortunately we did not read the reviews before. When they served the wine they put a dish of cashews on the table. I wanted to pay immediately the 200k for the wine but she said to pay later. I asked about the nuts and she said it is a additional 200k so I sent it back. When we finally went to pay the wine they told us there was 10% additional charge. We refused to pay it as it was not mentioned anywhere. They insisted saying it was normal in Vietnam ! It is normal when it is written ! In a few words a rip off ! We checked their rating on google and it says it is closed, which is not true ! Another scam ! Too bad it has a nice location and a nice view ! Just next to the cathedral, but they are many other choices around.

I went in for dinner. They gave us bad food which was exorbitantly priced. They had given a tiny bowl of rice which we thought was a side dish, but later in the bill they had added it as a separate item for 50k vnd. They had also added 10% service charge for horrible food and the waitress gawking at us incessantly. I argued my way out of the bill and paid only for 2 items we ordered, didn't pay service charge too. They make their own people sit in the cafe for make it look active to attract tourists. They have such a nice location and they can do great honest buisness here, but these people don't know better. Such a beautiful country and such beautiful people, but people like these ruin it for all :-(

We stopped for a drink and ordered a beer, my husband pointing at and saying ‚ÄúHanoi‚Äù (beer). The older waitress / manager said ‚Äú2 Vietnamese beer, very good‚Äù and then brought us over two 330ml bottles of a local beer I had not heard of. We didn‚Äôt mind it wasn‚Äôt Hanoi, and went on to order two more. When was came to pay they said the four beers were 660,000 (over ¬£20). It became apparent that this is a scam to give customers a different beer at inflated price and hope they pay it. We stood our ground and paid the 200,000 the Hanoi beer would have cost. On reflection, the younger waitress looked very miserable and was constantly sent into the square by the older woman to try and ‚Äòsnare‚Äô western looking tourists in an overly aggressive way. They tried to give us a plate of cashews which thankfully we refused (on hygiene grounds) and am very relieved we did since reading people were charged 200,000 for them! Nice location for people watching, but avoid like the plague.

name: Daikon Foods - Restaurant & Caf√©
address: 212A Lac Long Quan, Buoi Ward Tay Ho District, Hanoi, Hanoi 100000 Vietnam
description: Daikon or white Radish is a simple yet important ingredient in Japanese cuisine.At Daikon Foods, we aim to bring a different side of Japanese culinary art to our beloved customers: Simple Yet Delicious Home-made Food in a comfortable and relax setting.
cuisines: Eastern European Restaurants for Lunch in Hanoi
example_reviews: During the quarantine period in Hanoi, isolated in a hotel room, Daikon delivered us delicious and comfort food., fundamental to have positive feelings. We¬¥re very gratefu.

This restaurant is on the ground floor of the Somerset West Lake. It has a small but complete menu. Food was good and served well. The ambiance of the restaurant was warm and cosy. The service staff was attentive and helpful. I am especially satisfied with one of their service staff, Ly. She speaks good English and provided good service.
We dined twice and had an excellent culinary experience across fish, beef, pork and chicken dishes. All servings are well-priced and the bento box is a great package. Very delicious.

name: Sushi Station
address: 84 Tran Vu Ba Dinh, Hanoi 100000 Vietnam
description: A small sushi shop by Truc Bach Lake with a beautiful Lake view. The Sushi Chef was working in New Zealand for 3 years so he knows exactly the western Taste. Manager and Staff are very friendly and helpful.
example_reviews: Don't go to this place. When we visited it was closed, but they recommended us to go to their second restaurant. So we took a cap through the whole city just to land in front of another closed restaurant, despite them telling us its open. These people didn't even care. How would ever eat something from them? Avoid this place.
Walked for 20 minutes to find out the place no longer exists and is just a pile of rubble. Not many other eating places around either

After the covid epidemic, sushi station has changed for the better. Sushi station has 3 branches, all of them are excellent from the quality of sushi to the quality of service, and the prices are reasonable. Highly recommended!

name: Banh Mi by Minh Nhat
address: 13 Hang Khay Str., Hoan Kiem Dist Old Quarter, Hanoi 10000 Vietnam
description: Banh Mi Minh Nhat is owned by Masterchef Vietnam winner season 2: Hoang Minh Nhat Each Banh mi has her own recipe to make it special. Shop style is clean, high quality product, amazing view of Hoan Kiem Lake. Located in the heart of Ha noi.
example_reviews: Well, there is nothing too special about this banhmi comparing to all those that street vendor sold me. Quite disappointing for a master chef winner
The sandwich here is OK. But on the streets you can get better. This feels like fastfood mass produced Bahn Mi.

Went here as cane across it when looking for a nearby cafe. Just average banh mi and more expensive than what you get elsewhere. The shop is small, old and needs a good clean and to be refreshed. There‚Äôs a couple of seats but it‚Äôs not a shop you‚Äôd want to sit and relax in anyway. They also didn‚Äôt have 2 of the meats we tried to order on the day. Best to get your banh mi in another old quarter street location.

name: New Gentry Beerhouse
address: 7 Hang Manh, Hanoi 10000 Vietnam
description: Decent sized caf√©-style venue with table seating and lots of retro-beer posters on the walls. They stock only bottles from a range of local not easily available craft and more common international major brewers. The beer list is extensive with limited editions (10 in all from Overmorrow, Labtory, Heart of Darkness, Mixtape; VND110-140000), commercial (8 in all from Vietnam, Laos, Mexico, Japan, Slovakia; VND50-100000), local craft brewers (16 in all from Ha Noi & Saigon; VND100-140000 for 330ml bottle), Belgian (14 in all) and Trappist (7 in all). Prices listed are a bit expensive for the local scene. Non-beer includes ciders (7) and wine. Didn't try the food which consists of snacks and mains. The service is basic (not with-standing language barriers) however, as staff seem to be more focused on their mobile phones, they don't annoy you. NOT a place for lager drinkers but a great place to visit to taste some hard to get local craft beers!!
example_reviews: Decent sized caf√©-style venue with table seating and lots of retro-beer posters on the walls. They stock only bottles from a range of local not easily available craft and more common international major brewers. The beer list is extensive with limited editions (10 in all from Overmorrow, Labtory, Heart of Darkness, Mixtape; VND110-140000), commercial (8 in all from Vietnam, Laos, Mexico, Japan, Slovakia; VND50-100000), local craft brewers (16 in all from Ha Noi & Saigon; VND100-140000 for 330ml bottle), Belgian (14 in all) and Trappist (7 in all). Prices listed are a bit expensive for the local scene. Non-beer includes ciders (7) and wine. Didn't try the food which consists of snacks and mains. The service is basic (not with-standing language barriers) however, as staff seem to be more focused on their mobile phones, they don't annoy you. NOT a place for lager drinkers but a great place to visit to taste some hard to get local craft beers!!

Wow, stumbling upon New Gentry in Hanoi was like finding a hidden gem in the craft beer universe! The service was top-notch, and my wife's delight in their French and Italian wines was matched only by the blissful chill they kept them at on that warm evening. Now, let's talk beer ‚Äì their local craft brews were a delight, although that farmhouse-leaning stout had me scratching my beer-loving head. Maybe an infected batch? But hold on to your mugs, because the real magic happened with their exquisite selection of Belgium beers. Oh, the joy of sipping on a Chimay Blue or the Duvel Triple Hop Citra Belgium IPA ‚Äì pure liquid nirvana that hit the spot every single time. The food, the cozy setting, and that A++ service sealed the deal ‚Äì this place is an absolute must-visit. Just remember, it's a tiny haven that fills up fast, so make sure to hop in early. In my books, New Gentry stole the show during our short Hanoi escapade, and it's hands down my favorite spot in the city! üçª

Wandered past and was lured in by the name. I was surprised by the extensive beer list. From fairly cheap local beers to pricier imports. You can drink for cheaper in Hanoi but you won‚Äôt be as comfortable

name: RICO Seafood & Grill
address: 56 Tr·∫ßn Qu·ªëc To·∫£n H√† N·ªôi Hai Ba Trung District, Hanoi 100000 Vietnam
description: Situated in the bustling Hanoi‚Äôs French Quarter, RICO Seafood & Grill offers a stylish, contemporary space. It houses a range of interconnected projects, including multiple dining rooms, a raw bar, open kitchen, butcher, and two outdoor dining areas. It is ideal for entertaining, celebration or corporate meetings.
cuisines: Late Night Seafood Restaurants in Hanoi
South American Restaurants for Lunch in Hanoi
example_reviews: Excellent spot for a quiet and intimate meal in Hanoi. Our server Nghia was outstanding and very friendly. I recommend the seafood platter with lobster (you must order ahead of time when booking reservation) and the tomahawk steak.

My wife and I had dinner here and it is fabulous. High end dining very good food and service and by European standards reasonably priced. The restaurant is housed in a beautiful old house and I have no hesitation in recommending it

I went to the Penfolds wine dinner last night hosted by Rico Seafood and Grill. It was an absolute pleasure! Delicious dishes with an amazingly creative touch and impeccable service. They have a oyster special on Wednesday's and I am certain I will be a regular there. Gorgeous interior decoration as well...just a fine place to enjoy with family and friends.

name: Annam Caf√© Gourmet
address: 51 Xuan Dieu Syrena Shopping Center, Quang An, Tay ho District, Hanoi 10000 Vietnam
description:
My wife and son liked their crepes. They charred my burger though. Had to send it back.
They also need to do something about the flies.....
Service is average.
example_reviews: My wife and son liked their crepes. They charred my burger though. Had to send it back. They also need to do something about the flies..... Service is average.
Very nice atmosphere. Me and my man enjoy 2 cups of coffee here cappuccino and latte. Yummy. The manager is attentive, enthusiastic and cosy. Recommend

We frequented this cafe 3 times and tried different things. It was always clean and the staff were exceptionally friendly and attentive. The food preparation didn‚Äôt always match the expectation but was still OK. The fruit punch smoothie was fabulous each time. The quiche Lorraine was very nice but the hot fries where not consistent. The pancakes where disappointing , an unusual heavy consistency.

name: Tung Ban Quan
address: Ch·ª£ C·∫ßu Gi·∫•y, Hanoi 100000 Vietnam
description: With many delicous dishes from the North to the South Vietnam, especially Pa Pinh Top ( grilled fish followed Thai people), Grilled beef with dry sauce from ant, grilled chicken by Dam San style, Fresh spring rolls made by yourself, etc... The place decor in North West style and staffs are very friendly. Some wine from rice and corn, specially "Bach Nhat" wine - jars of rice wine (including yolk of egg) were hidden under the land 100 days before using. Start from 11.00AM you can come to drink beer, Bach Nhat wine, taste delicous food here and see the local train in Vietnam.
cuisines: German Restaurants for Lunch in Hanoi
example_reviews: Stopped at this place by coincidence & so glad we did! Amazing place with great elements from Sa Pa, Food was also incredible & good in proportion! We truely recomend to try the local ricewine From Sa Pa witch they serve there! At last you can leave the place with wonderfull memories & new friendships! The owner is very friendly and sweet and can talk good english. Greetings Dean & Ellen

We went here because of the review saying it was a hidden gem. The food is cooked in North Western Vietnamese style. The fish had a coriander based stuffing. We also had the Mam Da - a local green vegetable. Really good meal.

What a great hidden gem in the old quarter! The food is all made fresh, portions are generous and there are many different options on the menu. The atmosphere is a relaxed fun one, with people playing a guitar, singing local and internationals songs tho it is no way intrusive on a meal. If you are looking for local food at excellent prices without anything being geared towards the tourist then I highly recommend this for you! Miss Ha is very helpful with great English in choosing what to eat and drink, so if you are from abroad ask for her for help!

name: Lucky Cafe & Fast Food
address: Terminal 1, Noi Bai Airport, Hanoi 100000 Vietnam
description: The food here at the Lucky Restaurant in T1 was fine, but service was slow, it took forever to get the bill, and there was smoking at the table next to us. You‚Äôll be better off at the T2 restaurants, as far as I can tell there is no indoor smoking.
cuisines: Late Night Sushi Restaurants in Hanoi
example_reviews: The food here at the Lucky Restaurant in T1 was fine, but service was slow, it took forever to get the bill, and there was smoking at the table next to us. You‚Äôll be better off at the T2 restaurants, as far as I can tell there is no indoor smoking.
Plenty of souvenir and cafe at 2nd floor before entering immigration. Tried latte was bit cold setvice good. Many food options available.
We came here because the menu looks interesting. We had corn soup and omelete. Soup is okay not great. Omelete is nice. Abit hard to get the waiters attention even though they wander around.

name: Banh My Tram
address: 252 Cua Nam Hoan Kiem, Hanoi 100000 Vietnam
description:
Good food - clean - friendly staff. Price fair and not cheating foreign. Can sit on street or inside.

Will be back soon. Must try other dishes too
cuisines: Japanese Restaurants for Large Groups in Hanoi
example_reviews: Good food - clean - friendly staff. Price fair and not cheating foreign. Can sit on street or inside. Will be back soon. Must try other dishes too
Delicious and really filling. Rammed with locals which is always my benchmark when traveling. It‚Äôs very basic street food but soooo good.

Warning about tram restaurants to Perfume Pagoda! There is a scam to try to trap tourists to eat at crap restaurants with super high prices, by telling them at the entrance that they must pre-book. This is not true! Better to pick something when you arrive!

name: Van Hoang Group - L'amour Steak VƒÉn Qu√°n
address: ƒê∆∞·ªùng 19/5, KDT  VƒÉn Qu√°n T·∫ßng 1 To√† New Skyline, H√† ƒê√¥ng, Hanoi 100000 Vietnam
description: International standard European restaurant. Pofessionally trained chef from Europe. Beautiful, luxurious space. Cheapest price in Hanoi, friendly staffs. Especially, VAN HOANG GROUP IMPORT & EXPORT JOINT STOCK COMPANY choose this Restaurant as a selling point to introduce Italian wine products for distribution activities in Hanoi, this is the reason you can use wine at the restaurant with the price of listed companies on the market. No extra charge. Come here and you'll want to come back again
example_reviews: When my friend invited me to come here to try it, I was surprised that the food was quite delicious and suited my taste. My friend also complimented me on the delicious food. Everyone can come here and try it. I found the price reasonable.
I have visited this restaurant and I have been surprised that they have not only asia food, but own chief specialist for European cuisine. I highly recommend this place.
Romantic environment with Italian style. The design of this restaurant looks like an old and classic cellar. Delicious foods and tasty Italian wines.

name: Rising Dragon Restaurant
address: Nguyen Quang Bich St Old Quarter, Hanoi 10000 Vietnam
description: Rising Dragon Restaurant is located on the rooftop at 12-14 Nguyen Quang Bich Street.Rising Dragon Restaurant offers the ultimate Vietnamese dining experience. The food menu has been specially crafted over the last decade, using traditional Vietnamese flavors and ingredients whilst also adopting modern and innovative cooking styles and imported foodstuffs to meet the demands of today's society.Vietnamese food is considered as an art, and that is the way we do for both tasty food in high quality and nice decoration. Let's try to discovery a part of Vietnam culture!
example_reviews: Rising Dragon Restaurant is an interesting place to visit and enjoy local food! Try it!! You will Like it!

Randomly called in for a meal. We were wanting normal local atmosphere and we got that. Nothing classy but comfortable to sit and watch happenings around. Food was very flavoursm and different from Kiwi food. Excellent friendly service and as all things in Vietnam very inexpensive. A great start for our adventure.

All great, staff, service, quality of the food, the outdoor roof top setting. I was recommended to try Banh Xeo (Rice pancakes), and had a mini training session how it should be put together, eaten- not to make a total mess of yourself, and sauces to be used.

name: Gu Bistronomy
address: 60, Nguyen Thi Dinh B12, Cau Giay, Hanoi 100000 Vietnam
description: GU Bistronomy The finest wine restaurant & bar & winecellar in Hanoi A grandeur of Indochine style blended in Art Deco architecture, GU Bistronomy is a true destination for any gastronomy and wine lover to explore the art of food and wine pairing. Savour the modern and innovative French-based cuisine in all its finery matched by our extensive wine list boasting more than 1000 international wines from famous wine regions around the world.
cuisines: Fast Food Restaurants in Cau Giay
Asian Restaurants for Lunch in Cau Giay
Vietnamese Restaurants for Lunch in Cau Giay
Fusion Restaurants for Lunch in Cau Giay
example_reviews: This restaurant is a must for anyone in Hanoi who wants to experience fine dining at its best. The setting is impeccable - the restaurant is clean and stylish. The decor is beautiful. Tables are generously spaced apart, and there are those overlooking to kitchen and others that provide a street view. The staff were FANTASTIC! Knowledgable, friendly, attentive. We had a wonderful time chatting to the staff. Special mention goes to Dong, the General Manager for her hospitality. Last, but not least, the food! Hands down the best piece of meat I√¢‚Ç¨‚Ñ¢ve ever had. Cooked to utter perfection. The sides were also delectable. Drinks were perfect too. Could not fault a thing.

Delightful experience for my lady and I, especially on our anniversary. One of the best gems to experience in Hanoi. They really made you feel like you√¢‚Ç¨‚Ñ¢re somebody. They gave me a tour of the whole restaurant and even the wine cellar with their vast selection. From the decor to their service. Nothing but the best. A very fine dining experience. Very refreshing especially having eaten mostly local and street food. We had a table side server, Duy Anh. He was amazing! Glass never empty and even if I had a look of curiosity he was by my side ready to answer any question. He even drank a glass wine with me ( I even made him pour a bigger glass so he can enjoy himself at work). The food was amazing. My lady surprisingly licked each plate clean √∞≈∏Àú‚Äö. I highly recommend this place to anyone wishing to treat themselves. They offered to call a taxi and never left us thirsty. Always supplied water even while waiting for a taxi. Thank you so much for the wonderful experience here at GU. A memorable anniversary dinner.
We have never been to a place in Hanoi that has this quality of wine for the price that was offered.

name: Pizza 4p's Aeon Mall Long Bi√™n
address: 27 C·ªï Linh, Long Bi√™n, Hanoi 100000 Vietnam
description: An Earth to People restaurant on a mission to make the world smile for peace, one pizza at a time. Earth to People is our commitment to serve safe and fresh foods directly from Mother Earth to you. Located in Ho Chi Minh City, Hanoi, Danang and Nha Trang.
cuisines: Eastern European Restaurants for Lunch in Hanoi
example_reviews: As a first-time visitor, I was impressed by the friendly and attentive staff. They made me feel welcome and were happy to offer recommendations. The pizza was delicious‚Äîcrispy, chewy, and topped with fresh homemade cheese. I tried the Burrata Parma Ham Pizza, and it was fantastic. The ingredients tasted high-quality and well-prepared. The restaurant had a cozy, modern vibe, perfect for a relaxing meal. Prices were a bit high, but the quality made it worth it. Overall, a great experience, and I‚Äôd love to come back!
Pizza 4P's Aeon Mall Long Bien has delicious pizza, beautiful space, good service, worth trying! I will definitely come back here

name: X√≥m M·ªõi Garden
address: 144 V√µ Tr·ª©, ph∆∞·ªùng T√¢n L·∫≠p, Nha Trang 650000 Vietnam
description: Fantastic food, it is the place for people that like quality food adequately priced in a casual atmosphere (not suitable for romantic occasions). We ordered ribs, chicken in passion fruit sauce, mango smoothies and everything (every single detail) was delicious! I am amazed how the kitchen can serve so many customers that fast and keep the quality so good

I am amazed how the kitchen can serve so many customers that fast and keep the quality so good

It's so, so delicious. The banh xeo and nem nueng here are really delicious and the staff prepares it right next to you, so it's really convenient. If you order rice noodles mixed with rice, even the kids will enjoy a bowl. If you order beef rice noodles, it tastes like galbitang soup. It's definitely a choice. Be sure to come. Authentic Vietnamese cuisine, with a waiter making hand rolls directly in front of the guests, features, Vietnamese coconut coffee must try. Potatoes and pork dishes are worth a try. The environment has Vietnamese characteristics.

name: Altitude Rooftop Bar
address: 26-28 Tran Phu Street Sheraton Nha Trang Hotel & Spa, Nha Trang 650000 Vietnam
description: From the 28th floor, Altitude boasts a luxurious character and panoramic views in the heart of Nha Trang. Feel the music industry's latest beats with our guest DJs . example_reviews: I came here yesterday for New Year‚Äôs Eve with a couple of friends and family and the food was absolutely Devine it was perfectly cooked and the presentation of it was unbelievable. In the restaurant everything was so organized and our waitress Ariana made our experience at altitude so much better with her perfect manors and a bright smile she was so polite and made sure we had everything we possibly needed so a big thank you to her. Happy new years all x

The snacks at Altitude bar, including cocktails and French fries, were very delicious, and the cocktails were also very delicious. Peach...? The cocktail was so delicious that I want to drink it again the next time I visit Nha Trangüòç Even though it was a hotel, the price was reasonable and it was very nice. I also liked that the staff were friendly. I especially liked that Linh was friendlyüíó Thank u Linhüíó

We went to Altitude for sunset drinks, and had a fantastic time. They had a huge drinks menu, there is definitely something for everyone. We had a very early morning start the next day, so asked them to make 2 non-alcholic mojitos, which were great. The view from the bar is amazing. You won't get any other view like this in Nha Trang. The only downside is that there was someone blasting very loud music from the beach, and even all the way up at Altitude bar, we could hear their music! Otherwise, it's a great place to relax and enjoy a tipple after a long day out in Nha Trang.

name: Livin - Nha Trang
address: 5a Ngo Thoi Nhiem Tan Lap, Nha Trang 650000 Vietnam
description: Established in 2015, LIVIN ‚Äì Nha Trang is a casual restaurant deep-rooted from the traditions of American barbecue. Balancing between traditions, cultures, and innovation; we hope to create, inspire, and share a wide-range of classic to new-American dishes. Our Mission is to serve our customers an honest, delicious, and an amazing experience.
cuisines: Street Food Restaurants in Nha Trang
Fast Food Restaurants in Nha Trang
Mediterranean Restaurants with Private Dining in Nha Trang
example_reviews: If you're a brisket enthusiast in Vietnam, look no further than Livin Nha Trang. This hidden gem takes the crown for serving the best brisket in the country, making it a must-visit for meat lovers. The star of the show at Livin Nha Trang is undoubtedly their brisket. Bursting with flavor and tenderness, each bite is a heavenly experience. The succulent, slow-cooked brisket is perfectly seasoned and melts in your mouth, delivering a delightful blend of smoky and savory notes. Combine brisket with the warm tortillas, fresh toppings, and zesty sauces, the brisket tacos become a culinary masterpiece that will leave you craving more. I have had them three times in one week Beyond the brisket tacos, Livin Nha Trang offers a range of other tantalizing dishes that showcase their expertise in meat preparation. The quality and consistency of the brisket are truly remarkable, guaranteeing a memorable dining experience every time. Apart from the outstanding food, Livin Nha Trang provides a welcoming and relaxed atmosphere. The friendly staff members are passionate about their craft and are more than happy to guide you through the menu and recommend the perfect pairing. The cozy and casual setting adds to the overall enjoyment of the meal, making it a great spot to gather with friends or family. While Livin Nha Trang's focus is primarily on their standout brisket dishes, they also offer a decent selection of sides and beverages to complement your meal. Whether you're in the mood for crispy fries, refreshing salads, or a cold craft beer, they have you covered. In terms of value, Livin Nha Trang delivers on both taste and portion sizes. The prices are reasonable considering the high quality of the ingredients and the mouthwatering flavors you'll experience. In conclusion, Livin Nha Trang is a haven for brisket lovers in Vietnam. With their unparalleled brisket tacos and an array of flavorful dishes, they have undoubtedly perfected the art of brisket preparation. Prepare yourself for a taste sensation that will linger on your palate long after your visit. Don't miss the opportunity to savor the best brisket Vietnam has to offer at Livin Nha Trang!

We were recommended this place by our friends, upon arrival it smelt absolutely incredible and the choice on the menu was great! The food from start to finish was honestly some of the nicest and tastiest food weve eaten since visiting Vietnam. The steak was cooked to perfection just how we wanted it and the pulled pork loaded fries for starter were definitely my favourite dish! 10/10 would definitely recommend and return here in the future

We fancied a meat/BBQ selection whilst on our Vietnam trip and came across this place. We were certainly not disappointed! We shared the 2 person meat selection which is served with coleslaw & pickles. The meats were cooked & smoked to absolute perfection and we just didn‚Äôt want it to end! We ordered a side of fries to share and there was more than plenty of food. The staff are great, the wine was good and well chilled. The place has a great vibe and quick service. A couple of bits that would make it perfect: -the bathrooms could do with a paint/mini refurb -the restaurant is above another and it‚Äôs a little hard to find/misleading at first. More signage would be good! If you are visiting Nha Trang and like your meat - 100% visit here, you will not be disappointed!

He took care of the surroundings so that I could take pictures, and when he served the last cocktail to see if the food was delicious, he let the kids try it one at a time. The kids had a great time, and the songs they sang were good. We were listening to pop songs that my father likes. I think you would have really liked it, so I hope you come with me next time.

example_reviews: Very tasty, cheesecakes are flying out every day. I took oatmeal, they can cook it with oat milk, without sugar. You can also make scramble purely from egg whites. My husband took pancakes, which were also delicious. DELICIOUS üòã and very pretty inside. European cuisine is common to many, not pho bo soups for breakfast. Many Russian-speaking visitors and Europeans. name: Skylight Nha Trang
address: 38 Tran Phu Street Rooftop, Nha Trang 650000 Vietnam
description: Don't miss out on the ultimate experience at Skylight Nha Trang! This breathtaking rooftop beach club, located on the 45th floor of the Havana Hotel in Vietnam, offers 360¬∞ views of the stunning beach town paradise and the best DJs in town to dance the night away underneath the stars. Open Thursday to Sunday from 20:00 to 01:00, come make unforgettable memories and capture those Instagram-worthy photos at Skylight Nha Trang. We look forward to welcoming you to our beach town paradise!
cuisines: Street Food Restaurants in Nha Trang
Fast Food Restaurants in Nha Trang
example_reviews: My visit to Skylight Rooftop in Nha Trang with my family was an exceptional experience. The ambiance, with its stunning panoramic views of the city and coastline, set the perfect backdrop for our evening out. The highlight of our meal was the Tomahawk steak. The meat was incredibly tender and cooked to perfection, offering a delightful blend of flavors that left us all thoroughly impressed. The presentation was equally impressive, making it a feast for both the eyes and the palate. The service was top-notch, with attentive and friendly staff who ensured our dining experience was seamless. They were especially accommodating to our family, making us feel welcome and well cared for. The overall atmosphere, combined with the quality of the food and service, makes Skylight a must-visit destination in Nha Trang. It's an ideal spot for families looking to enjoy a memorable meal with breathtaking views! Highly recommended for anyone visiting Nha Trang with their loved ones, especially if you are a meat lover.

Skylight Nha Trang is a vibrant rooftop bar and entertainment venue that offers a truly unforgettable experience. Perched atop the Premier Havana Hotel, it provides 360-degree panoramic views of Nha Trang's coastline, cityscape, and mountains, making it a perfect spot for sunset lovers and nightlife enthusiasts. The venue boasts a sleek and modern design, with multiple areas including a pool deck, a restaurant, and a lively dance floor featuring top-notch DJs. The drinks menu is diverse, offering creative cocktails and a solid selection of wines and spirits. The food menu features a mix of local Vietnamese flavors and international dishes, catering to a variety of tastes. The atmosphere is lively and sophisticated, drawing both tourists and locals. While the entry fee might seem steep to some, it typically includes a complimentary drink, and the overall experience justifies the cost. Whether you're looking to unwind with a cocktail, enjoy stunning views, or dance the night away, Skylight Nha Trang delivers.

Rooftop bar and restaurant at the Premier Havana Hotel. Paid entrance (includes one welcome drink), 360¬∞ view, attentive staff who will show you everything and guide you everywhere. I especially recommend a place with a glass floor. Come at sunset, the views and photos will be great!

A rich breakfast is available offering a freshly baked selection of croissants, muffins and pastries, roasted Italian coffee and infusions. In the late afternoon, & More turns into a vibrant wine bar. Wines are served in attractive ice-bucket on the counter bar, paired with tasty snacks. The atmosphere is laid-back and cheerful. The outdoor terrace lounge sets the perfect mood for wine degustation.

example_reviews: If you‚Äôre looking for an authentic taste of Spain, this restaurant is a fantastic choice. The atmosphere is warm and inviting, with charming d√©cor. Overall, this is a must-visit spot for anyone who loves Spanish cuisine or wants to experience something new. Highly recommended!

I went there to commemorate the anniversary because I heard it was awarded 1 Michelin star. I really enjoy trying new foods and seek out a variety of flavors. The amuse bouche was delicious and all the food was good. In particular, the staff member in charge of us was very friendly and I felt really good. I think she said she was Choi and she said she was famous for the drama Queen of Tears haha. Thank you so much for even gifting us an anniversary dessert! It was a day like a gift‚ù§Ô∏è

We had the pleasure of dining twice at the Gran Melia Nha Trang's Hispania restaurant (Spanish restaurant). Once √† la carte and once with the Chef's testing 5-course menu, and both were incredible experiences! Spanish cuisine has pride of place here, and every dish we tasted was a true delight. Featuring quality products, the authentic and delicate flavors really delighted our taste buds. A huge thank you to the Chef and his brigade, as well as to Ms Jasmin and Ms Trinh. Their service was impeccable, combining professionalism with human warmth. They took the time to explain each dish to us, which enriched our experience. The ambience of the restaurant is equally charming, creating an ideal setting for a memorable meal. We particularly appreciated the attention to detail, both in the presentation of the dishes and in the warm welcome. In short, L'Hispania is a must for those wishing to enjoy authentic Spanish cuisine in a welcoming setting. We'd like to thank the whole team for a fantastic evening, and look forward to coming back for more! Comte G&M

name: Ph·ªü T√¨nh Nha Trang
address: 64c Nguy·ªÖn Th·ªã Minh Khai T√¢n L·∫≠p, Nha Trang 57100 Vietnam
description: Pho Tinh Nha Trang is proud to bring the traditional Hanoi pho flavor, famous for its rich, delicious broth simmered from marrow bones for many hours. Combined with tender, sweet beef slices and delicious, chewy pho noodles, each bowl of pho here is a perfect blend of Vietnamese culinary quintessence. The restaurant is located at 64C Nguyen Thi Minh Khai, right in the center of Nha Trang, very convenient for both locals and tourists. We serve from 6am to 9pm, ideal for early breakfast, intimate lunch or relaxing dinner with family and friends. The restaurant space is designed to be spacious, clean, equipped with modern air conditioning to bring maximum comfort to diners. The friendly, professional staff is always ready to serve and bring a great culinary experience. Visit Pho Tinh Nha Trang to feel the authentic traditional pho flavor and enjoy a cozy, intimate Vietnamese culinary space!

example_reviews: Clean and excellent service. The ph·ªü isn‚Äôt quite the same as the ironical one in Hanoi as it has less green onion but I guess that‚Äôs just adjusting to the local taste bud. Still recommended if you‚Äôre looking for a taste of Hanoi Ph·ªü Th√¨n
Clean atmosphere. Great Korean. Second visit. I came to remember Korean food. Same as when we arrived in November. The Big Swan.
There's a special menu so I think it'd be nice to visit a band tired of other rice beans! The steak and rice are delicious :)

name: Secrets Bar & Grill Nha Trang
address: 64 Hong Bang, Nha Trang 650000 Vietnam
description: Canadian owned and operated...Steaks, burgers & more... Great Cocktails serving in bottom floor bar...cozy dining room, amazing chilled out patio.. and vip private room for dinner functions. Warm and friendly staff ready serve you. Thanks All and See you!

French Restaurants for Breakfast in Nha Trang
Greek Restaurants for Lunch in Nha Trang
example_reviews: Really glad i found this joint in nha trang. Food was excellent, our server (i think his name was Tho?) was exceptional, very patient and knowledgeable, servers even went above ans beyond in buying us flowers on request because we didnt know the area well! Bar staff gave us complementary drinks on the house as well! Owners are from Canada and xan speak english and vietnamese fluently and are very friendly and easy going. Steaks were delicious along with the mussles and clams we had as sides. Highly recommend visiting and experiencing this place, it feels like a five star western restaurant with Nha Trang prices and warm asian welcoming vibes.

After weeks of delicious Vietnamese food, that craving for Western comfort started creeping in. Lucky for us, our friend Brandon introduced us to Secrets Bar & Grill, a steakhouse gem in Nha Trang owned by chef Gerry Nguyen. Tucked near the beach and city center, this place is as inviting as it is impressive‚Äîelegant decor, cozy indoor and breezy outdoor seating, plus a full bar with a solid wine list. Gerry sources top-quality meats straight from Australia and Canada, and it shows. We kicked things off with a perfectly shaken margarita and a frozen Bellini‚Äîboth were spot on. Then came the starters: a classic Caesar salad with anchovies and rich French onion soup. But the star? That ribeye. Cooked to absolute perfection. Secrets Bar & Grill is known for its premium imported steaks, curated wine selection, and relaxed, upscale vibe. Whether you‚Äôre celebrating or just need a break from noodles, this is the spot. The secret‚Äôs officially out‚Äîif you‚Äôre in Nha Trang, do yourself a favor and check it out. You won‚Äôt be disappointed.

This place is a bit expensive compared to Vietnamese prices, but the quality of the food is good enough for the price. Usually, about 300 grams per adult is enough, so I don't know the exact name of the amount and drink, but I ordered two cocktails and ate them with my wife. I went there together, and the restaurant has a nice atmosphere and the staff's English level is excellent and friendly. I'm planning to visit Nha Trang again on May 3 for a 5-day, 4-night trip, and I'm planning to visit for dinner. However, the only thing that's disappointing is that the menu doesn't mention food and cocktails. I think I can get more help with ordering if there is a picture with it.

name: Mix Greek Restaurant
address: 181 Nguyen Thien Thuat, Nha Trang 650000 Vietnam
description:
We decided to give this restaurant a try on our trip to Nha Trang  as Greece is literally our 2nd home. And boy we were not disappointed. Met by the owner, Stefanos, we were shown to a beautiful table by the window that gave a great view of the street. Our first impression of the restaurant was how like the many Greek Tavernas we have tried that this place actually was, with original Greek colors and wall art.

We chose the local house wine and excitedly perused the extensive menu. Missing all the fresh fish we eat in Greece we asked Stef if we could try a Fish Platter. Excellent choice! (please see pic below and arrive hungry!) As it was going to be all cooked from fresh we were told to expect a wait of at least 35 minutes. Not a problem, just keep the excellent house red topped up in our glasses! 

And then it arrived! Wow! It was nearly the length of the table! So on the huge platter there were Clams, Mussels Saganaki, Calamari‚Äôs, a whole Seabass, Bassa portions accompanied by a bowl of fries, fresh salad adorning each end of the plate, a selection of dips and bread too. So we set to work! Demolishing everything we could see! It was a work in progress in between the wine. Even the owner was surprised we finished it!

With this gone we thought we could not manage another morsel! Quickly changed our minds though when we were presented with little chocolate pots to finish off!

All in all it was an excellent start to our trip to Nha Trang with excellent food and service which is second to none that we have experienced and will definitely visit again before we leave.

Thank you Steve, Makis and the team you certainly deliver 100% in all aspects!

Jo and Mart x

I physically cannot explain how good this place is. The best food we‚Äôve had in a long time- and you get a free dessert just because! Everything tastes extremely fresh, the staff strive for perfection and the setting really feels like you‚Äôre in Greece. After 6 weeks of backpacking, this place cured my soul. Please go here!

We discovered this restaurant in 2015 and rediscovered it at its new location 9 years later. Food is still fabulous and great value. The portions are generous and the Britzola (pork steak) was enough between two adults. The meat was very flavoursome. We also had a starter of fried saganaki which was very creamy and moreish. Finally, a complimentary dessert ‚Äì a chocolate brownie type pudding with banana. We highly recommend this restaurant.

name: Sailing Club Nha Trang
address: 72-74 Tran Phu, Loc Tho, Nha Trang 570000 Vietnam
description: Part of the unique charm of the Nha Trang Sailing Club is its ability to transform itself depending on the hour of the day. From sun-up until sun-down it is the perfect beach club and is available for all to enjoy. If you are looking for a place to while away a few hours whilst soaking up an amazing beach and island view then look no further. A delectable cocktail or delicious snack is only a wave of the hand away. As the sun disappears behind Nha Trang's beautiful hills, the Sailing Club transforms into a sophisticated dining setting serving eclectic food from four different international kitchens. Whatever your taste may be, we believe we have the dish for you! And just when you thought it was time to go home, the Nha Trang Sailing Club once again reinvents itself as restaurant becomes bar and night club. Every night of the year, the Nha Trang Sailing Club offers the best dance floor and the latest tunes on offer in the city.
cuisines: Fast Food Restaurants in Nha Trang
Street Food Restaurants in Nha Trang
Indian Restaurants for Lunch in Nha Trang
example_reviews: Excellent location right on the beach and has seating on the sand, patio or inside. Has an equally vast choice of cuisines and drinks. We had a bespoke, vegetarian pizza made and it was absolutely delicious. Thin, crispy with a perfect balance of toppings and cheese. As it was early evening, the music being played by the DJ was appropriate to enjoy the meal whilst enjoying the sound of the sea and breeze. Though not the cheapest beachside bar/restaurant, it has the perfect ambience to unwind and enjoy Nha Trang by nite. Would definitely come again.

Ideally located , easily accessible and the perfect beach setting. We were there in the evening for a bite and saw the colors change ‚Ä¶. Beaches of Nha Trang all brilliant hues. Found the menu very interesting, the passion fruit cocktail i ordered was refreshing.Samosa was mind blowing with the accompanying mint chutney.Prices are also moderate however it‚Äôs well worth it for the eclectic vibe!!! Service was top notch and also rather quick. There were milkshakes, lavish fruit platters and endless beers being served. Great place for people watching as jogger‚Äôs go by in the evening and one can see the ferris wheel lit up at Vinwonder. Drop by to hang out and chill!!!

We stopped after a day at the beach to have a beer. Excellent service. It has tables on the beach and the place is right in front of the sea. It also offers restaurant service with dishes from all over the world: from local, Indian, Italian... prices above the local average.

name: Ambassador Club Nha Trang
address: Ana Marina, Nguy·ªÖn C∆° Th·∫°ch B·∫øn thuy·ªÅn Ana Marina, Nha Trang 650000 Vietnam
description: I had a nice breakfast and drinks at The Yacht. There are many breakfasts here, such as Hue beef noodles, Nha Trang soup ... More importantly, there is a decaf food. At The Yacht restaurant, there are not only a variety of dishes, but also beautiful drinks to make drinkers feel delicious, such as: sunset tea, cardamom flower tea... and more importantly, the yacht has great staff and has fun. Thank you for a great breakfast.
