Not too bad if you were wanting to try the fresh coffee anyway. You can walk along the bridge & look at the coffee plantation for free if you aren't bothered by the other bits.
Lovely spot. Got to learn about the coffee process and try some. Saw weasel enclosure - a first for me. If you are an Insta poster, this is also the spot for you! Wow!!

The view of the coffee plantation is very nice. However, there is wooden trail into the coffee plantation that was close, the explanation on coffee production process was very poor (couldn't see anything on coffee roasting and grinding) and the prices for a cup of coffee were very high

name: Down Under
address: 55 Ba Thang Hai Hana Dalat Hotel, Ward 1, Da Lat 670000 Vietnam
description: THE BEST IN TOWN!! The first venue in Dalat dedicated to your sporting passions, BIG Screens, Great Food & Good Company. We are true blue committed to exceeding your expectations! !!Fair Dinkum!!
cuisines: Street Food Restaurants in Da Lat
Fast Food Restaurants in Da Lat
Late Night European Restaurants in Da Lat
French Restaurants for Lunch in Da Lat
example_reviews: Food was great (we had loaded fries, burrito with garlic chips and bangers and mash which were Cumberland so I was over the mood) and staff were very attentive. Owner was a lovely guy too but didn‚Äôt catch his name. The bar sports a large screen playing ESPN and also sells Saigon cider which was a treat. Well worth the trip if you‚Äôre in De Lat!

This isn't just the best sports bar in da lat .. the food is 10/10 .. the waggu burger is delightful and would recommend to anyone .. they also have a wide selection of food and beers .. the owner is very welcoming and makes you feel right at home even though you could be miles from it !! Thanks and keep up the good work !!

I visited a small burger shop then wandered a couple of doors up the street and spotted the Down Under Bar Sports Bar. It turns out that the owner, Peter, was the former proprietor of the burger place! He was there during my visit and we chatted away for a couple of hours as he told me how it all came to be. He is a good man with doing something a little different to the norm. TV screens adorn the walls playing various sporting events from surfing, to football, golf, cricket, both rugby codes and even AFL. To name but several. It opens early enough (and stays open late enough) for you to be able to catch your sport of choice from anywhere in the world. As a smoker, I didn't find the non-smoking policy to be a hinderance, as it is easy enough to step outside to partake if you so choose. The drinks menu was extensive, from local and imported craft beers (and all your favourites), to mixed drinks and cocktails. The "grub" (food) menu was exceptional with some hilariously named dishes (Peter has quite the sense of humour), from simple snacks up to fine quality steaks. All of which - like the drinks - are within the budget of even the most budget conscious visitor. Particularly at Happy Hour, where drinks were 50% off! The decor is clean and fresh and the staff most friendly. All bearing testament to the vision Peter and his wife have for the place. It had only been open a couple of months prior to my visit and I encourage you to stop in and say g'day to Peter and enjoy the ambience. In my conservative estimation, I rate it a solid 11/10. Do not visit Da Lat without dropping in. Stu.

name: Gourmet Burger
address: 54/4 Phan ƒê√¨nh Ph√πng Ph∆∞·ªùng 1, Da Lat 650000 Vietnam
description: Alain The Best Gourmet Burger in Dalat. Australian import meat, only fresh ingredients : bread, bacon, vegetables, mushrooms etc, French chef and owner (Alain) ! Our menu have Burgers, Fish an Chips, Rib Eyes australian steack, French fries, Italian sausage. Beers, soda, water... We can speak English, French and Vietnamese Opening time : 7/7 from 12 to 9pm (from noon to 9 p.m.) We have re-opened to welcome you even better than usual with a new address 54/4 Phang Dinh Phung, a few meters from the old one! See you soon. Alan
cuisines: Street Food Restaurants in Da Lat
Fast Food Restaurants in Da Lat
Seafood Restaurants for Breakfast in Da Lat
example_reviews: Amazing cozy place to have good burgers with good quality meat! Prices are beyond reasonable, not only because of the delicious food, but because the owner is a really nice person to spend some time chatting with. He will tell you lots of interesting things about life in Da Lat, and about his life journey. DEFINITELY A MANDATORY STOP IN DA LAT.

Great selection of burgers on the menu in this bright little cafe style eatery. Friendly family run with delicious food. Clean plates all round. Set within a beautiful picturesque street. ‚≠ê‚≠ê‚≠ê‚≠ê‚≠ê

a truly excellent example of a traditional Australian-style hamburger! (the beef and bacon variety). the all-Australian beef patty was tasty and perfectly cooked, and the bun and other ingredients were just perfect. not too big, but easily enough for a great feed, and really perfectly balanced and tasty. will be back!

name: Qu√°n C∆°m Linh ƒê√† L·∫°t
address: 11 L√™ VƒÉn T√°m Ph∆∞·ªùng 10, Da Lat 66100 Vietnam
description:
We had a quick meal on a rainy afternoon in August. We were all in a hurry, the rain came and we didn't have time to manage it, but fortunately a quick but correct decision helped us enjoy the meal. Dinner with a taste of home. Here, with a level 4 house, decorated in a rustic style, hot rice and soup are brought out just in time, everything seems to be gathered together to make the meal more delicious.
 If you have a chance, please try to visit.
(near the center - about 5 minutes by car and has car parking)
cuisines: Fast Food Restaurants in Da Lat
Street Food Restaurants in Da Lat

We were all in a hurry, the rain came and we didn't have time to manage it, but fortunately a quick but correct decision helped us enjoy the meal. Dinner with a taste of home. If you have a chance, please try to visit. (near the center - about 5 minutes by car and has car parking)

I happened to visit the restaurant during a quick trip to Da Lat. What impressed me was that the restaurant's space was quite warm, the food was simple but familiar like home-cooked meals, and the staff were super cute. If I have a chance, I will stop by the restaurant :)

I stopped by Quan Linh with my friends and we ordered lunch including shrimp soup, stir-fried water spinach with garlic, and braised pork. All 3 dishes are delicious and hot. The prices here are reasonable compared to the general level. If I have a chance, I will stop by the restaurant again.

name: Le Retour
address: 38 Phan Boi Chau, Da Lat 670000 Vietnam
description: The place for you to rejoice life because ‚Äúyears, lovers, and glasses of wine are things that should never be counted‚Äù
cuisines: Fast Food Restaurants in Da Lat
Street Food Restaurants in Da Lat
Seafood Restaurants for Breakfast in Da Lat
example_reviews: What a pleasant surprise to find this lovely cheese and wine bar in it would be a delight anywhere let alone in Da Lat. we could only stay for a short time and enjoyed goats cheese with apple, honey comb and bread. Service was amazing. The young man extremely polite and helpful. Even took some pictures and air dropped them for us. Overall wonderful end to our last night in Da Lat.

What a gorgeous find! After reading reviews, I was delighted to stumble upon this bar. Beautifully decorated for Christmas, it offered a warm welcome. Once inside, I was surprised by the small size, but the design was such that you didn't feel crowded. Welcomed by the charming and personable Nguyen, I chose a glass of the Viognier and generous plate of prosciutto. The experience was delightful. I will be back to try the Italian white. Highly recommended.

We popped in to have a quick drink with our three boys and ended up coming back every night we were in Da Lat. The children loved the space, the lovely lady Tran was excellent with the three boys helping them make wax seals and chatting with them. The wine was delicious as well! A real gem.

name: Biang Dalat Garden Restaurant
address: No. 94 Ly Tu Trong Street Inside Banyan House Eco Hotel, Da Lat 670000 Vietnam
description: Biang Dalat is an eco friendly farm to table restaurant using all fresh ingredients from the farmers of Dalat city cooked by professional chef in a modern way
cuisines: Fast Food Restaurants in Da Lat
Street Food Restaurants in Da Lat
Romantic Italian Restaurants in Da Lat
example_reviews: Table not to be missed. Fusion cuisine, Italian inspired. The sauces each have their own particularity, but always a flavor in harmony with the meat; chosen. I recommend the smoked basa fish and the porcheta. A variety of wines, white and red, are offered and sound advice is provided. The dishes are plentiful, and the service very attentive. The restaurant offers space and conviviality; the decoration is elegant. The staff is particularly welcoming and available. We celebrated New Year's Eve there, with family, with great pleasure.

This restaurant is a kind of hidden and chill, the decor is just my style. With only 2 people going, I couldn't order many dishes, because each portion was quite large. I ordered salad and steak, Salad is a no-brainer because Da Lat vegetables are always fresh and delicious, the steak is also very delicious. Highly recommend this restaurant to everyone.

We weren't sure how the food would turn out after reading some reviews, but we were pleasantly surprised with everything we ordered. The steak was cooked to our requests and was absolutely delicious. Will definitely be back for that. The octopus was also was good. At first i thought the portion might not be enough but it was, in fact, very filling, but also left us with a bit of room for dessert. They only have 1 option right now,a pumpkin budin which was nice. I'd also like to note that the staff was very attentive. They wrote down our order and confirmed it, which i appreciated, and they also answered any of our questions regarding ingredients and allergies/sensitivities. You could tell that they were really making an effort to serve with care. Clean well stocked bathrooms as well were a big plus. Definitely recommend coming here for a treat dinner, as it is pricer than other traditional options, however it was totally worth it!

name: H·∫° - C∆°m N·∫•u L·ªëi Hu·∫ø
address: 01 Nguy·ªÖn Sinh Cung Ph∆∞·ªùng V·ªπ D·∫°, Qu·∫≠n Thu·∫≠n Ho√°, Hue 49000 Vietnam
description: This restaurant opened only 3 months ago and is very good positioned near the river. Classy experience and very good kitchen. The service lacks experience but this will get better with time.  Overall a very good experience.
cuisines: Sushi Restaurants for Lunch in Hue
example_reviews: This restaurant opened only 3 months ago and is very good positioned near the river. Classy experience and very good kitchen. The service lacks experience but this will get better with time. Overall a very good experience.

Gorgeous spot a few steps away from the main city. Really modern restaurant situated on a small island over a bridge. Stunning space, delicious food, great service. Phuong Trinh was very helpful recommending some great dishes.

name: B√°nh G√°nh Restaurant
address: 51 V√µ Th·ªã S√°u, Hue 49118 Vietnam
description: Local food- Hue specialites
example_reviews: This is a great little restaurant just outside the main hub the serves delicious food and good service for a reasonable price. I have been searching Hue for my favourite spicy Hue style noodle soup and on our last day we found it at this restaurant. We have found that most of the restaurants in Vietnam don‚Äôt serve spicy and you have to ask. If you don‚Äôt like spicy then most of the menu is just great tasting Vietnamese food. Worth a visit when in Hue.

We visited for dinner and sat on the second floor so we could people watch from the large windows upstairs. The food was delicious and so well priced. Our waiter was friendly and suggested reducing our order as he felt we wouldn‚Äôt be able to eat it all‚Ä¶and he was right! We ordered the local speciality beef soup to share and a main course each with rice , plus a beer and glass of wine and spent around ¬£16 in total which was great! There were loads of prawns in my stir fry prawns and vegetable stir fry and the pak choi, okra, carrots and cabbage were very tasty in a light spicy sauce.

Absolutely delightful restaurant serving local specialties (that the wait staff are happy to advise you on!). Sat upstairs overlooking the street. Comfortable and not at all noisy. (this was a real plus given the commotion on the walking streets on a Sunday evening). The menu had delectable vegetarian choices for the friends we were traveling with who had been relegated to rice and steamed vegetables for several days. The food was modestly priced and outstanding (I took their advice on the local specialties, my husband had a clay pot meal- all the dishes were terrific). We REALLY enjoyed chatting with the wait staff, especially Bom who was eager to speak English with us. They were attentive and helpful. Easy to walk here from our hotel via the pedestrian "walking streets" from our hotel

name: V·ªã Hu·∫ø Restaurant & Caf√©
address: 61 V√µ Th·ªã S√°u, Ph√∫ H·ªôi, Hue Vietnam
description: Renowned for its vibrant flavors, fresh ingredients, and artistic presentation, Hu·∫ø cuisine is a treasure of Vietnam‚Äôs culinary heritage. V·ªã Hu·∫ø takes this tradition to new heights, blending sustainability and creativity into every dish. From fragrant herbs to delicate spices, every bite reflects the royal essence of Hue, inviting diners on an unforgettable journey of flavors, culture, and refinement!
cuisines: Sushi Restaurants for Lunch in Hue
Thai Restaurants for Lunch in Hue
example_reviews: Exquisite experience from start to finish. Mong, our waitress, had the warmest smile and made us feel at home. The food was amazing, each dish surprised us with a different, subtle taste. We had the lotus salad, duck, linguine, rice noodles as well as the flamb√©ed banana and sweet soup for dessert. The interior design was gorgeous. This restaurant was Perfection in all aspects. We paid 22 dollars per person (without wine) for what felt like a Michelin meal.

If you‚Äôre looking for a cozy restaurant with excellent service, Vi Hue is a must-visit. The service is prompt and attentive without being intrusive. The ambiance is charming, with soft lighting and a relaxed vibe that makes you feel at home. The menu offers a wide range of dishes, and each plate is a masterpiece in flavor and presentation. I highly recommend their signature Sous vide duck breast, which is perfectly cooked and rich in taste. And I‚Äôm really impressive with good service of Mrs.Dream and Mrs.Vi.

Very elegant restaurant and inventive cuisine. The dishes I chose were delicious and very well presented. Vietnamese cuisine of high standard for relatively wise prices. The staff , multilingual is very welcoming and with little care especially Mr.Bach who was very attentive and took care to explain each dish in French! The decor is successful and relaxing. Do not forget to have a cocktail üç∏üçπ they are well made and original. I will definitely return during my stay. Patrick

name: Imperial Craft Bia Brewpub
address: 21/4 Ngo Gia Tu Vinh Ninh, Hue 530000 Vietnam
description: The best place to drink craft beer in Hue. We got 14 taps of beer brewed on-site in a variety of styles, with Lagers, Pale Ales, and of course IPAs. We also do killer sourdough pizza, beef & chicken burgers on homemade buns and Mexican-style carnitas tacos. Welcome to the brewery!
cuisines: Sushi Restaurants for Lunch in Hue
example_reviews: We visited on a very quiet Tuesday afternoon (just us in there!). We are suckers for a craft beer place as generally places with nice beer do great food, and we weren‚Äôt wrong here. They had a great barman (as well as the owners) on hand to talk through their beers, and even brought out three for my husband to try before he ordered. I had the freshly squeezed lemon juice which was lovely. The food was excellent. My husband had the chicken burger, the bun he described more like a scone like texture but said it was so tasty. I opted for the fish tacos, again these were full of flavour. I imagine when this place has more people in the atmosphere just improves more. We‚Äôre really glad we visited!

Fantastic range of craft beers, friendly atmosphere, great happy hour deals and we were fortunate enough to come for Taco Tuesday - carnitas tacos at about $1.50 Australian dollars each were absolutely delicious. Pizzas looked fantastic too although we did not try them. Not in main tourist area but worth a 15min walk or taxi.

Amazing NE IPA in the heart of Hu·ªÅ! We are from Boston and this is the closest NEIPA we have had to the greats like Trillium and Treehouse outside of New England. The food was awesome (especially the pizza and ice cream) and our server L√Ω was so kind to us and our kids. We went back daily during our time in Hu·ªÅ.

name: Le Cercle Hue
address: 11 Le Loi Street, Hue 530000 Vietnam
description:
We had an incredible dining experience at this Vietnamese restaurant. The food was authentic, flavorful, and beautifully presented, offering a true taste of Vietnam. The restaurant‚Äôs location provides a stunning view, making the atmosphere even more enjoyable.

A special shoutout to Long, our server, who went above and beyond to accommodate our extra requests. His attentiveness, friendly demeanor, and dedication to ensuring we had a perfect meal truly stood out.

If you‚Äôre looking for delicious Vietnamese food paired with excellent service and a breathtaking setting, this place is a must-visit. Highly recommended!
cuisines: French Restaurants for Breakfast in Hue
Japanese Restaurants for Lunch in Hue
example_reviews: We had an incredible dining experience at this Vietnamese restaurant. The food was authentic, flavorful, and beautifully presented, offering a true taste of Vietnam. The restaurant‚Äôs location provides a stunning view, making the atmosphere even more enjoyable. A special shoutout to Long, our server, who went above and beyond to accommodate our extra requests. His attentiveness, friendly demeanor, and dedication to ensuring we had a perfect meal truly stood out. If you‚Äôre looking for delicious Vietnamese food paired with excellent service and a breathtaking setting, this place is a must-visit. Highly recommended!

We heard about this historical building in Hue, it used to be a famous sport club (swimming, rowing boat, tennis, etc.) during the French colonial era. Now it‚Äôs a high-end restaurant aptly named Le Cercle Hue. We had dinner here on our first night in Hue. Impressive interior with high ceiling, elegant wooden French doors leading to an outdoor terrace overlooking the Perfume River. Relaxing atmosphere, romantic setting with white table cloth, red rose, candle on every table. The napkin on each plate was folded into the shape of a white tuxedo jacket! We enjoyed our fabulous dinner, especially the traditional C∆°m √Çm Ph·ªß ( Hell‚Äôs rice) and B√°nh cu·ªën th·ªãt n∆∞·ªõng (rice crepe with grilled pork skewers). Our waiter L·ªôc suggested an excellent French white wine to pair with the dishes. He also happily showed us how to fold a napkin into a tuxedo when we told him we loved the look of it. Many thanks also to our waitress Ng·ªçc who recommended the fantastic hibiscus lime ice tea (hibiscus infusion with lime juice and ginger-kumquat syrup). Such unusual, complex flavors yet so refreshing! Highly recommend this place.

Excellent location by the Perfume River between two bridges. The local draft beer was very drinkable and the food excellent and reasonably priced given the location. We were served by Long who's English was very good and he was very willing to tell us about the dishes that we had chosen and life in Hue in general. He was very attentive and considerate of our well being given it was a hot day.

name: Chan
address: 01 Nguyen Thai Hoc, Hue Vietnam
description: Chan is a Hue traditional restaurant with cozy atmosphere and serve dishes from a typical family meal of Hue people.
example_reviews: This was the best dining experience weve had on our second visit to Hue after 14 years. A beautifully presented restaurant, great atmosphere. The staff are all very professional, friendly and take great care to make you feel welcome. The extensive menu has something for everyone. Vegetable, beef, pork, duck, chicken, seafood and tofu dishes deliver satisfying traditional Vietnamese flavours distinct to Hue. There is also a cafe section at the front for coffees, juices and pastries from 8am in the morning. I recommend trying the caramelised pork belly, the salt roasted chicken dishes and the kumquat and apricot juice but everything on the menu looks and tastes delightful and is very reasonably priced. We have many favourite restaurants in Vietnam and will always return to this one.

This restaurant is a wonderful find We were served by sally (Hien) who spoke brilliant English and was really helpful with our choices and the quantities required which is always difficult as the portions vary so much from one restaurant to another The food was the best we experienced in our three week trip in Vietnam and also one of the most reasonably priced We discovered that we were sitting next to the owners and the fact that they eat there speaks volumes There was a really good mix of tourists and locals eating there We would recommend this restaurant to any wanting to eat Vietnamese and specifically Hue style food

I‚Äôm visiting Hue for a couple of days and was curious after reading reviews of Chan. I called to make a reservation (I think we may have been able to just walk in, but it seemed around 80% full when we arrived around 7PM on a Sunday). The ambiance is comfortable, with many intriguing artifacts on the walls ( I asked staff about some of it). All the staff, especially our server Ngoc, were genuinely warm and friendly. I was a little surprised when, stepping out of my Grab, somebody smiling appeared with an opened umbrella (it was raining), holding it above me as I walked to the entrance. The menu seems extensive compared to what I‚Äôve seen in most restaurants on my visits to Vietnam; I recognized some of the items but there were many new ones I haven‚Äôt seen elsewhere that I think must be local regional dishes. I like to take my time and look at everything on the menu, and the staff didn‚Äôt hurry me a bit to order even though the restaurant is quite busy. The Vietnamese friend I was eating with, from a different province in Vietnam, was more excited at the menu and the food as it arrived than I‚Äôve ever seen him before in a restaurant. He kept expressing his delight at the food, and even said that if he lived near this restaurant he would eat there every day. I enjoyed everything we ordered, though I think my favorite was a fried tofu cooked in a tomato based sauce. I highly recommend trying Cham if you are in Hue, whether you are from Vietnam or are a foreign tourist.

name: Madam Thu Restaurant
address: 45 Vo Thi Sau Street, Hue 530000 Vietnam
description: Madam Thu Restaurant is a local restaurant located in Backpacker Area of Hue City. The name of woman who is owner. Madam Thu Restaurant will offer you Lunch and Diner with some famous Hue Food as Stuffed rice pancake (Banh Khoai), Grilled Chopped Pork (Nem Lui), Grilled Pork Vermicelli, Fried Spring Rolls with other delicious Hue Food with Hue Style. Beside, She will show you ‚ÄúHow to Cook Hue Food
example_reviews: We ended up here via webs and had meals twice here with abs no complaints!! There are 2 outlets and we came by .45. The place is lovely and inviting. We ordered the 10 pieces taster menu and Bahn bo, both were served quite fast. The dished and dips are so flavorful!! Our host Dihn gave exquisite care, went out of his ways to get us some items which are not on the menu, added so much to our appreciation. We were taught to assemble the rolls, every stuffs. I guess we were quite lucky tasting local foods with such reasonable prices. Give it a go when in Hue and see why this place gets great reviews for its food. Thanks the whole team for warm welcome!! Highly recommended!!

If you‚Äôre in Hue and want to sample all the best of the local food, this is the place. For about 190000 VND ( about $13 Aust) you can get a set platter that contains all samples of the local cuisine, everything from the hand rolled rice paper rolls to the fresh fruit for dessert. This place is quick, high quality and great value, but the best bit by far was Oanh our waitress, who took the time to explain the process for constructing every bite and was friendly and delightful throughout to a group of Aussies worn out by a day of high humidity touring. If you want to do yourself a serious favour while you‚Äôre on tour, drop in here, order the set menu and an ice cold Huda beer, and ask if Oanh is on duty. Truly worth it.

There are 2 Madame Thu branches 140 metres apart in the same street. Madame Thu number 1 at 4 Vo This Sau street is the more authentic building but both serve the same menu. We ate very well trying the local delicacies which were delicious - only one slight problem was that starters and mains arrived simultaneously. Notwithstanding this the food was excellent and with mineral water and a bottle of French wine we paid about ‚Ç¨14 a head which is exceptional value. Credit cards accepted. Staff very helpful in explaining how best to eat some of the esoteric dishes Highly recommended

name: Nook Eatery
address: Alley 42 Nguy·ªÖn C√¥ng Tr·ª© street Number 33 Hue, Hue 530000 Vietnam
description: A cozy, friendly, funky cafe where you can enjoy a deliciously cooked full English breakfast with the works including baked beans and English muffins - Veggie option available. We also serve a range of vegetarian and vegan breakfasts including home made granola, crepes, smoothie bowls and fresh smoothies & juices. Join us for Lunch and Dinner and enjoy Vietnamese & Asian fusion dishes, home made Vegetarian / Vegan burgers, Australian style beef burgers, Asian style curries and Stir Fry Noodle dishes - Vegan options available, fresh salads, snacks and delicious desserts. We offer a full bar with local beers, mixed drinks, cocktails and our well known coconut coffee which many of our guests keep coming back for. As with all of our dishes we take great care when preparing our Vegan / Vegetarian dishes to ensure our customers satisfaction. The team at Nook looks forward to welcoming you.
cuisines: Japanese Restaurants for Lunch in Hue
example_reviews: We chose this restaurant because it was welcoming and original with a very appetizing menu combining Vietnamese tradition and a choice of burgers. The waitresses are adorable and the food is very tasty, made from fresh produce. We had lunch and dinner for three days because this restaurant was close to our hotel but also because we wanted to explore the map. The bill is completely reasonable. A plate of fresh fruit was kindly offered to us during our last meal. The musical atmosphere is also very good, far from the synth covers heard over and over in other places.

This is the 3rd time that I have been to Nook over a number of years and it was great to see that the staff still make you feel very welcome as soon as you walk in the door. It had changed location since I'd last been however it didn't make it any easier to find! They have a wide ranging menu, including both Asian and Western dishes, open from 7am for brekky and close at 10pm. As mentioned, the staff were very frindly and great to have a chat to, and they were also very attentive to your needs, especially Min and Ha. The Nook is set out over 2 levels, with the larger seating area up the top and the kitchen/smaller seating area down the bottom. I had the pork spring rolls and a burger. Both dishes were good, although it would have been great if the bun was a little bigger on the burger from the look of the fries, I would probably say it was time to change the oil in their deep fryer. The only negative really is it would have been nice to have empty plates and bottles etc removed from the table a little quicker. Overall, I recommend that if you are in the area to pop in for a bite to eat or have a drink, you will be treated very well by the staff and also, all the food/drink is reasonably priced.

Very good restaurant. Though a little off the beaten track there are signs directing you to Nooks. The menu is arguably quite limited and a fair amount of it is "Western" but there are enough Vietnamese dishes to keep your taste buds tingling. Nice friendly service.

name: Junrei Restaurant
address: 130 Minh Mang Road, Hue Vietnam
description:
Visually very attractive both inside and out, lots of tasteful decorative elements. It is within the Pilgrimage Village Hotel complex and therefore very nicely situated in the green. In the basement there is a nice jazz bar where you can hear perfectly acceptable standards from the Blue Book, often by Cole Porter. Of the long drinks we only tried the mojito and the gin and tonic, only the latter we really recommend. The staff are very friendly, courteous and attentive throughout and know how to make the guest feel like they are the center of attention. Very nice!!!

For the food: The menu is a thick book that is also visually very professionally presented with photos. There is a selection of very nicely presented Vietnamese dishes and some standard international dishes. However, the Vietnamese dishes were quite heterogeneous in terms of quality and we were not always satisfied. However, the international dishes are always well served. We can highly recommend the stylishly decorated and delicious desserts.

The restaurant is relatively expensive, in keeping with the tasteful offering. A pizza, for example, costs around ‚Ç¨11, which is good value for money by European standards, but by Vietnamese standards it is of course incredibly expensive. However, you have to take into account that the ingredients for such dishes, such as Camembert or mozzarella, are hard to come by in Vietnam and are therefore expensive.
cuisines: Late Night Italian Restaurants in Hue
example_reviews: Visually very attractive both inside and out, lots of tasteful decorative elements. It is within the Pilgrimage Village Hotel complex and therefore very nicely situated in the green. In the basement there is a nice jazz bar where you can hear perfectly acceptable standards from the Blue Book, often by Cole Porter. Of the long drinks we only tried the mojito and the gin and tonic, only the latter we really recommend. The staff are very friendly, courteous and attentive throughout and know how to make the guest feel like they are the center of attention. Very nice!!! For the food: The menu is a thick book that is also visually very professionally presented with photos. There is a selection of very nicely presented Vietnamese dishes and some standard international dishes. However, the Vietnamese dishes were quite heterogeneous in terms of quality and we were not always satisfied. However, the international dishes are always well served. We can highly recommend the stylishly decorated and delicious desserts. The restaurant is relatively expensive, in keeping with the tasteful offering. A pizza, for example, costs around ‚Ç¨11, which is good value for money by European standards, but by Vietnamese standards it is of course incredibly expensive. However, you have to take into account that the ingredients for such dishes, such as Camembert or mozzarella, are hard to come by in Vietnam and are therefore expensive.

Our first night/dinner at The Pilgrimage Village and we‚Äôre off to a great start‚Ä¶. the Passionfruit Juice was punchy & the local beer was a winner (& nicely chilled as it should be!). We opted for the A La Carte (there is a half buffet option with an A La Carte for those with huge appetites) and we shared a starter of minced pork skewers which you wrap in rice paper with salad & peanut sauce - delicious if not a bit messy (though a cold towel is on hand). Then for mains we had the deep fried Red Snapper which you similarly prepare and eat in rice paper, though this time with salad & fresh mango slices, then dip in a chilli sauce and also the Beef Curry which was a stand out winner - mild not spicy and the beef was so tender with not an ounce of fat to be seen! All the waiting staff were super friendly, especially Lien who was so polite & sweet. We were going to eat out in town tomorrow evening but I very much suspect we‚Äôll be back in The Junrei to sample more amazing flavours üòã

We had a great time at Junrei restaurant, located in the beautiful Pilgrimage Village. The food was simply delicious, full of local flavors and perfectly prepared. Many thanks to the whole team for their kindness and warm welcome! The waiters have been taking care of us, taking the time to advise us on local specialties, but also on how to taste them to take full advantage of them. A special thank you to Madame Lien, an exceptional waitress whose smile and attentiveness truly brightened our meal. Thanks to her, this culinary experience was even more memorable. Thanks again!

name: Nha Hang Cafe Vy Da Xua
address: 131 Nguyen Sinh Cung Ph∆∞·ªùng V·ªπ D·∫°, Hue 530000 Vietnam
description: Very good mode and coffee taste very good . We could spend very good time here . Tea also taste very good and many kinds of tea .
cuisines: Chinese Restaurants for Lunch in Hue
example_reviews: Very good mode and coffee taste very good . We could spend very good time here . Tea also taste very good and many kinds of tea .

We went here with family, it is a gorgeous cafe shop with lots of places to sit and take photos. It is very calm and beautiful. We had drinks, all of which were amazing. Come here if you‚Äôre in the area for sure.

This place was very pretty, the overall ambience and vibe was very calm and serene. The architecture was very pretty as well. I had a matcha, and it was the best matcha I‚Äôve ever had. I recommended coming here for sure!

name: Chan - 19 Nguyen Thai Hoc
address: 19 Nguyen Thai Hoc, Hue 530000 Vietnam
description: Chan is a Hue traditional restaurant with cozy atmosphere and serve dishes of a typical family meal of Hue people.
cuisines: Sushi Restaurants for Lunch in Hue
example_reviews: A very patient wait staff who helped our group of 10 take orders then happily spilt bills individually and gave option to pay cash or card +2%. They even reissued a dish after some confusion on orders. Food was lovely and the chan special was real value for money at Vd95k, drinks were also more reasonably priced than other places. Catfish was succulent and little class were very filling.

A real delight üòã 10th day in Vietnam and since 3 or 4 days we can no longer get enough of rice and others, we opt for European cuisine. Today we go to this restaurant, to take over the local cuisine, carefully chosen according to notes and reviews. And now, what a joy to reconcile to Vietnamese cuisine! We ask our waitress Huyen for advice on typical Hue dishes. All happiness and flavors... um... for the proposals made. In addition very beautiful setting and a note more than incredible (25‚Ç¨ to 2 with a bottle of wine included) => No hesitation üëç

We ordered the set meal number 4 and it was great. The braised pork was sweet and tender, the soup was tasty, morning glory, and best of all was the fried fish and rice paper pancakes. This was served with fresh watermelon juice and finished with fresh fruit and the subtly delicious dessert. Our waitress was Huyen and she was friendly, spoke very good English and answered our questions about the dishes with enthusiasm. Highly recommended

name: Spice Viet Restaurant
address: 15 Ly Thuong Kiet, Hue 530000 Vietnam
description: SPICE VIET is a brand-new chain of farm-to-table restaurants showcasing authentic Vietnamese cuisine by using fresh, seasonal ingredients to create dishes that are healthy, green and delicious. Spice Viet Hue is the first in the Spice Viet chain of restaurants. Other location will open throughout Vietnam (Ho Chi Minh City, Hanoi, Hoi An...) and abroad (Europe, Australia...)
cuisines: Late Night Vietnamese Restaurants in Hue
Chinese Restaurants for Lunch in Hue
example_reviews: We forgot making a reservation before coming to the restaurant but didn√¢‚Ç¨‚Ñ¢t have to wait long, the waiters were very quick to bring out the dishes after only 10-15 minutes ordering. The menu was varied, we ordered a few dishes along with Com Nieu, I have to use the word "excellent" to describe that dinner. The restaurant's space is also charmingly decorated. It's really in the top list of Vietnamese Cuisine Restaurant in Hue.

I highly recommend this restaurant for its exceptionally fresh and quality prepared food. The hotel staff in the restaurant had an excellent service for our breakfast buffet and we enjoyed thoroughly many different varieties of fresh fruit, coffee all kinds of different Vietnamese style food and pancakes. The children really loved it and we would come back again especially the hotel and the swimming pool are excellent When you can enjoy the view from the garden from the HOTEL restaurant.

I've visited multiple Spice Viet restaurants across Viet Nam, and I always find myself returning for their food and interior designs. The restaurant always deliver amazing vietnamese food while also having choices for western cuisine as well; although it's obvious from the name that Viet food is their specialty. Saying specialty is also an understatement as their cooks deeply understand the cuisine, capable of refining it to perfection. I always recommend Spice Viet to all travelers if they're looking for the best that Vietnamese cuisine has to offer, and with a reasonable price as well.

name: Ancient Hu·∫ø Gallery Cuisine
address: 104/47 Kim Long Ancient Hue Garden Houses, Hue 49000 Vietnam
description: Some feasts were said to have included 300 rare dishes served in over a thousand bowls. ‚Äç Located in the main Garden House, Kim Long Fine Dining Restaurant mixes local specialties with Asian and European flavors to create memorable, modern-day versions of royal feasts. ‚Äç Discover this unique space and start your culinary journey sitting at a table with lacquered authentic furniture and surrounded by refined ornamental details. ‚Äç Continue this gourmet escape by enjoying the artistic vision of the mural painting representing the motifs of an Empress robe and take a look at the antique panels with the four seasons flowers carved in by the mother of pearl shells which reflect Ancient Hue. ‚Äç
cuisines: Seafood Restaurants for Lunch in Hue
example_reviews: It's been the best dinner we've ever had in Vietnam. It is more expensive than other places in the city but with a great value for money. The restaurant is located in a hotel with abundant vegetation and an outdoor pool, with a remarkable and elegant wooden building that already provided an unbeatable environment. We took a Shiraz red wine from the house which for the price is totally recommended and the best we have drunk in Vietnam after many disappointments with much more expensive wines. As for the food we share some Vietnamese prawn rolls, highly recommended. Each one also ordered a later dish: my partner ordered a b√≤ Hue b√≤ (traditional meat and noodle soup, flavored with coriander) and it came out delighted; I ordered a grilled chicken with lime leaf that was delicious, with a magnificent sauce and accompanying vegetables that I also can not fail to recommend. For dessert we had a fruit cake of the right passion but not remarkable and a dessert of chocolate type coulant that was totally worth it. The treatment of the staff was always very cheerful and polite and we had the opportunity to see during the end of the dinner a live concert of 5-6 musicians and music who played typical instruments and sang local songs, enlivening and improving the evening. Definitely a dinner to remember in Hue and all over Vietnam. 100% recommended.

I have been to this restaurant during Vietnam trip with my family. We were really satisfied. We were looking for a fairly elegant and well-served restaurant, where we could taste traditional dishes and fortunately we found it! The place remains outside the chaos of the city and presents itself very well. Dispersed in a well-kept "Vietnamese" garden, the restaurant is easily reachable by taxi (cheap). Here you can eat meat, fish, but also children's and vegetarian menus. All served as it should, with tablecloths and cutlery, but without losing the oriental charm. The service is very attentive, the waiters are kind, helpful and attentive. As well as in the kitchen, where they prepare very good and aesthetically fascinating dishes. Price above average here in Vietnam but totally affordable for those coming from the West. Worthy of note if you are looking for a refined restaurant. Great experience!

After so much street food and some "filthy" contexts it is legitimate to indulge in a little luxury. The 32 euros each for the tasting menu are well worth the service offered. The venue, inside the luxury lodge, is truly cared for down to the last detail. Courteous and very attentive service. The phon so praised by books on Vietnam finally takes shape and flavor, it is cooked with great dedication. Everything else is a virtuosity of cooking design and a vague overview of Hu√© cuisine. The only flaw to point out is the geographical location, not well marked on the maps and difficult to reach even by taxi drivers. If you have difficulty, have the restaurant call. Overall a very nice and refreshing experience.

name: Zucca Restaurant
address: 15 Chu VƒÉn An, Hue 530000 Vietnam
description: If you are looking for a restaurant in Hue that offers an intimate and inviting atmosphere, generous portions and reasonable prices, then Zucca Restaurant is the best choice. With rustic decoration and soft lighting, the restaurant offers a unique and memorable gastronomic experience. The service is very friendly and attentive, and the staff always greet you with a smile. Additionally, the restaurant is located close to the Citadel and other tourist attractions, making it a very convenient location.
cuisines: Chinese Restaurants for Lunch in Hue
example_reviews: If you are looking for a restaurant in Hue that offers an intimate and inviting atmosphere, generous portions and reasonable prices, then Zucca Restaurant is the best choice. With rustic decoration and soft lighting, the restaurant offers a unique and memorable gastronomic experience. The service is very friendly and attentive, and the staff always greet you with a smile. Additionally, the restaurant is located close to the Citadel and other tourist attractions, making it a very convenient location.

Superb attention from staff, and their lasagna was absolutely mouthwatering. This Italian/Vietnamese fusion establishment truly impresses. They generously provide a complimentary appetizer, beverage, and fresh fruit platter to finish your meal. The pricing is quite fair considering the quality, and the staff's attentiveness is remarkable throughout the dining experience.

The staff creates a warm, inviting atmosphere complemented by delicious, beautifully presented meals. Offering outstanding value, this spot serves fantastic pizza and a great variety of drinks. An absolute must-visit!

name: Les Jardins de La Carambole
address: 32, Dang Tran Con, Hue 10000 Vietnam
description: Les Jardins De La Carambole is a new restaurant in Hue serving Vietnamese and French cuisine. It is inside the Citadel, very near the Forbidden City. It's an impressive reconstruction of a French Colonial Villa. Great attention was paid to every detail of the historic reconstruction.
cuisines: Sushi Restaurants for Lunch in Hue
example_reviews: A ‚Äònice‚Äô location with good food. We initially had a nice lunch here, but with a few strange twists and turns. Upon arrival we were asked to place our rental bikes out of sight so that their parking space remained free. That was strange in itself because there was more than enough parking space, but soit; they must have a good reason, we thought. After a delicious starter and main course, the staff started to act a bit weird when we wanted dessert after. This was weird, but we got it. When we had finished dessert and asked again for the menu for a drink when choosing a next activity we were presented with the bill and ordered to leave. When we indicated that we meant the drinks menu, the staff suddenly pretended they could no longer speak English while communication was effortless at first, and they aggressively pushed the bill back in our faces. My tablemate wanted to go to the toilet after checkout but this turned out to be no longer possible. All we can think of is that they wanted our table for the group that just came in, but half the tables were still free. As for hospitality, this restaurant actually deserves a big two, but the food was very tasty and the location looked neat so that's why I'm going for four stars anyway.

Our tour guide dropped us here for a pre paid pre booked lunch along side many others people That said the set menu was very tasty and showed off the cuisine very well . Green mango salad was the winner Staff friendly and showed us how to eat some of the dishes Drinks very well priced

This excellent restaurant built in a colonial style serves top class food for a very moderate local price. The service is top class and the owner showed us around his restaurant telling about the many antiques he has collected over the years. We found this restaurant by accident since it was located in the same street as our hotel and we were immediately attracted by the colonial, beautiful style it was built in. The prices of the food were very affordable and a decision was quickly made to have our breakfast then and there and didn't regret it. we also found out from the owner that he owns a second restaurant in Hue City which we visited at night for dinner and deserves a separate review. E. Rouffa A Day.

name: Eco Restaurant
address: 107 Minh Mang Street, Hue 530000 Vietnam
description:
We ate here two nights in a row as the food and service is amazing. Everything we had was fabulous. They kindly tailored the crispy pancakes so I could try this local favourite (I do not eat pork/beef which is tricky in some places in Vietnam). I was so grateful that they did this. All the staff were friendly and welcomed us back the second day. 

The food is also incredibly cheap, our favourite meal for 2 people including beer was less than ¬£10. Give this place a go if you are in the area, you will love it.
cuisines: Chinese Restaurants for Lunch in Hue
example_reviews: We ate here two nights in a row as the food and service is amazing. Everything we had was fabulous. They kindly tailored the crispy pancakes so I could try this local favourite (I do not eat pork/beef which is tricky in some places in Vietnam). I was so grateful that they did this. All the staff were friendly and welcomed us back the second day. The food is also incredibly cheap, our favourite meal for 2 people including beer was less than ¬£10. Give this place a go if you are in the area, you will love it.

We were staying at The Pilgrimage across the road from the Eco Restaurant so decided to go for dinner and support the locals. Ha our host was lovely and we really enjoyed talking with her, her restaurant is beautiful and the food was fresh and very very tasty. Highly recommended. Thank you Ha - Linda & Brett from New Zealand

Family run very friendly owner and staff. All food cooked from freshest ingredients to order - excellent quality at very reasonable prices. Local beer very refreshing. Visited several times as menu varied but very happy to just serve you coffee which was welcome after a walk in the surrounding countryside

name: Pizz.√° Restaurant - Italian Cuisine
address: 34 Chu VƒÉn An 2nd Floors, Hue 530000 Vietnam
description:
Spacious, quiet, clean restaurant/pizzeria on the upper floor of a building on a street that's mostly pedestrian in the evening.
The waitresses and waiters are extremely nice, going above and beyond to make sure you have everything you need.
The food itself... *sigh. I ate here twice in three days. Pizza Margherita first, delicious dough, fresh and tasty ingredients. Then pasta the second time, the vegetable lover spaghetti: the mixed vegetable sauce brought me straight to summer back in Italy, all the flavours were there and just right.
Also appreciated the potato wedges or French fries, as the menu says, and the complimentary (thank you!) miso ice-cream was interesting with that spicy mix on top, and itself fresh and good and a nice texture.
Were I staying longer in Hue, I'd likely return a third time!
cuisines: Sushi Restaurants for Lunch in Hue

Great service amazing pizza. Really nice surroundings and atmosphere. Really good value for money. Would definitely come back to this place again. Oh did I forget to mention the nice and friendly waiters. If there was one thing to comment on it would be the IGers. (People who take photos for instagram or any other) but overall amazing. As a family and individual it was brilliant. My 10 year old daughter thought it was the best pizza place she had ever been to.

As tourists in Hue we spent lovely time in this restaurant and we really enjoyed the pizza here! We really appreciate the relaxed atmosphere and the extremely kind and professional waiters. Si Huy followed us in each step of our dinner: he introduced very well the menu, enhancing the originality of the offer and he took care of us in every part of our pizza experience. We really appreciated the pizza, very tasty and rich in terms of ingredients! A really nice pizza experience in Hue, highly recommended!

name: N. Cafe And Restaurant
address: 08 Tr·∫ßn Huy Li·ªáu, Hue 49000 Vietnam
description:
I read so much about this restaurant that I had to dine there. At the end of my meal, I felt the same as all the reviewers. Overall,  it was an excellent dining experience, and the bonus was the view. I had a table that faced the walls of the Citadel. Everything was good, the food, the beverage and the service. 

I was satisfied with my order. The coconut coffee had just the right amount of ice, unlike some places. The diced chicken, vegetable and rice combination for my main dish was cooked well. The service was prompt and fuss-free. 

The little touches made a huge difference. Before the meal; it was a packet of wet tissue, to wipe my hands I was pleasantly informed. At the end, the same wait staff presented me with a fruit, saying it was dessert. How unexpected and a lovely surprise indeed. 

These touches and everything else make me want to recommend this cafe and restaurant to everyone visiting the Imperial City.
cuisines: Late Night Vietnamese Restaurants in Hue
Chinese Restaurants for Lunch in Hue
